Policy: Presidential Decree No. 175/18 approving the Policy on Diamond Marketing.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Policy on Diamond Marketing. This Policy, consisting of seven Sections, is based on a diamond trading system which makes the legitimate interests of producers compatible with the State's need for standardization, classification, control, certification and taxation of this activity, providing that, in compliance with the principle of effective sovereignty over mineral resources, all the marketing operations must continue to be carried out through a Single Channel, under the Public Marketing Body, whose function is exercised by SODIAM - EP in close collaboration with ENDIAMA - EP and the Kimberley Process Commission and other relevant entities in the Diamond Industry. It focuses in particular on the principles and objectives of the marketing policy for gross diamonds, the single channel for the marketing of rough diamonds, the diamond trading system, commercialization of polished diamonds, which is free in the Angolan market, as well as in ensuring compliance with the standards established by the Kimberley Process Certification System and in the fiscal, customs and exchange regime.

Policy: Décret n°2018-538 définissant le code d’alerte national.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret définit le code d'alerte national, en application de l'article 7 de la loi n° 2017-06 du 31 mars 2017, déterminant les principes fondamentaux de l’organisation de la protection civile Le code d'alerte national fixe les obligations auxquelles sont assujettis les détenteurs de moyens de publication et de diffusion. Il contient les mesures destinées à alerter et informer, en toutes circonstances, la population suit d'une menace ou d'une agression, soit d'un accident, d'un sinistre ou d'une catastrophe. Ces mesures sont mises en œuvre par les détenteurs de tout moyen de communication au public dans, le cadre de l'alerte rapide.

Policy: European Union (Planning and Development) (Environmental Impact Assessment) Regulations 2018 (S.I. No. 296/2018).
Policy_Content: These Regulations extensively amend the Planning and Development Act 2000 and the Planning and Development Regulations 2001 in order to transpose into Irish law the provisions of Directive 2014/52/EU amending Directive 2011/92/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on the assessment of the effects of certain public and private projects on the environment. In the Act of 2000 the definition of ‘environmental impact assessment’ is amended. Amendments generally concern requests, applications, appeals to planning authorities and  to An Bord Pleanála in relation with proposed projects in various fields, including water. A planning authority or the Board, as the case may be, shall, in respect of a development or proposed development specified in Part 2 of Schedule 5 to the Planning and Development Regulations 2001, specify in its declaration or decision, as the case may be, whether the development or proposed development identified in section 5 of Act of 2000 would be likely to have significant effects on the environment by virtue, at the least, of the nature, size or location of such development and require an environmental impact assessment. One of the criteria (listed in Schedule 7 of the Regulations) is the impact on areas classified or protected under legislation, including Natura 2000 areas designated pursuant to the Habitats Directive and the Birds Directive (location of proposed development).
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe l’organisation du ministère des transports, des travaux publics, de l’équipement et de l’aménagement du territoire. Le Ministère des Transports, des Travaux Publics, de l’Equipement et de l’Aménagement du Territoire a pour missions entre autres, de: concevoir et exécuter la politique nationale en matière d'aménagement du territoire, d'urbanisme et de l’habitat, en veillant à la protection et à la conservation des ressources naturelles; élaborer et faire appliquer la réglementation en matière d'aménagement du territoire; élaborer et mettre à jour les schémas directeurs d'aménagement du territoire et de l'urbanisme; mettre en œuvre le Plan Directeur innovant de la ville de Bujumbura et ses alentours, Vision 2045; concevoir et exécuter la politique nationale de l’aménagement, du lotissement et de l’attribution des parcelles; assurer le cadastre national et la sécurisation foncière; élaborer et assurer le suivi des projets d'investissement au Ministère. Pour réaliser ses missions, le Ministère des Transports, des Travaux Publics, de l’Equipement et de l’Aménagement du Territoire dispose des services de l'Administration Centrale et des institutions paraétatiques placées sous l'autorité du Ministre.

Policy: Ley Nº 30831 - Modifica la Ley Nº 29664, que crea el Sistema Nacional de Gestión del Riesgo de Desastres (SINAGERD).
Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica la que crea el Sistema Nacional de Gestión del Riesgo de Desastres (SINAGERD), con el objeto de fortalecer el Sistema Nacional de Gestión del Riesgo de Desastres (SINAGERD), a fin de garantizar la acción permanente y el cumplimiento de la gestión prospectiva, correctiva y reactiva de riesgos de desastres. Se modifica el Artículo 19, sobre los instrumentos del SINAGERD que deben ser establecidos, y en especial respecto al Plan Nacional de Gestión del Riesgo de Desastres, que integra los procesos de estimación, prevención y reducción del riesgo de desastres, preparación, respuesta y rehabilitación, y reconstrucción, y que tiene por objeto establecer las líneas estratégicas, los objetivos, las acciones, procesos y protocolos de carácter plurianual necesarios para concretar lo establecido en la presente Ley. En el diseño del Plan Nacional, se consideran los programas presupuestales estratégicos vinculados a la Gestión del Riesgo de Desastres y otros programas que estuvieran relacionados con su objetivo, y que sirve de marco para la elaboración de los planes específicos por cada proceso y tipo de desastre que deben ser desarrollados anualmente por las entidades públicas en todos los niveles de gobierno.

Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 51 - Modifica el Decreto Legislativo Nº 776, Ley de Protección al Consumidor.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Legislativo, considerando que con los avances tecnológicos y la aparición de nuevas tecnologías son cada vez más los consumidores que hacen uso del comercio electrónico, por lo que se vuelve imperante que se actualice la legislación vigente a fin de incorporar la regulaciones que permitan la efectiva protección de los derechos de dichos consumidores frente a este tipo de comercio, se  modifica la Ley de Protección al Consumidor, con la finalidad de introducir el concepto de comercio electrónico en la legislación especializada en derechos del consumidor, y de establecer obligaciones especiales para los proveedores que ponen a disposición de los consumidores sus productos y servicio a través del comercio electrónico, con el objeto de regular aspectos como la implementación de medidas tecnológicas de seguridad para proteger la información personal y financiera de los consumidores, la reversión de pagos y la disponibilidad de la información clara, completa y veraz sobre los productos y servicios ofrecidos en esta modalidad de comercio.

Policy: Law No. 173 amending Law on normative price and procedure of sale and purchase of land (No.1308-XII of 1997), Law No. 1543- XIII on register of immovable property and Law No. 778-XV on geodesy and cartography.
Policy_Content: Article 3 of Law on normative price and procedure of sale and purchase of land (No.1308-XII of 1997) states that in the absence of the value indicated in the real estate register, the normative price of the land, calculated according to the Law on normative price and procedure of sale and purchase of land (No.1308-XII of 1997) - the cost of the immovable assets shall be determined according to art. 4 par. (5) of the Law no. 1056/2000 for the implementation of Title VI of the Fiscal Code. Article 101 of the Law No. 1543- XIII on register of immovable property shall be amended to add the following wording: “Article 101. Competence of the central authorized body in the field of cadaster. The central cadastral body shall: (a) elaborate, promote and monitor the normative documents and policy documents in the field of cadastre; (b) coordinate the creation and maintenance of the cadastre; (c) establish the procedures for the registration of immovable property and the rights thereon; and (d) perform other tasks related to the cadastre, including the international commitments of the Republic of Moldova in the field of cadaster”. Article 8 of the Law No. 778-XV on geodesy and cartography shall be amended to add the following wording: “Competence of the central authorized body in the field of geodesy, cartography and geoinformatics. The central authorized body responsible for the implementation of state policy in the field of geodesy, cartography and geoinformatics shall: (a) ensure the elaboration and promotion of the unified policy in the aforesaid field; (b) elaborate and examine, as well as, as the case may be, approve, according to the law, the normative acts in the aforesaid field; and (c) accomplish international collaboration in the field”.

Policy: Law No.34 of 2018 promulgating the Public Health Law.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 131 articles divided in XXVII Parts aims at defining the tasks of the concerned department in order to protect the public health. It establishes that the competent department, in cooperation with the concerned administrative body, shall undertake the following (i) implementation, follow-up and evaluation of preventive health policies and procedures, with the aim of preventing and controlling the spread of diseases; (ii) development of health awareness and education programs and activities; (iii) proposing instructions, standards, health requirements and regulations on which ministerial circulars or decisions should be issued; (iv) issuing work permits for shops and professions subject to the supervision of the competent department; (v) periodic field studies and research to monitor and respond to diseases; and (vi) monitoring and implementation of health requirements for public health as determined by the Minister.

Policy: Law No. 18/2018 on the ecological production and the quality regime of agricultural and food products.
Policy_Content: The objectives of this Law, consisting of 44 articles divided into six Chapters, are to perform the following activities: 1. Establish the bases for the sustainable development of products from agriculture, including aquaculture, and subsequent processing to be marketed for consumption. 2. Regulate the origin and quality labels of agri-food products. 3. Provide agri-food producers with the right tools to inform buyers and consumers of the unique characteristics and qualities of their products. 4. Contribute to guarantee fair competition for farmers and producers in the agri-food sector. 5. Contribute to guarantee the protection of legitimate rights and interests of producers, buyers and consumers, including access to reliable information about products and respect for intellectual property rights. 6. Regulate the inspection, control and sanctioning regime. This Law applies to all actions carried out in Andorran territory, in the field of organic production and in relation to the origin and quality certificates of agricultural and food products.

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 350 - Estrategia Forestal de El Salvador.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo aprueba la Estrategia Forestal de El Salvador (EFES), que tiene como objetivo articular las iniciativas, recursos y necesidades de todos los actores del sector forestal, en un instrumento de gestión nacional de largo plazo, para posicionar y convertir el sector en un factor clave de desarrollo sostenible en los aspectos económico, social y ambiental del país. La Estrategia Forestal de El Salvador se basa en una visión de un sector forestal articulado y competitivo, en un entorno de mercado, que contribuya al bienestar social, cultural, ambiental y económico del país, orientada a diseñar, promover e implementar iniciativas públicas y privadas, orientadas a valorar, fortalecer y dinamizar el desarrollo forestal, en un contexto institucional articulado y eficiente con mecanismos financieros y legales adecuados, sobre la base del ordenamiento y manejo sostenible de los bienes y servicios provenientes del sector forestal.

Policy: Decree № 151 of 25 July 2018 on the adoption of the Rules of procedure of the Agricultural Academy.
Policy_Content: This Decree, based on the provisions of the Law on the Agricultural Academy, defines the structure, the organization and the activity of the Agricultural Academy. The Academy is a national autonomous budget organization under the Minister of Agriculture, Food and Forestry for scientific research, for scientific-applied, innovative and educational activity in the field of agriculture and food. The Academy carries out its activity within the framework of the state agrarian policy and the common agricultural policy of the European Union, as: 1. organize and carry out scientific and applied research, innovative and implementation activities and related activities in the field of the agricultural sector and food on the basis of a developed strategy; 2. develop in coordination with the Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Forestry (MAF) and with the Ministry of Education and Science strategies for development of science and education in the agricultural sector; 3. perform activities assigned by the Ministry of Agriculture and Food, the Ministry of Environment and Water, other departments and agencies, local and regional authorities with scientific expertise in the field of: protection and rational use of soils, water basins and fish resources; ecology and environmental protection; crop and livestock production; fisheries and aquaculture; food and food industry; agrarian economy, etc.; 4. participate in the elaboration of normative acts, forecasts, programs, projects and strategies for realization of the agrarian policy in the field of the agrarian sector and the food industry on national and regional scale; 5. create, collect, process and store scientific data in the field of the agricultural sector and food and provide them for use by the society; 6. carry out expert, consulting and design activity on projects and programs in the field of the agricultural sector and the foods of national, regional and international importance; 7. conducts procedures under the Law on Academic Affairs of the Republic of Bulgaria, as well as for the election of academics (full members) and corresponding members of the Academy; 8. carry out training of doctoral students, postgraduates and raising the qualification of persons who are employed in the field of the agrarian sector and the food; 9. carry out information and publishing activities and popularize the results of scientific research; 10. cooperate with research, educational and other organizations in the country and abroad, be a member and participate in the activities of national and international scientific organizations; 11. preserve, maintains and develops genetic resources in the field of the agricultural sector as an invaluable national wealth, which is a guarantor of national security and the prosperity of society; 12. concludes contracts with agricultural producers and other economic entities for implementation of the scientific developments of the Academy, for the scientific service, performance of analyzes and expertises, development of projects, consultations and other services provided by the Academy; 13. perform scientific-applied, applied and experimental-production activity and realize the production from this activity, as well as the products and the rights - object of intellectual property; 14. perform other activities related to the scientific research conducted by it, the application of the scientific results and the accompanying activities.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Black Sea, Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This text entered into force on the first day of the month following the month of its publication in the Official Gazette (published on 31 July 2018).

Policy: Arrêté n°0622 du 24 Juillet 2018 portant création d’une Cellule Nationale d’Observation Environnementale et des Zones Arides et semi arides.
Policy_Content: Il est créé, avec le premier titre de cet arrêté, qui se compose de cinq titres, une cellule dite Cellule Nationale de l’Observation Environnementale et des zones arides et semi arides (CNOEZA), au sein du Ministère de l’Environnement et du Développement Durable, dirigée par un coordinateur. Le deuxième titre définit la mission de la cellule qui couvre un numéro d'activités, entre autres l'analyse et la diffusion des informations et données techniques et scientifiques relatives aux zones arides et semi-arides; l'étude des dynamiques et des équilibres écologiques et écosytémiques qui s'opèrent dans les milieux arides et semi-arides; la contribution à la promotion et à l'utilisation des énergies renouvelables dans les zones arides et semi-arides;la promotion de l'écotourisme; la participation aux efforts de développement communautaire et local dans les zones arides et semi-arides. Le troisième titre est dédié à la description du fonctionnement et de la composition de la cellule, qui comprend outre de son coordinateur, d’un secrétariat et des trois unités thématiques et scientifiques : l'unité de Gestion des connaissances, l’unité de l’Observation Ecologique et l’unité de l’intervention en zones arides et semi-arides (UIZA). Le quatrième titre s'occupe des ressources financière qui soutinnent les activités de la cellule et de ses dépenses. Suivent les dispositions finales (titre cinquième).

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto establecer los principios que rigen las relaciones entre los órganos, organismos de la Administración Central del Estado, las entidades nacionales, y las administraciones locales del Poder Popular. El Decreto se aplica a los órganos, organismos de la Administración Central del Estado, a las entidades nacionales y a las administraciones locales del Poder Popular. Policy: Ley Nº 9593 - Ley de acceso a la justicia de los pueblos indígenas de Costa Rica.
Policy_Content: El presente Ley de acceso a la justicia de los pueblos indígenas de Costa Rica, establece el acceso a la justicia con apego a la realidad cultural de los pueblos indígenas, y dispone que el Estado costarricense deberá garantizar el acceso a la justicia a la población indígena tomando en consideración sus condiciones étnicas, socioeconómicas y culturales, tomando en consideración el derecho indígena siempre y cuando no transgreda los derechos humanos, así como tomando en cuenta su cosmovisión. El sistema de administración de justicia dará prioridad al trámite y a la resolución de los casos en que figuran personas indígenas como parte. El juez deberá solicitar peritajes culturales en aquellos procesos judiciales que requieran un peritaje especial de las costumbres, las tradiciones y los conceptos normativos de los pueblos indígenas.
Subject: General

Policy: Law implementing the EIA Amendment Directive
Policy_Content: Bavaria’s law implementing the EIA Amendment Directive seeks to amend various Bavarian legislative texts to ensure compliance with European Union Directive 2014/52/EU. The Bavarian Administrative Procedure Act (Verwaltungsverfahrensgesetz) is thereby amended to include an article on environmental impact assessments (Art. 78a). The Bavarian Nature Conservation Act (Naturschutzgesetz) is amended by changes in wording of Article 23, par. 6, sentence 1. The law on the responsibilities in state development and in environmental issues (Gesetz über die Zuständigkeiten in der Landesentwicklung und in den Umweltfragen) is amended to clarify the competences of the Bavarian Environmental Ministry. Amendments to several articles in the jurisdiction Regulation (Zuständigkeitsverordnung) are made, which include the addition of provisions on the washing and cleaning agent law (Wasch-und Reinigungsmittelgesetz), on the Environmental damage law (Umweltschadensgesetz), and the Environmental Appeals Act (Umwelt-Rechtsbehelfsgesetz). The cableway regulation (Seilbahnverordnung) and IPPC Sewage Regulation (IVU-Abwasser Verordnung) are amended by changes in wording of arts. 78a sentence 1 for the cableway regulation and § 1, 5, and 6 for the IPPC Sewage Regulation respectively.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea la Unidad de Fideicomiso y Seguimiento a Inversiones (UFISI) del Ministro de Ambiente, con el fin de reforzar la labor que realiza el Ministerio de Ambiente en instruir y remitir el o los procesos previamente sustanciados para que se efectúen los pagos conforme a los requisitos del proceso de adquisiciones (compras y contrataciones). Policy: Agricultural Free Patent Reform Act (Republic Act No. 11231).
Policy_Content: This Act aims at removing the Restrictions Imposed on the Registration, Acquisition, Encumbrance, Alienation, Transfer and Conveyance of Land Covered By Free Patents. It establishes that Agricultural public lands alienated or disposed in favour of qualified public land applicants under Section 44 of Commonwealth Act No. 141, as amended, shall not be subject to restrictions imposed under Sections 118, 119 and 121 regarding acquisitions, encumbrances, conveyances, transfers, or dispositions. Agricultural free patent shall not be subject to any restriction on encumbrance or alienation. These provisions shall have retroactive effect and any restriction regarding acquisitions, encumbrances, conveyances, transfers, or dispositions imposed on agricultural free patents issued under Section 44 of Commonwealth Act No. 141, shall be removed, provided, that nothing in this Act affects the right under Section 119 of Commonwealth Act No. 141, as amended.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 171/18 approving the Forestry Regulation.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approving the Forestry Regulation. This Regulation, consisting of 176 articles divided into fourteen Chapters and nine Annexes, regulates the sustainable management of forestry resources and their ecosystems. It aims to establish standards for their conservation and wise use taking into account the environmental, social, economic and cultural dimension of these resources and applies to forests and protecting activities, conservation, research, utilization, exploitation, afforestation and reforestation, commercialization, transport and primary processing of forestry resources, which regulates the rights to these resources, their sustainable exploitation, exploitation under a concession contract and annual licenses, forest clearing and deforestation, afforestation and reforestation, fire prevention and fire fighting, forest research, possession, transit, trade and statistics of forest products, certification, exploitation fees and other charges, supervision and infractions, etc.

Policy: Executive Order No. 58, s. 2018 approving the Merger of the Home Guaranty Corporation and the Philippine Export-Import Credit Agency (Philexim), Transferring the Guarantee Functions, Programs and Funds of the Small Business Corporation, and the Administration of the Agricultural Guarantee Fund Pool and the Industrial Guarantee and Loan Fund to the Philexim, and Renaming the Philexim as the Philippine Guarantee Corporation.
Policy_Content: This Executive Order approves the Merger of the Home Guaranty Corporation and the Philippine Export-Import Credit Agency (Philexim), Transferring the Guarantee Functions, Programs and Funds of the Small Business Corporation, and the Administration of the Agricultural Guarantee Fund Pool and the Industrial Guarantee and Loan Fund to the Philexim, and Renaming the Philexim as the Philippine Guarantee Corporation. The HGC shall be merged with the PhilEXIM, including all its guarantee functions, programs, personnel, assets and liabilities. The PhilEXIM aiming at the agricultural and market development shall be the surviving entity in the merger. Moreover, all the guarantee-related functions, programs, funds, assets and liabilities of the SBC shall be transferred to the PhilEXIM.

Policy: National Green Energy Fund Act No. 10 of 2018.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down rules to support projects and activities aimed to achieve the objectives of the National Energy Road Map in providing accessible, affordable, secure and reliable and sustainable energy and green growth, and to provide financial support and technical assistance to extend the access to electricity for users of renewable energy sources and facilitate more efficient end-use of energy. To this end, this Act sets forth provisions on the establishment of the National Green Energy Fund and the establishment, functions, composition and powers of the National Green Energy Fund Board. The Board shall be responsible for the efficient and proper management and control of the Fund. Moreover, the Board may establish other committees for assistance to carry out its functions under this Act.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 017-2018-EM ─ Mecanismo de racionamiento para el abastecimiento de gas natural al mercado interno ante una declaratoria de emergencia.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo tiene por objeto establecer el Mecanismo de Racionamiento ante situaciones que afecten y pongan en Emergencia el abastecimiento de gas natural en el país. Para efecto de la presente norma, entiéndase como Emergencia el desabastecimiento total o parcial de gas natural en el mercado interno por cualquier situación que afecte el suministro y/o transporte y/o distribución de gas natural, debidamente calificada como tal por el Ministerio de Energía y Minas mediante Resolución Ministerial. La presente norma es de cumplimiento obligatorio por los Productores, los Concesionarios de Transporte de Gas Natural por Ductos, los Concesionarios de Transporte de Líquidos de Gas Natural por Ductos, los Concesionarios de Distribución de Gas Natural por Red de Ductos, los operadores de Plantas de Licuefacción, el Comité de Operación Económica del Sistema Eléctrico Interconectado Nacional (COES) y los Consumidores de Gas Natural.

Se declara de interés nacional la promoción de la inversión privada mediante Asociaciones Público Privadas y Proyectos en Activos para contribuir al crecimiento de la economía nacional, al cierre de brechas en infraestructura o en servicios públicos, a la generación de empleo productivo y a la competitividad del país. El rol del Estado incluye las labores de seguimiento y la realización de acciones para facilitar la ejecución oportuna de los proyectos desarrollados bajo las modalidades reguladas en el presente Decreto Legislativo, de acuerdo con los principios que establece.

Policy: Décret n°100/081 du 20 juillet 2018 portant missions, organisation et fonctionnement du ministère des finances, du budget et de la coopération au développement économique.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les missions, l’organisation et le fonctionnement du ministère des finances, du budget et de la coopération au développement économique. Le Ministère des Finances, du Budget et de la Coopération au Développement Economique a pour missions de: concevoir et exécuter la politique financière et monétaire du Gouvernement; participer à l’élaboration, en collaboration avec les ministères sectoriels, de la stratégie de réduction de la pauvreté et en assurer le suivi; participer, en étroite collaboration avec· les ministères sectoriels, à la Programmation et assurer le suivi physique et l'évaluation d'Investissement Publics (PIP) et les Programmes des Dépenses Publiques (PDP); préparer les Programmes d'Investissement Publics (PIP) et les Programmes des Dépenses Publiques (PDP); coordonner l’élaboration du Cadre des Dépenses à Moyen Terme (CDMT) dans les ministères; préparer, en collaboration avec les ministères intéressés, les programmes de coopération économique et financière avec les partenaires au développement tant au niveau bilatéral que multilatéral; préparer les Programmes de Coopération Technique (PCT) et en assurer la coordination, le suivi et l’évaluation; participer à la promotion du secteur privé; contribuer, par une saine gestion des finances publiques, au développement économique et social; préparer le budget général de l'Etat et en assurer l’exécution; assurer la mission d'ordonnateur de l’ensemble des dépenses de l'Etat; assurer l’équilibre financier interne et externe du pays et en particulier promouvoir l’épargne; superviser l'ensemble des activités engageant financièrement l'Etat; prendre toutes les mesures visant la sauvegarde du patrimoine de l'Etat; représenter et défendre les intérêts du Burundi en matière économique au niveau international; promouvoir les relations économiques et financières avec les partenaires au développement; préparer et négocier les programmes de coopération économique avec les partenaires bilatéraux et multilatéraux, afin de favoriser le progrès économique et social du pays; promouvoir, de concert avec les ministères techniques concernés, le développement des relations économiques et commerciales entre le Burundi et les autres pays afin de promouvoir l’économie nationale; proposer la mise à jour de la politique des reformes des sociétés à participation publique; élaborer la planification du développement du pays à court, moyen et long terme; assurer le suivi de la mise en œuvre de la stratégie de réduction de la pauvreté; adapter les politiques sectorielles au Plan National de Développement; mener les études prospectives, en collaboration avec les instances habilitées, pour aboutir à une vision stratégique nationale de développement à court, moyen et long terme; assurer en permanence la fonction de prévision et de cadrage macroéconomique ainsi que l'anticipation de l'impact des politiques économiques; concevoir, coordonner et évaluer l’exécution du Plan National de Développement; participer à la conception d'une politique nationale de la population; faire la promotion de l'investissement étranger au Burundi; élaborer et assurer le suivi des projets d'investissement du ministère.

Policy: Executive Decree No. 269/18 approving the Regulation of the Advisory Council of the Ministry of Mineral Resources and Petroleum.
Policy_Content: This Executive Decree approves the Regulation of the Advisory Council of the Ministry of Mineral Resources and Petroleum. This Regulation, consisting of 11 articles divided into three Chapters, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Advisory Council. The Advisory Council is responsible for: assessing the performance of the Ministry and the Mineral Resources and Petroleum Resources Sector, as well as proposing development policies and strategies on the following areas: a) Treatment of rocks and minerals; b) Transport, storage, distribution and commercialization of rocks, minerals, crude petroleum and its derivatives; e) Social responsibility; d) Licensing for distribution and trade of rocks, minerals, petroleum derivatives and biofuels; e) Exploration and exploitation of mineral resources; j) Supervision and control of geological, mining and oil activities; g) Allocation of exploration licenses and petroleum concessions; h) National, regional or multilateral matters for the development of activities in the Mineral Resources and Petroleum Sector; i) Perspectives and programmes of the Mineral Resources and Petroleum Sector, with a view to the sustainable, balanced and fair development of the economy; l) Refining of crude oil, treatment of natural gas and petrochemicals; k) international cooperation in the geological, mining, oil and biofuel sectors; etc.

Policy: Décret n°100/083 du 20 juillet 2018 portant organisation du ministère de la sécurité publique et de la gestion des catastrophes.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe l’organisation du ministère de la sécurité publique et de la gestion des catastrophes. Le Ministère de la Sécurité Publique et de la Gestion des Catastrophes a pour missions de: concevoir et exécuter la politique du Gouvernement en matière de sécurité publique et de gestion des catastrophes; assurer l’ordre public et la sécurité intérieure du territoire en collaboration avec les autres services concernés; assurer la protection civile notamment par la prévention et le secours public en cas de risque naturel ou autre cataclysme; coordonner et superviser le processus de désarmement de la population civile; assurer le suivi de la gestion du registre national des armes; coordonner et superviser le programme de lutte contre la prolifération des armes légères et de petit calibre; veiller, en collaboration avec les ministères concernés, à la sécurité sur les frontières; assurer le contrôle des mouvements de la population et des étrangers sur le territoire national, en collaboration avec les services concernés; assurer la délivrance et la gestion de tous les documents de voyage pour les nationaux et de séjour pour les étrangers; veiller, en collaboration avec les autres services concernés, à la gestion des fichiers des étrangers et des demandes d'asile; veiller, en collaboration avec les autres ministères concernés, à la gestion des fichiers des réfugiés et des apatrides; assurer l’organisation et la formation tant technique que morale du personnel du Ministère de la Sécurité Publique et de la Gestion des Catastrophes, concevoir et exécuter la politique nationale en matière de prévention et de gestion des catastrophes en collaboration avec les autres services concernés; coordonner et centraliser les statistiques de la sécurité publique et de la gestion des catastrophes et en assurer l’archivage; élaborer et assurer le suivi et le respect de la politique nationale en matière de surveillance et de gardiennage privés; veiller au respect des valeurs fondamentales et renforcer l’esprit de tolérance, de respect des droits de la personne humaine et de neutralité politique au sein de la Police Nationale; veiller à assurer aux corps de police des capacités nécessaires à l’accomplissement de leurs missions; doter la Police Nationale du Burundi et les autres structures du Ministère des capacités nécessaires à l’accomplissement de leurs missions.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Spatial Planning, Architecture and Construction Code of Georgia (No. 3213-RS of 2018)
Policy_Content: The Code provides for spatial and urban planning in Georgia, its main principles, goals and purposes, hierarchy of spatial and urban plans and their content, and rules for drafting and approving them; rules for using plots of land for construction and main requirements imposed on buildings; issuing building permits, supervision of construction and state compliance and liability for the violations of law. The purposes of the Code, among others, include regulation of use and development of the territory of Georgia by balancing public and private interests; creating decent environment for human life and activity, protection of human health, environment, natural resources and cultural heritage; public participation in the spatial and urban planning; and ensuring urban development that is safe for human health and life.

Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 1358 - Modifica la Ley Nº 29151, Ley general del Sistema Nacional de Bienes Estatales.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Legislativo modifica la Ley que crea el Sistema Nacional de Bienes Estatales, con la finalidad de optimizar la regulación del saneamiento físico legal de los inmuebles estatales destinados a servicios públicos y otros usos del Estado y dictar medidas que faciliten el otorgamiento de derechos para la inversión pública y privada. Se propone optimizar el marco institucional y los procesos para la obtención y saneamiento de predios requeridos para la ejecución de proyectos de inversión, que permitan el cierre de brechas de infraestructura y el cumplimiento oportuno de las obligaciones contractuales a cargo del Estado peruano, así como el desarrollo del catastro urbano y facilitar el saneamiento físico-legal de inmuebles destinados a servicios u otros usos por el Estado, de los bienes inmuebles patrimoniales, sin afectar los derechos de las comunidades campesinas y comunidades nativas.

Policy: Access to Information Act, 2018 (No. 4 of 2018).
Policy_Content: This Act requires every public body to create, keep, organise and maintain its information in a manner that facilitates access to information, as provided in this Act. It also imposes a requirement of proactive disclosure and annual publication of specified information. Proactive disclosure shall be done for, among other things, reports containing the results of surveys, environmental impact assessment reports prepared by the public body. Each public body shall, within its organization, designate an Information Officer. The Act sets out the procedures relating to request for and granting access to information and establishes the Information Commission.

Policy: Law No. 139 “On energy efficiency”.
Policy_Content: This Law implements Directive 2012/27/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on energy efficiency and Directive 2009/125/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing a framework for the setting of ecodesign requirements for energy-related products. The purpose of this Law shall be to create the legal framework necessary to promote and improve energy efficiency through the implementation of energy efficiency action plans, the development of the energy services market, and the introduction of other energy efficiency measures. It regulates activities aimed at increasing the efficiency of both production and use of energy, improving the country's energy security and reducing the negative impact of the energy sector on the environment by reducing greenhouse gas emissions. This Law consists of VIII Section. Section I lays down the general provisions. Section II sets national objectives and policy measures in the field of energy efficiency. Section III establishes administrative competence. Section IV regards energy efficiency in the process of energy use. Section V deals with energy auditing and energy services. Section VI regards energy efficiency in the field of energy supply. Section VII establishes liability for breach of energy efficiency legislation. Section VIII lays down final and transitional provisions. The main principles of the field of energy efficiency shall be as follows: (a) promoting energy efficiency, in particular by supporting energy efficiency programs that include the introduction of advanced energy technologies such as cogeneration and trigeneration, the distribution, transfer and use of energy and fuel, through the adoption of international energy efficiency standards for installations, buildings, devices and equipment, as well as monitoring the application of these standards; (b) promoting private initiative and encouraging the emergence of new energy service providers; (c) supporting cooperation between energy market participants in view of the achievement of the objectives of the state policy in the field of energy efficiency; (d)  ensuring transparency in the activities of public authorities and public institutions with powers in the field of energy efficiency; (e) training of officials on the implementation of energy efficiency measures; (f) the creation of the necessary prerequisites for the development of technical capabilities for the provision of energy services, including energy audits and energy management, through the organization of training courses and the introduction of qualification and registration schemes; (g) public awareness of public policies on energy efficiency; (h) engaging civil society and its involvement in decision-making and implementation of energy efficiency measures; and (i) cooperation with other countries, including within the framework of international organizations, in order to promote advanced technologies, the introduction of scientific achievements and best practices in the field of energy efficiency. The state policy in the field of energy efficiency is an integral part of the energy policy of the state and is aimed at achieving the following objectives: (a) removing barriers to promoting energy efficiency; (b) introduction and promotion of technologies with increased energy efficiency, modern control and measurement systems; (c) application of modern principles of energy management; (d) encouraging end-users to use energy-efficient equipment and facilities, as well as renewable energy sources; (e) promoting energy efficiency and financial instruments for energy saving, providing financial and tax benefits in accordance with the law; (f) mobilization of investments in renovation of buildings; (g) cooperation between end-users, producers, suppliers, distribution system operators, public authorities and public institutions; (h) development of the energy services market; (i) educating end-users and increasing their awareness of the importance and benefits of applying energy efficiency measures; and (j) promotion of fundamental and applied research in the field of energy efficiency.

Policy: Renewables Obligation (Amendment) Order 2018 (S.I. No. 896 of 2018).
Policy_Content: This Order amends the Renewables Obligation Order 2015 to provide for an annual renewables obligation certificates (“ROCs”) cap and makes other minor amendments. A new Schedule 6 introduces caps relevant to the number of ROCs that can be issued in respect of “relevant electricity” generated by certain types of generating station during each obligation period. Relevant electricity is electricity that has been generated in certain ways described in paragraph 1 of new Schedule 6 (using either biomass or bioliquid as fuel). New Schedule 6 also defines two types of generating station (“capped” and “mixed”) and two new types of combustion unit which a generating station may comprise (“capped” and “exempt”).

Policy_Content: La presente Decisión tiene por objeto establecer los lineamientos para la elaboración, adopción y aplicación de reglamentos técnicos y los procedimientos de evaluación de la conformidad al interior de los Países Miembros y a nivel comunitario, a fin de evitar que éstos se constituyan en obstáculos técnicos innecesarios al comercio. Las disposiciones de la presente Decisión son aplicables a la elaboración, adopción y aplicación de reglamentos técnicos y procedimientos de evaluación de la conformidad, exceptuando a las medidas sanitarias y fitosanitarias u otras reguladas por una Decisión específica.

Policy: Loi du 18 juillet 2018 concernant la protection de la nature et des ressources naturelles
Policy_Content: La présente loi concerne la protection de la nature et des ressources naturelles. La loi a pour objectifs: la sauvegarde du caractère, de la diversité et de l’intégrité de l’environnement naturel; la protection et la restauration des paysages et des espaces naturels; la protection et la restauration des biotopes, des espèces et de leurs habitats, ainsi que des écosystèmes; le maintien et l’amélioration des équilibres et de la diversité biologiques; la protection des ressources naturelles contre toutes dégradations; le maintien et la restauration des services écosystémiques; et l’amélioration des structures de l’environnement naturel. En complément des mesures générales de conservation du paysage et de protection des espèces et biotopes, un réseau de zones protégées est constitué en vue d’atteindre les objectifs de la présente loi. Il distingue des zones protégées d’intérêt communautaire appelées zone Natura 2000 et des zones protégées d’intérêt national. La présente loi énonce que sans préjudice de l’autorisation du ministre ayant dans ses attributions la Gestion de l’eau, l’autorisation du ministre est requise pour tous travaux de drainage, de curage de fossés et de cours d’eau, et plus généralement pour tous les travaux en relation avec l’eau, susceptibles d’avoir une influence préjudiciable sur les espèces sauvages et leurs habitats. L’autorisation du ministre est également requise pour la création et la modification d’étangs ou autres plans d’eau en zone verte. En outre, tout changement d'affectation de fonds forestiers est interdit, à moins que le ministre ne l'autorise dans un but d’utilité publique ou en vue de la restructuration du parcellaire agricole permettant une amélioration de l’exploitation concernée

Policy: Regulation (EU) 2018/1091 of the European Parliament and of the Council on integrated farm statistics and repealing Regulations (EC) No. 1166/2008 and (EU) No. 1337/2011.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes a framework for European statistics at the level of agricultural holdings and provides for the integration of information on the structure with that on production methods, rural development measures, agro-environmental aspects and other related information. The objective is to continue the implementation of the programme of European surveys on the structure of agricultural holdings in order to examine the trends in the structure of agricultural holdings at the Union level and to provide the statistical knowledge base necessary for the design, implementation, monitoring, evaluation and review of related policies, in particular the common agricultural policy (CAP), including rural development measures, as well as environmental, climate change adaptation and mitigation and land use policies of the Union and some Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

Policy: Décret n° 2018/6026/PM du 17 juillet 2018 portant création, organisation et fonctionnement du comité de suivi de la mise en œuvre de l'initiative pour la transparence dans les industries extractives.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée auprès du Ministre chargé des finances un Comité de suivi de la mise en couvre de l’Initiative pour la Transparence dans les Industries Extractives (Comité ITIE). Le Comité ITIE est un organe qui vise à promouvoir la bonne gouvernance, la transparence et la redevabilité dans la gestion des ressources naturelles au bénéfice de tous les citoyens. A cet effet, il supervise la mise en œuvre au Cameroun de la Norme ITIE dans le respect des lois et règlements en vigueur. A ce titre, il est notamment chargé de: adopter et d'exécuter le plan de travail pour la mise en œuvre de l'ITIE au Cameroun; identifier les obstacles à la mise en œuvre de la Norme ITIE et de proposer au Gouvernement des mesures correctives ; encourager l'intégration de la transparence dans les administrations, les entités publiques et privées intervenant dans le secteur extractif au moyen de la déclaration et de la diffusion systématique des données ITIE produites; superviser les déclarations ITIE des entreprises et de veiller, au moins une fois par an , à la confection par cabinet spécialisé indépendant, dit administrateur Indépendant ITIE », d'un rapport de conciliation des quantités extraites et des paiements effectués par les industries extractives au profit de l 'Etat, ainsi que des sommes effectivement enregistrées dans la comptabilité de l’Etat, sur la base des comptes audites des entités susmentionnées; approuver et de diffuser ledit rapport de conciliation; assurer la publication, sur le site internet du Comite et sur tout autre support médiatique, des informations sur les paiements et les recettes perçues par l'Etat et payées par les industries extractives, y compris les rapports de « l’Administrateur Indépendant ITIE »; rechercher pour le compte du Gouvernement, l’assistance technique et financière internationale nécessaire pour la mise en œuvre efficace et durable de l'ITIE; veiller à la représentation du Cameroun aux rencontres internationales sur l’ITIE par la (ou les) personne (s) compétentes ; élaborer, d’adopter et de publier le rapport annuel de ses activités. Les membres du Comité ITIE sont issus des ministères, de l’Assemblée nationales et sénat, des collectivités territoriales, du secteur privé, des Organisations de la Société Civile (OSC).

Policy: Isiolo County Climate Fund Act, 2018 (No. 3 of 2018 ).
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to create a fund in the County for the purpose of facilitating establishment of a mechanism to finance climate change activities, programs and projects in the County through; initiating and coordinating financing of Climate Change Adaption and Mitigation activities at the community level in the County; enhancing Climate Finance mechanisms in the County; facilitating community initiated Climate Change Adaption and Mitigation activities within the County, taking into consideration the gender perspective, among others. Essentially, the Act establishes the fund, provides for its administration, and sources and disbursement of funds. The Act also establishes the Isiolo County Climate Change Fund Planning Committee. It shall, among other things, develop projects eligibility criteria under this Act and receive, compile, evaluate and approve the projects submitted by Ward Planning Committees (established under this Act) based on the agreed criteria, and prepare the County Climate Finance Budget. There shall be a Climate Finance Framework for the County every three years.

Policy: Microlending Act, 2018 (No. 7 of 2018).
Policy_Content: This Act provides rules for the bussines of microlending, i.e. the business of advancing loans to borrowers in terms of microlending transactions (defined) as a regular feature. The objects of this Act are to - (a) foster - (i) the highest standards of business conduct by microlenders; (ii) fairness, efficiency, transparency and orderliness of the microlending industry; (iii) the protection of borrowers and the promotion of responsible borrowing and lending; (iv) the promotion of public awareness and understanding of the microlending industry; and (v) the reduction and deterrence of financial crime; (b) regulate and supervise the microlenders as provided for in this Act; and (c) ensure that microlenders comply with the relevant provisions of the Usury Act. A person needs to be registered with the Namibia Financial Institutions Supervisory Authority (NAMFISA) in order to legally conduct the business of a microlender. The Act provides rules for the conduct of business and defines rights and obligations of borrowers. It also provides for supervision by NAMFISA.

Policy: Law No. 5.235 creating the State Policy for the Preservation of Environmental Services, the State Programme for Payment for Environmental Services (PESA) and a Programme Management System.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 24 articles divided into four Chapters, creates the State Policy for the Preservation of Environmental Services, the State Programme for Payment for Environmental Services (PESA) as well as a Programme Management System. This Law defines the concepts, objectives, guidelines and actions of the above mentioned matters. The State Programme aims to regulate and strengthen the performance of environmental services, in order to promote sustainable development, environmental conservation and to encourage the provisions and maintenance of these services in all territory state. The State Programme for Payment for Environmental Services, linked to the State Policy on Climate Change (PEMC), has the following objectives: protect the natural ecosystems of the State of Mato Grosso do Sul, providing for the maintenance of environmental services while promoting its socioeconomic development; reduce the deforestation of Cerrado, Atlantic Forest and Pantanal biomes in the State and, consequently, minimize the emission of greenhouse gases and maintain the forest carbon stock; protect and stimulate the sustainable use of water resources, maintaining their quality, processes and ecological functions for present and future generations; strengthen governance structures that allow mutual recognition at national and international levels of programmes to maintain environmental services; create management tools for environmental services; adopt systems for environmental products and services; stimulate the development of science, technology and innovation to ensure the sustainability of the genetic heritage of the natural environments of the State of Mato Grosso do Sul.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 328 validating the Regulation on the procedure for providing information in the field of hydrometeorology and monitoring of environmental pollution by an authorized state body in the field of hydrometeorology.
Policy_Content: This Regulation defines the procedure for the provision by the authorized state body in the field of hydrometeorology of hydrological, meteorological, agrometeorological information and performance of special-purpose works carried out on orders (requests) of state bodies. It classifies information related to environmental pollution as follows: (a) operational and prognostic; (b) reference information; (c) climatic information; (d) general information; and (e) specialized information. Information in the field of hydrometeorology and monitoring of environmental pollution of general use: weather forecast, emergency (storm) information, information on air pollution, surface water pollution, is provided to users (consumers) free of charge. The provision of information on request may be denied for the following reasons: (a) the requested information is contained in the parts of the documents that, in accordance with the legislation, are classified as information with limited access; and (b) the request was made in violation of the requirements provided for by the Law of the Kyrgyz Republic "On access to information under the authority of state bodies and local self-government bodies of the Kyrgyz Republic".

Policy: Law No. 7/2018 establishing the Basic Law on maritime areas management.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 13 articles establishes the general principles and framework for the management of the maritime areas of the Macao Special Administrative Region (MSAR), including the bases of the legal regime for the management of maritime areas and the institutional framework between the coordinating body and the competent authorities. The objectives of the maritime areas management are: 1) Ensure that the exploration and exploitation of these areas is consistent with the general national interest and the long-term development interests of the MSAR; 2) Promote economic sustainable development; 3) Protect the ecological environment of marine areas; 4) Strengthen the capacity to prevent and minimize marine disaster impacts; 5) Increase the quality and efficiency of exploration and exploitation of maritime areas; 6) Promote the development of the maritime economy.

Policy: Resolution of the Council of Ministers No. 115/2018 establishing a new strategic orientation for forestry management.
Policy_Content: This Resolution of the Council of Ministers establishes to implement a new strategic orientation for forestry management based on the following objectives: a) reduce the average number of fire lighting and annual burned area; b) reduce the vulnerability of forestry areas to harmful biotic agents; c) recover and rehabilitate affected forest ecosystems; d) ensure that the areas most susceptible to desertification and erosion are managed in accordance with the appropriate technical standards; e) ensure the conservation of habitats and species of protected fauna and flora; f) increase the contribution of forests to climate change mitigation; g) promote active and professional forestry management; h) modernize and train forest enterprises; i) promote new products and markets through modernization and training of forestry companies; redefine the territory of the Regional Forestry Programmes (PROF) through the approval of specific programmes.

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 864/2018 - Desarrolla la estructura orgánica básica del Ministerio para la Transición Ecológica.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto desarrolla la estructura orgánica básica del Ministerio para la Transición Ecológica, que es el departamento competente en el ámbito de la Administración General del Estado para la propuesta y ejecución de la política del Gobierno en materia de lucha contra el cambio climático, protección del patrimonio natural, de la biodiversidad y del mar, agua, y energía para la transición a un modelo productivo y social más ecológico. Corresponde al Ministerio para la Transición Ecológica, la elaboración de la legislación estatal en materia de aguas y costas, medio ambiente, meteorología y climatología; la gestión directa del dominio público hidráulico, del dominio público marítimo-terrestre; la representación del Estado en los organismos internacionales correspondientes a estas materias, sin perjuicio de las competencias del Ministerio de Asuntos Exteriores, Unión Europea y Cooperación; así como la coordinación de actuaciones, la cooperación y la concertación en el diseño y aplicación de todas las políticas que afecten al ámbito de competencias de las comunidades autónomas y de las restantes Administraciones públicas, propiciando su participación a través de los órganos e instrumentos de cooperación adecuados. Son órganos superiores y directivos del departamento, dependientes directamente del Ministro: a) La Secretaría de Estado de Energía; b) La Secretaría de Estado de Medio Ambiente; c) La Subsecretaría para la Transición Ecológica.

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba la Tarifa Eléctrica Rural para Sistemas Fotovoltaicos, expresada en Cargos Fijos Equivalentes por Energía Promedio, los Cargos de Corte y Reconexión para Sistemas Fotovoltaicos, y las Fórmulas de actualización de la Tarifa Eléctrica Rural y Cargos de Corte y Reconexión para Sistemas Fotovoltaicos. La Tarifa Eléctrica Rural se aplicará a los suministros de energía eléctrica, pertenecientes a un sistema eléctrico rural aislado que es atendido exclusivamente por sistemas fotovoltaicos. Se podrá autorizar la aplicación de dicha tarifa para suministros no convencionales atendidos con sistemas de otras tecnologías (eólico, biomasa, mini centrales hidroeléctricas o híbridos) en función de un rendimiento equivalente de dichos sistemas, en el caso se presenten dentro del periodo de regulación siempre y cuando no se justifique una regulación específica o se trate de proyectos piloto.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 008-2018-MINAM ─ Disposiciones para la implementación, operación e interoperabilidad de la Plataforma Informática de la Ventanilla Única de Certificación Ambiental.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba disposiciones para la implementación, operación e interoperabilidad de la Plataforma Informática de la Ventanilla Única de Certificación Ambiental, a cargo del Servicio Nacional de Certificación Ambiental para las Inversiones Sostenibles (SENACE). Son objetivos de la Plataforma Informática de la Ventanilla Única de CertificacióAnm biental: 1) Optimizar el proceso de certificación ambiental en el marco del Sistema Nacional de Evaluación del Impacto Ambiental (SEIA), a través de la simplificación administrativa, integración y uniformación de los procedimientos administrativos que se efectúan ante el SENACE; 2) Facilitar la articulación, coordinación e integración de procesos, así como el intercambio de información de los sistemas informáticos de las entidades públicas involucradas en el proceso de certificación ambiental en el marco del SEIA, de acuerdo con sus respectivas competencias, mediante el uso de la Plataforma Informática de la Ventanilla Única de Certificación Ambiental; 3) Utilizar la Plataforma de Interoperabilidad del Estado (PIDE) como herramienta para exponer los servicios web de la Plataforma Informática de la Ventanilla Única de Certificación Ambiental; 4) Brindar seguridad jurídica y predictibilidad a los administrados, promoviendo el uso de mecanismos de gobierno digital, que permitan la provisión de información oportuna sobre los procedimientos administrativos a cargo del SENACE; 5) Promover el acceso a la información ambiental a través de una gestión pública orientada a la atención de la ciudadanía y personas en general, conforme a los principios de la Política Nacional de Gobierno Electrónico y la Política Nacional de Modernización de la Gestión Pública; 6) Fomentar la ecoeficiencia y la mejora continua del proceso de certificación ambiental, mediante el uso racional de recursos y la disminución de impactos negativos en el ambiente.

Policy: Law No. 17.542 creating the Biogas State Policy.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the Biogas State Policy that gathers a set of principles, objectives, instruments, guidelines, actions, and incentives adopted by the State, alone or in cooperation with the Union, municipalities or private individuals, aiming at producing, exploiting, managing and marketing biogas. Natural and legal persons, whether public or private, directly or indirectly responsible for products and by-products capable of generating biomass and biodigestion within the State Territory are subject to comply with this Law. The objectives of the Biogas State Policy are: protection of human and animal health and the environment to minimize impacts of the production and commercial exploitation of animal protein by the state agroindustry; adoption, development and improvement of clean technologies to minimize environmental impacts; reduction of biomass volume and biodigestion of animal, urban and industrial waste; promotion of the use of biomass and biodigestion through its use on an industrial and commercial scale, as a form of employment and income generation; articulation between the different spheres of the Public Power and those with the business sector, with a view to technical and financial cooperation for exploration, commercialization and transport of biogas; continuous technical training in the area of ​​biomass, biodigestion, biogas and biomethane; and stimulate environmental labelling, consumption and sustainable production of biomass, biogas and biomethane.

Policy: Decreto Nº 236 - Crea el Consejo Nacional para la Paridad de Género.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea el Consejo Nacional para la Paridad de Género, cuyo objetivo principal es impulsar acciones a favor de la paridad de género en concordancia con lo establecido en el punto 5 de los Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible (ODS). El Consejo tendrá, entre otras, las siguientes funciones: 1) Apoyar la implementación de las medidas y actividades relacionadas a las propuestas priorizadas en materia de participación laboral femenina, brechas salariales de género y barreras al ascenso femenino; 2) Promover la participación de las mujeres especialmente niñas. adolescentes y jóvenes en los estudios y profesiones con mayor demanda dentro de las economías del futuro; 3) Apoyar la integración de mujeres egresadas (con énfasis de carreras de letras y humanísticas) en los sectores de oportunidad y, muy particularmente en la economía del conocimiento; 4) Prestar un apoyo integral al desarrollo del proyecto de vida y profesional de las mujeres jóvenes, con énfasis en las desempleadas y en las que se encuentran en condiciones de vulnerabilidad socioeconómica;  5) Impulsar el Plan Nacional de la Coalición Internacional en favor de la Iguallad de Remuneración (EPIC); 6) Promover la integración de la paridad de género corno prioridad en los planes estratégicos nacionales, regionales y locales; 7) Fomentar la integración del enfoque de género en el ecosistema de empleo, información y emprendimiento.

Policy: Política Nacional de Educación Ambiental (PNEA).
Policy_Content: La presente Política Nacional de Educación Ambiental (PNEA) de El Salvador. La PNEA es el resultado de un proceso de construcción participativo desarrollado mediante talleres de consulta y validación; expresión de los aportes de participantes para promover una nueva cultura ambiental que busca propiciar la participación consciente de la población en la protección y restauración de los recursos naturales. Además, se basa en las competencias establecidas en el marco jurídico nacional, en la Política Nacional del Medio Ambiente y en su Estrategia Nacional conformada por las Estrategias Nacionales de Saneamiento Ambiental, Recurso Hídrico, Biodiversidad y Cambio Climático. Con base en lo anterior, la PNEA se propone impulsar esta Política mediante alianzas y acciones interinstitucionales a escala nacional y territorial, orientadas a generar conocimientos, valores, actitudes y acciones que permitan transitar a una cultura de responsabilidad ambiental.

Policy: Plan El Salvador Sustentable - Por el derecho a un desarrollo en armonía con el medio ambiente.
Policy_Content: El Plan El Salvador Sustentable - Por el derecho a un desarrollo en armonía con el medio ambiente, elaborado por el Consejo Nacional de Sustentabilidad Ambiental y Vulnerabilidad (CONASAV), propone una agenda de compromisos y de líneas de trabajo en torno a cuatro ejes para promover el desarrollo sostenible del país: 1) fortalecimiento a la institucionalidad en materia ambiental; 2) transformación del sector productivo hacia niveles de mayor eficiencia y competitividad, con menores externalidades al entorno; 3) fomento de la educación y de la cultura para la sustentabilidad; y 4) enmarcar todo lo anterior en una genuina comprensión de los riesgos vinculados al cambio climático y a los eventos naturales, para incorporarlos y gestionarlos en la planificación pública y privada. El Plan El Salvador Sustentable, asume la visión de conservación y restauración de la naturaleza, y propone el reto de encontrar la fórmula que promueva el desarrollo económico y social en armonía con el ambiente. El marco temporal del Plan es de 2018-2030, aunque buena parte de sus metas trascienden dicho periodo. El hecho de ser un instrumento orientador, dinámico y flexible le permite ser ajustado y, particularmente, evaluado en un periodo determinado para medir su efectiva implementación. Las metas prevén una ejecución gradual.

Policy: Order No. 172 of the Ministry of Regional Development, Construction and Housing and Communal Services validating the Procedure for certification of energy efficiency and form of energy certificate.
Policy_Content: This Procedure determines the mechanism for certification of energy efficiency and sets requirements for: (a) procedures for collecting and processing information on actual or design characteristics of enclosing structures and engineering systems; (b) assessments of the compliance of the calculated level of energy efficiency with the established minimum requirements for energy efficiency; and (c) development of recommendations for improving energy efficiency. The information required for calculation of the energy efficiency of buildings: (a) local climatic conditions; (b) functional purpose, architectural-planning and constructive solution of the building (characteristics of wall fencing structures, coating designs, covering, translucent fencing structures, external doors); (c) geometrical parameters of the building and the actual values determined (total area and compass points of the corresponding external fencing structures of the building, their thickness, conditioned (heated) area, air conditioned (heated) volume, volume intended for ventilation, average height of rooms);  (d) normative sanitary and microclimatic conditions of the premises of the building; (e) availability of premises with different functional purposes within the building, actual values of the conditioned area, conditioned volume and volume for ventilation of such premises; (f) structural features and geometric parameters of translucent fencing structures, material of construction, type of glass cover, the presence of sunscreen devices, the value of the calculated thermal conductivity; (g) indicators of reduced resistance of heat transfer of opaque and translucent fencing structures; (h) the estimated value of time-average air flow for the building or its conditioned zones; (i) internal heat transfer; (j) solar heat transfer; (k) data on the engineering systems of the building; (k) data on heating system; (l) data on cooling system; (m) hot water supply; (n) ventilation system; (o) lighting system; (p) normative terms of service of fencing constructions and elements; and (q) energy balance of the building.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Government Decree No. 691 validating the Regulation on the conditions and the procedures for the performance of activities for land reclamation, protection, conservation and improvement of soil fertility.
Policy_Content: The scope of the Regulation on the conditions and procedures for the performance of land reclamation, protection, conservation and improvement of soil fertility shall be to improve the efficiency of procedures for organizing and implementing land reclamation activities, protecting, preserving and improving soil fertility. The provisions of this Regulation shall apply to all types of land reclamation, protection, preservation and improvement of soil fertility with financial support from the state budget. Land reclamation work related to protection, conservation and improvement of soil fertility shall be performed for the following purposes: (a) protect the soil from mechanical actions of water and wind, including a set of works on prevention and control of erosion; (b) restoration (replenishment) of moisture deficit, content of organic substances in soil, including irrigation; (c) preventing or removing excess water from the soil  from its surface (a category that includes deaquation and drainage; (d) restoration of soils (a category related works on construction and operation of waterworks, work on selective removal of soil layer and reclamation of damaged or degraded lands, work on amelioration of black alkali soil and saline land. Users of works on land reclamation, protection, preservation and improvement of soil fertility, financed from the state budget, can be any individual or legal entity that owns land on condition of ownership, possession or tenancy. The user's contribution to the cost estimate for the implementation of works on land reclamation, protection, conservation and improvement of soil fertility, financed from the state budget, should not be less than the cost of design documentation.

Policy: Política de Crecimiento Verde. Documento CONPES Nº 3934.
Policy_Content: La presente Política de Crecimiento Verde, que se implementará durante un horizonte de tiempo de 13 años (2018-2030), tiene como finalidad llevar al país a una transición hacia un modelo económico más sostenible, competitivo e inclusivo, con el propósito general de avanzar hacia patrones de crecimiento más sostenibles, a partir de la eficiencia en el uso y manejo de los recursos naturales, la innovación e inversión en industrias verdes, y la sostenibilidad del crecimiento económico. Policy: Law No. 2496-VIII “On Basic Principles and Requirements for Organic Production, Turnover and Labelling of Organic Products”.
Policy_Content: This Law defines the basic principles and requirements for the organic production, trade, transportation and labeling of organic products, the principles of legal regulation of organic production, the circulation of organic products and the functioning of the organic products market, the legal basis for the activities of central executive authorities, organic market players and public policy directions in the specified areas. Organic production operators shall include producers of organic agricultural commodities, and also organic seeds and planting materials. This Law does not apply to the production and trade of products intended for one’s own consumption, perfumery and cosmetic products and medicines, hunting and fishing products obtained from the natural environment. Operators have the right, in the presence of a certificate, to perform the following activities: (a) to produce and sell organic products under its commercial name and/or trademark (a logo for goods and services); and (b) to entrust the provision of certain services (works), including contracting (commissioning), required for organic production and/or circulation of organic products, to a third party, subject to verification of the capacities of such person by the certification body and obtaining consent from it. Operators are responsible for complying with the requirements of legislation in the field of organic production, circulation and labeling of organic products within the scope of the activities they carry out. Operators shall have the following duties: (a) to comply with the requirements of legislation in the field of organic production, circulation and labeling of organic products; (b) withdraw and/or remove products produced by them that do not comply with the requirements of the legislation on organic production, circulation and labeling of organic products if it is marked with the state logo for organic products or contains the designations and inscriptions "organic", "biodynamic", "biological", "ecological", "organic", and similar or derivative words from these words with prefixes "bio-", "eco-", etc. in any languages; (b) to receive annually certification of organic production and/or circulation of organic products for confirmation of compliance with the requirements of legislation in the field of organic production, circulation and marking of organic products; (c) to interact with the certification bodies with whom they have concluded certification contract and to ensure the unhindered access of inspectors for organic production and/or circulation of organic products to their premises, facilities and to authorize them to perform sampling, as well as to provide, upon request of the certification bodies, the documents necessary for the certification of organic production, including access to financial documents; (d) to ensure unimpeded access of officials exercising state control (supervision) in the field of organic production, circulation and labeling of organic products in accordance with the law, for the implementation of state control measures, including sampling; (e) to declare volumes of organic products put into circulation; and (f) to coordinate the marking of organic products with the certification body. The guidelines of the state policy in the field of organic production, circulation and labeling of organic products shall be as follows: (a) introduction of innovations, energy and resource-saving technologies; (b) development of competition and increase of competitiveness of Ukrainian producers in the domestic and foreign markets; (c) increase in exports of organic agricultural products; (d) development of the internal market of organic products; (e) ensuring genetic safety, biodiversity and the rational use of natural resources and their reproduction; (f) supervision over observance of legislation in the field of organic production, circulation and marking of organic products; (g) humane treatment of livestock by providing conditions for the life of animals that meet their biological, specific and individual characteristics; (h) provision of environmental safety in the process of organic production; (i) creation of a unified system of certification of organic production and/or circulation and state control of organic production, circulation and labeling of organic products; (j) promotion of organic products; (k) scientific support of organic production; (l) establishment of liability for violation of legislation in the field of organic production, circulation and labeling of organic products. Agricultural commodities shall be intended products (goods) of plant or animal origin that fall under the definition of groups 1-24 of Ukrainian classification of foreign trade goods. This Law consists of XII Sections divided into 42 Articles. Section I lays down general provisions. Section II establishes rights and duties of the operators of organic production market. Section III lays down general principles of state regulation in the field of organic production, circulation and marking of organic production. Section IV defines competence of authorized state institutions in the sphere of organic production. Section V deals with issues of organic production. In the process of organic production it is prohibited to use synthetic substances, including agrochemicals, pesticides, antibiotics for preventive purposes, hormonal preparations, growth stimulators and animal feed (including poultry and insects. Section VI regards the process of certification and certification bodies. Section VII regards circulation, labelling and trade of organic production. Section VIII deals with state control (supervision) in the field of organic production. Section IX establishes liability for the infringement of legislation in the field of organic production. Section X regards international cooperation. Section XI lays down transitional provisions. Section XII lays down final provisions.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 800 validating the Regulation on recultivation and conservation of land.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for recultivation and conservation of land as specified in Forest Code of the Russian Federation and it shall be applicable equally to land areas and land plots. Development of a land reclamation and land recultivation project, development of a land conservation project shall be performed by persons whose activities have led to land degradation, including legal possessors of land, land tenants on condition of servitude, public servitude, as well as by persons using land areas or land plots pertaining to state or municipal property, without allotment of land and application of servitude. Land reclamation must ensure land restoration up to condition suitable for the use thereof in accordance with the specific intended use and authorized use, by ensuring compliance with quality standards and requirements as established by the legislation of the Russian Federation in the field of sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population, in relation to agricultural land and in compliance with the rules and regulations in the field of ensuring the fertility of agricultural land, but not lower than the indicators of the state of fertility of agricultural land. Land conservation shall be performed in relation to disturbed land, negative impact on which led to their degradation, deterioration of ecological situation and (or) disturbance of the soil layer, as a result of which are prohibited economic activities if the elimination of such consequences by land reclamation with a view of ensuring compliance with the requirements provided for in paragraph 5 of this Regulation is impossible for 15 years.
