Policy: Agreement between the Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring and the Government of Sverdlovsk region on cooperation in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, environmental monitoring and monitoring of pollution on the regional territory.
Policy_Content: This Agreement defines the intentions of the Parties in the main areas of cooperation between Roshydromet and the Government of Sverdlovsk region on the issues referred to the subjects of joint management of the Russian Federation and the regions of the Russian Federation, requiring concerted action and joint decisions in the framework of works in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, in the field of state environmental monitoring, improvement of the functioning of an integrated system of observations of the state of the environment in the territory of Sverdlovsk region, assessment and forecast of the state of  changes thereof under the impact of natural and anthropogenic factors. The Agreement is designed to strengthen cooperation between the Parties in the field of state environmental monitoring, adoption and implementation of target programs and planned environmental protection activities, providing the population and regional executive bodies with information on the state of the environment and its pollution. The main areas and forms of interaction between the Parties shall be as follows: (a) ensuring the functioning and improvement of the state observation network and territorial system of observations of the state of the environment and its pollution in the regional territory; (b) improving the efficiency of forecasting of natural disasters, phenomena and creation of optimal conditions for the improvement of the level of protection of the population and reduction of damage caused by natural disasters; (c) improvement of early warning system for the population related to dangerous natural phenomena and actual and projected changes in weather and environmental pollution, which may threaten the life and health of the population and cause damage to the environment; and (d) planning and implementation of joint programs and activities in the fields of interaction, exchange of information, working meetings and conferences on the most important issues requiring joint solutions in the of state environmental monitoring and environmental pollution on the territory of Sverdlovsk region.

Policy: Law No. 5.224 establishing the State Tourism System, the State Public Policy for Tourism and the State Tourism Plan of Mato Grosso do Sul State.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 19 articles divided into seven Chapters, establishes the State Tourism System, the State Public Policy for Tourism and the State Tourism Plan of Mato Grosso do Sul State. The State Tourism System of the State of Mato Grosso do Sul (SET-MS) has as its guideline the promotion and support for the development of tourism in the State of Mato Grosso do Sul, in a democratic and integrated way among the actors provided for in this Law and in consonant with the State Tourism Policy and the State Tourism Plan. SET-MS has the following objectives: comply with the goals, guidelines and objectives outlined in the State Tourism Plan; stimulate and coordinate the integration aimed at planning and carrying out the tourist activity at the state level, focusing on the decentralization of this activity; promote studies aimed at improving the quality of tourism services provided in the State of Mato Grosso do Sul; promote and organize the necessary surveys for the  state tourism offer; promote and support the exchange of information with municipal, regional and national entities, directly or indirectly linked to tourism, in order to subsidize the strategic planning of tourism in the State and regions of tourist interest; propose to the competent environmental agencies the creation of conservation units, considering areas of tourist interest.

Policy: Loi n°18/020 du 09 juillet 2018 relative à la liberté des prix et à la concurrence.
Policy_Content: La présente loi fixe les règles applicables à la liberté des prix et d’organiser la libre concurrence. Elle définit les dispositions de protection de la concurrence afin de stimuler l’efficience des relations commerciales. Elle vise à assurer la transparence, la régularité et la loyauté des prix ainsi que la lutte contre les pratiques restrictives et la hausse illicite des prix. Elle a également pour objet le contrôle de la concentration économique; et la protection du consommateur. A cet effet, elle s’applique à tous les secteurs de l’économie nationale et à toutes les activités de production, de distribution de biens et de services réalisées sur le territoire national par des personnes physiques ou morales, publiques ou privées qu’elles aient ou non leur siège ou des établissements en République Démocratique du Congo, dès lors que leurs opérations ou comportements ont un effet sur la concurrence sur le marché ou sur une partie substantielle de celui-ci. Elle s’applique également aux publications et éditions faites par les Instituts ou autres Organismes de recherche.

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 93 - Estatuto Orgánico de Gestión Organizacional por Procesos del Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo expide el Estatuto Orgánico de Gestión Organizacional por Procesos del Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería, cuya estructura organizacional se alinea con su misión y se sustenta en su base legal y direccionamiento estratégico, filosofía y enfoque de productos, servicios y procesos, con el propósito de asegurar su ordenamiento orgánico. Los procesos que generan los productos y servicios del Ministerio se ordenan y clasifican en función de su grado de contribución o procesamiento primario al cumplimiento de la misión institucional de articular los servicios financieros y no financieros, facilitando el desarrollo de los mercados de servicios no financieros, a través de la política pública para la agricultura comercial y la agricultura familiar campesina priorizando los servicios de comercialización, asociatividad e innovación, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de la población y garantizar el objetivo estratégico constitucional de la soberanía alimentaria. Se ha definido dentro de su estructura los procesos gobernantes, procesos sustantivos, y procesos adjetivos de asesoría y de apoyo.

Policy: Islands (Scotland) Act 2018 (2018 asp 12).
Policy_Content: The Act creates a framework of measures for Scotland’s island communities. It gives effect to a range of policy changes to improve outcomes for island communities in Scotland. The Act places a duty on the Scottish Ministers to prepare, lay before the Scottish Parliament and publish a national islands plan. The plan will set out the overarching objectives and strategy of the Scottish Ministers for improving the outcomes of island communities across Scotland. It also requires Scottish public authorities to have regard to island communities when exercising their functions and to prepare impact assessments in relation to island communities in certain circumstances. The Act grants regulation-making power for the Scottish Ministers to create a licensing scheme in relation to any works in or under the sea in the coastal waters surrounding islands for up to 12 nautical miles. The Scottish Ministers may, by Regulations, establish a scheme by virtue of which a person must not, except in accordance with a licence granted by a local authority, carry on a development activity within such part of the Scottish island marine area as is designated in the regulations as a part in which such a licence is required to carry on a development activity.

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 818/2018 - Medidas para la reducción de las emisiones nacionales de determinados contaminantes atmosféricos.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto tiene como finalidad establecer las medidas necesarias para lograr unos niveles de calidad del aire que no supongan efectos negativos significativos en la salud humana y el medio ambiente. A tal fin, tiene por objeto: 1) Establecer los compromisos nacionales de reducción de las emisiones atmosféricas antropogénicas de dióxido de azufre (SO2), óxidos de nitrógeno (NOx), compuestos orgánicos volátiles no metánicos (COVNM), amoniaco (NH3), y partículas finas (PM2,5); 2) Regular el contenido y el procedimiento para la elaboración, adopción y aplicación de un programa nacional de control de la contaminación atmosférica; 3) Establecer un sistema para el seguimiento de las emisiones y de sus efectos en los ecosistemas, así como la presentación de informes al respecto. Se aplicará a las emisiones de los contaminantes incluidos en el Anexo I procedentes de todas las fuentes presentes en el territorio español, así como en los espacios marítimos donde el Reino de España ejerce su soberanía, derechos soberanos o jurisdicción, incluidas, en su caso, las zonas de control de la contaminación. Quedan excluidas del ámbito de aplicación las emisiones que se produzcan en las Islas Canarias y en sus espacios marítimos adyacentes donde el Reino de España ejerce soberanía, derechos soberanos o jurisdicción.

Policy: Resolución Nº 171-2018-PCM ─ Manual de Evaluación de Daños y Análisis de Necesidades - EDAN PERÚ.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el nuevo Manual de Evaluación de Daños y Análisis de Necesidades - EDAN PERU, que es un instrumento técnico que mediante un procedimiento de recojo de datos y procesamiento de información cuantitativa y cualitativa permite conocer el nivel de daños que ha sufrido una comunidad, distrito, provincia o región frente a la ocurrencia de un fenómeno de origen natural o inducido por la acción humana, generando el requerimiento de las necesidades para atender a la población damnificada y afectada. El Manual permite evaluar los daños y análisis de necesidades de niños, adultos mayores, personas con discapacidad, clasificados por género, así como personas con enfermedades crónicas, familia con jefa de familia, que constituyen los distintos grupos vulnerables; así mismo permite detectar las afectaciones a los medios de vida, para identificar damnificados en este aspecto.

Policy: National Youth Authority Act No. 6 of 2018.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down rules for the institution of a clean and manageable framework to guide and enhance the delivery of youth development programs and services; coordination, direction and support the development of youth programs; establishment of higher standards of youth development programs in all youth related service delivery; improvement of the participation of youths in youth development programs, national platforms and services; support for excellence, leadership and innovative performance of youth and youth service providers through capacity building programs, incentives and research; and monitoring and evaluation of all programs aimed at integrating the youth into the economy and society in general. This Act sets forth provisions on the establishment, composition, functions and powers of the National Youth Authority, National Youth Council and other Youth Committees and Youth sub-committees; registration of service providers, youth workers and youth groups and non-formal training programs; and funding and financial management of the Authority.

Policy: Ley N° 6123 – Que eleva al rango de Ministerio a la Secretaría del Ambiente y pasa a denominarse Ministerio del Ambiente y Desarrollo Sostenible.

Policy: Regional Law No. 3810-KZ “On the development of gardening and horticulture”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates legal relations in the field of support of gardening and horticulture provided by the regional authorities and local government, and sets out the forms and main directions of state support in this sphere. The objectives of this Regional Law shall be to ensure the development of gardening and horticulture with a view of meeting the demand of the population in vegetables, fruits, berries and other agricultural products through individual personal and family production, creation of favorable conditions for collective gardening and horticulture, improvement of efficiency of land plots allotted for gardening and horticulture in the regional territory. Gardening and horticultural non-profit partnerships (associations) contribute to interaction between their members and regional state bodies and local government with a view of creating favorable conditions for the development of gardening and horticulture, development of land plots as well as protection of their rights and legitimate interests. Priority areas of support for gardening and horticulture shall be as follows: (a) development of engineering and technical infrastructure of the territories allotted for gardening and horticulture; (b) assistance in the arrangement of land plots in common property allotted for gardening and horticulture; (c) formation and organization of the functioning of the agricultural commodities market for vending of vegetables and fruits grown by citizens engaged in gardening and horticulture; (d) provision of transport accessibility and construction of roads to the territories of gardening or horticulture; and (e) scientific-methodological, informational support of gardening and of horticultural non-profit partnerships (associations).

Policy: Law No. 120 amending Law No. 1543- XIII on register of immovable property.
Policy_Content: Law No. 1543- XIII on register of immovable property shall be supplemented with Article 55 (1) of the following wording: “Article 55 (1) The particulars of correcting errors made in the process of transferring ownership of land plots (1) Errors in supporting documents issued in the process of transferring ownership of land plots shall be classified as follows: (a) measurement errors - errors made at the stage of drawing up a topographic plan for the development of a land management project, or errors committed by cadastral work executors in determining the boundaries of land plots, which resulted in a graphical imposition of cadastral plans or the formation of free space between them and other inconsistencies in the configuration of the plan; (b) design errors - errors made at the stage of work on the development of the land management project (lack of registration of the direction of the rows of perennial plantations or incorrect drawing up of a list with the order of location of the owners of the projected land parcels); (c) identification errors - incorrect identification of real estate property and the holder of rights, as a result of which the data related to the owner in the land management project and/or in the document certifying the rights of the owner of the land plot do not correspond to the data in the identity documents; (d) discrepancies - differences between cadastral documentation and the requirements of existing normative acts (cadastral plans compiled in a conditional coordinate system, lack of graphic design of a land management project in electronic form, etc.). (2) The errors specified in paragraph (1) shall be corrected by the decision of the local council, issued in connection with a new land management project or a new geometric plan and, as the case may be, justifying the data related to the correct identification of real estate property and the holder of rights, if this correction does not lead to the transfer of ownership of the owners of land plots. The decision of the local council shall be the basis for updating the data in the cadastral plan and changing, as the case may be, the areas in the immovable property registry, as well as the identification data of the holders of rights entered in the real estate property register. The provisions of paragraphs (5) and (6) of Article 55 apply accordingly. (3) The correction of the errors indicated in paragraph (1) shall be financed from the state budget and/or from the assistance of development partners and shall be implemented in accordance with the program approved by the Government, in the order established thereby".

Policy: Mineral Resources Authority Act No. 6 of 2018.
Policy_Content: This Act lays down rules for the establishment, duties and powers of the Mineral Resources Authority; composition and structure of the Mineral Resources Authority Board; duties of the Managing Director and the staff of the Authority; and finance management and the Fund of the Authority. The duties of the Mineral Resources Authority includes to advise the Minister on matters relating to mining and the management, exploitation and development of mineral resources; to coordinate and monitor the implementation of the State’s undertakings and obligations under agreements and such other legal, contractual, commercial or social obligations in accordance with government policies on mining and the applicable laws that are necessary for the management of the mining sector; to provide small-scale mining and hydrogeological survey data services, and occupational health and safety community awareness programs; and to collect, analyze, store, archive, disseminate and publish geo-scientific information about mineral and geological resources. This Act is made taking account in particular the National Goals and Directive Principles entitled natural resources and environment.

Policy: Resolución Nº 125/2018 - Aprueba la Organización y Funcionamiento del Sistema Nacional de Información Geológica, las Bases Generales sobre la Generación, Diseminación, Acceso, Uso y Preservación de la Información Geológica y las Relaciones con el Instituto de Planificación Física.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución, que consta de 24 artículos divididos en cuatro Capítulos, aprueba la Organización y Funcionamiento del Sistema Nacional de Información Geológica. En particular, su objeto es de establecer la organización y funcionamiento del Sistema Nacional de Información Geológica, las bases generales para la generación, diseminación, acceso, uso y preservación de la información geológica, así como las relaciones con el Instituto de Planificación Física en este ámbito. Las personas naturales y jurídicas que generan, custodian, controlan o utilizan  información geológica del país, forman parte del Sistema Nacional de Información Geológica. El Instituto de Geología y Paleontología, como representante del Servicio Geológico, es  responsable de organizar y dirigir todos los aspectos relacionados con el funcionamiento del  Sistema de Información en ámbito geológico. La Oficina Nacional de Recursos Minerales es  depositaria de la información geológica generada en el país relacionada con recursos minerales, en cumplimiento de esa función controla su acceso y garantiza su preservación.

Policy: Management of Risks from Natural Hazards Strategy 2018
Policy_Content: The Management of Risks from Natural Hazards Strategy 2018 is a national sectoral strategy of Switzerland. Its main objectives include the following: (1) Switzerland is resistant - the effects of natural events are bearable by both society and the economy; (2) Switzerland is able to recover - society and the economy are capable of rapidly regaining functional capacity following natural events; and (3) Switzerland is able to adapt - society and the economy adapt in a timely manner to changes in conditions.

Policy: Development and Planning Amendment Act 2018 (No. 31 of 2018).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Development and Planning Act 1974 in various provisions concerning, among other things, the granting of or refusal to grant planning permissions, enforcement action and offences and penalties. These substantial amendments concern Part X, in which new provisions establish the Development and Planning Appeals Tribunal and grant powers to the Director to issue enforcement notices, breach of condition notices and stop notices. The amendments set out proceedings for such notices and grant powers to the Director of Planning to serve a planning contravention notice on a person in case of (suspected) breach of planning control in respect of any land. Policy: Aquaculture (Licence Application) (Amendment) Regulations, 2018 (S.I. No. 240 of 2018).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Aquaculture (Licence Application) Regulations 1998 to give further effect in Irish law to Directive No. 2011/92/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 13 December 2011 (as amended by Council Directive 2014/52/EU) on the assessment of the effects of certain public and private projects on the environment insofar as it applies to certain aquaculture licence applications and makes other miscellaneous amendments. "Environmental impact assessment" has now the same meaning as in the Directive. The Minister, as part of his or her consideration of an application for intensive fish farming (other than those specified in Regulation 5(1)(a), (b), (c) or (d), shall make a determination on the basis of the information provided by the applicant under Regulation 4(3)(e)(i), the criteria listed in Annex III of the Directive and where relevant the available results of other environmental assessments carried out pursuant to European Union Legislation other than enactments implementing the requirements of the Directive. An application under section 10 of the Act for an aquaculture licence in respect of specified aquaculture development shall require an environmental impact assessment and be accompanied by an Environmental Impact Assessment Report as prescribed by these Regulations. The environmental impact assessment shall identify, describe and assess in an appropriate manner the direct and indirect significant effects of a project on specified factors including, among other things, biodiversity.

Policy: Ley Nº 9590 - Ley para autorizar el aprovechamiento de agua para consumo humano y construcción de obras conexas en el patrimonio natural del Estado.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley autoriza el aprovechamiento de agua para consumo humano y construcción de obras conexas en el patrimonio natural del Estado. A tal fin, reforma el artículo 18 de la Ley Nº 7575, Ley Forestal de 1996: "Artículo 18 - Autorización de labores. En el patrimonio natural el Estado podrá realizar o autorizar labores de investigación, capacitación y ecoturismo, así como actividades necesarias para el aprovechamiento de agua para consumo humano, de conformidad con el artículo 18 bis de esta ley, una vez aprobadas por el Ministro de Ambiente y Energía, quien definirá, cuando corresponda, la realización de evaluaciones del impacto ambiental, según lo establezca el reglamento de esta Ley." Se adiciona el Artículo 18 bis a la Ley Nº 7575, Ley Forestal de 1996: "Artículo 18 - Aprovechamiento de agua para abastecimiento de poblaciones. El Ministerio de Ambiente y Energía (MINAE) podrá autorizar el aprovechamiento de agua proveniente de fuentes superficiales y la construcción, la operación, el mantenimiento y las mejoras de sistemas de abastecimiento de agua, en inmuebles que integran el patrimonio natural del Estado, previa declaración, por el Poder Ejecutivo, de interés público, en específico para un abastecimiento poblacional imperioso y a favor de los entes autorizados prestadores de servicio público." Todas las obras o actividades necesarias para el cumplimiento de los fines aquí establecidos deberán ser ejecutadas con base en estudios técnicos, procurando el menor impacto ambiental posible según el instrumento de evaluación de impacto ambiental que corresponda y en estricto cumplimiento de la normativa ambiental vigente.

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal du 3 juillet 2018 portant exécution de la loi du 3 juillet 2018 sur l’attribution de contrats de concession.
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement porte exécution de la loi du 3 juillet 2018 sur l’attribution de contrats de concession. L’application des règles prévues par la loi du 3 juillet 2018 sur l’attribution de contrats de concessions est contrôlée par les autorités, organismes et structures compétents. Lorsque les autorités ou structures de contrôle constatent des violations concrètes, telles que des cas de fraude, de corruption, de conflit d’intérêts et d’autres irrégularités graves, ou des problèmes systémiques, elles sont habilitées à en saisir les autorités nationales de contrôle, les tribunaux ou les autres structures ou autorités compétentes. Les résultats des opérations de contrôle effectuées conformément au paragraphe 1 er sont rendus publics par des moyens d’information appropriés. Afin de permettre au ministre ayant les Travaux publics dans ses attributions de présenter tous les trois ans un rapport de contrôle présentant un aperçu des causes les plus fréquentes d'application incorrecte des règles d'attribution des contrats de concession, les problèmes structurels ou récurrents que pose éventuellement l'application des dispositions, y compris les éventuels cas de fraude et autres agissements illégaux, les autorités, organismes et structures visées au paragraphe 1 er lui transmettent, annuellement, par écrit, les informations nécessaires, en fonction de leurs domaines de compétences respectifs.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy_Content: La présente loi établit les règles applicables aux procédures de passation de contrats de concession par des pouvoirs adjudicateurs et des entités adjudicatrices, lorsque la valeur estimée n’est pas inférieure aux seuils prévus à l'article 8. La présente loi s'applique à l'attribution de concessions de travaux ou de services à des opérateurs économiques par: les pouvoirs adjudicateurs; ou les entités adjudicatrices, pour autant que les travaux et services sont destinés à l'exercice de l'une des activités visées à l'annexe II. La présente loi s'applique sous réserve de l'article 346 du traité sur le fonctionnement de l'Union européenne. Les accords, décisions ou autres instruments juridiques qui organisent le transfert de compétences et de responsabilités en vue de l'exécution de missions publiques entre pouvoirs adjudicateurs ou entités adjudicatrices ou groupements de pouvoirs adjudicateurs ou d'entités adjudicatrices, et qui ne prévoient pas la rémunération des prestations contractuelles, ne sont en aucune manière affectés par la présente loi.

Policy_Content: La présente loi est structurée en 9 titres et comprend 450 articles. Le Titre I portant Dispositions et principes fondamentaux prévoit les dispositions générales. Elle fixe les dispositions et principes fondamentaux et vise à concrétiser les droits et devoirs de la population en matière de santé. Elle a pour objet d’assurer la prévention, la protection, le maintien, le rétablissement et la promotion de la santé des personnes dans le respect de la dignité, de la liberté, de l’intégrité et de la vie privée. Les objectifs en matière de santé consistent à assurer la protection de la santé des citoyens à travers l'égal accès aux soins, la garantie de la continuité du service public de santé et la sécurité sanitaire. Par ailleurs, il prévoit les obligations de l'Etat en matière de santé ; et les droits et obligations des patients.

Policy: Resolución 402/2018 - Reglamento del Fondo Fiduciario de Protección Ambiental de los Bosques Nativos.
Policy_Content: En el marco de la Ley Nº 26.331 (Ley de presupuestos mínimos de protección ambiental de los bosques nativos) y de la Ley de Presupuesto Nacional N° 27.431, mediante la que se creó el Fondo Fiduciario de Protección Ambiental de los Bosques Nativos, la presente Resolución aprueba el reglamento del mencionado Fondo Fiduciario. El Fondo estará conformado por dos cuentas fiduciarias, a saber : a) Cuenta Fondo Nacional para el Enriquecimiento y Conservación de los Bosques Nativos; b) Cuenta Fondos de Bosques Nativos y Cambio Climático, integrada con fondos captados en el marco de la Ley Nacional Nº 27.270, dentro del Plan Nacional de Acción de Bosques y cambio Climático cuyo objetivo es fortalecer la gestión sostenible de los bosques nativos de manera de reducir su vulnerabilidad frente al cambio climático, y la de las comunidades que dependen de éstos, contribuyendo a la disminución de las emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero a través de la reducción de la deforestación y la degradación forestal y al aumento de la captura de gases de efecto invernadero mediante restauración y recuperación de bosques nativos degradados.

Policy: Luxembourg 2030 3ème Plan National pour un Développement Durable.
Policy_Content: Le Plan National pour un Développement Durable a pour objectif la mise en œuvre de l’Agenda 2030 et les objectifs de développement durable dans le territoire national. Il fait le lien entre la politique nationale en matière de développement durable et les engagements pris par le Grand-Duché lorsqu’il a adopté l’Agenda 2030 des Nations Unies. De même, il fixe les domaines d’action, les objectifs et les mesures à prendre dans la perspective du développement durable. Les champs d'action prioritaires définis dans le document sont: assurer une inclusion sociale et une éducation pour tous; assurer les conditions d’une population en bonne santé; promouvoir une consommation et une production durables; diversifier et assurer une économie inclusive et porteuse d’avenir; planifier et coordonner l’utilisation du territoire; Assurer une mobilité durable; arrêter la dégradation de notre environnement et respecter les capacités des ressources naturelles; protéger le climat, s’adapter au changement climatique et assurer une énergie durable; contribuer, sur le plan global, à l’éradication de la pauvreté et à la cohérence des politiques pour le développement durable; et garantir des finances durables.

Policy: Fourth Health Sector Strategic Plan 2018-2024.
Policy_Content: The Rwanda Health Sector Strategic Plan 2018-2024 (HSSP IV) is the guiding document outlining national strategic directions to improve health standards of Rwandans over the next seven years. HSSP IV builds on lessons learnt and important progress that were made from the implementation of Rwanda Health Sector Strategic Plan 2013-2018 (HSSP III) and is fully aligned with the Rwanda Vision 2050 and the National Strategy for Transformation 2018- 2019. The Overall Objective of the health sector is to ensure universal accessibility (in geographical and financial terms) of equitable and affordable quality health services (preventative, curative, rehabilitative and promotional services) for all Rwandans (Chapter 3). This will be attained through four Strategic Objectives with respective focus on: 1. full implementation of the various programs (improve demand, access, coverage and quality); 2. strengthening the various health system components (strengthen policies, resources and management); 3. strengthening all levels of service delivery (organise the services effectively at all levels); and 4. ensuring effective governance of the sector (strengthen decentralization, partnership, coordination, aid effectiveness and financial management).

Policy: Decreto Nº 350/2018 - Establece el Regulamento del Decreto Ley Nº 358 sobre la entrega de tierras estatales ociosas en usufructo.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Reglamento sobre la entrega de tierras estatales ociosas en usufructo. El Reglamento, que consta de 49 artículos divididos en nueve Capítulos, regula los siguientes aspectos del Decreto Ley Nº 358 sobre la entrega de dichas tierras: a) la conformación del Fondo de Tierras Ociosas que pueden ser entregadas en usufructo; b) los requisitos que deben cumplir las personas jurídicas y naturales para ser usufructuarias; c) el procedimiento para la legalización del usufructo, su incremento y la prórroga; d) el contenido básico del Contrato de Usufructo; e) las bienhechurías; f) el control sobre la entrega de tierra ociosa y el cumplimiento del Contrato de Usufructo; g) la vinculación e integración del usufructuario; y h)   la extinción del Contrato de Usufructo. Los delegados o directores municipales de la Agricultura, según corresponda, garantizan de oficio la permanente actualización del Fondo de Tierras Ociosas, para lo que tienen en cuenta los datos que constan en el Catastro, los censos, las visitas de control, así como la información que obtienen de entidades estatales, unidades básicas de Producción Cooperativa, cooperativas de Producción Agropecuaria, cooperativas de Créditos y Servicios, otras personas jurídicas no estatales y personas naturales. Las personas jurídicas que en virtud de sus funciones conozcan o deban poseer la información necesaria para la periódica actualización del Fondo de Tierras Ociosas, están obligadas a aportarlas al Delegado o Director Municipal de la Agricultura, según corresponda, en un plazo de 15 días siguientes a que reciba de este la solicitud, exponiendo la ubicación de la tierra.

Policy: Arrêté royal relatif à la réduction de l’intensité de gaz à effet de serre de l’énergie destinée au transport.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté établit la réduction de l’intensité de gaz à effet de serre de l’énergie destinée au transport, en transposant l’article 7bis de la directive 98/70/CE du Parlement européen et du Conseil du 13 octobre 1998 concernant la qualité de l’essence et des carburants diesel et modifiant la directive 93/12/CEE du Conseil. Il transpose aussi la directive (UE) 2015/652 du Conseil du 20 avril 2015 établissant des méthodes de calcul et des exigences de déclaration au titre de la directive 98/70/CE du Parlement européen et du Conseil concernant la qualité de l’essence et des carburants diesel. Le présent arrêté s’applique, d’une part, aux carburants destinés au transport utilisés pour la propulsion des véhicules routiers, des engins mobiles non routiers (y compris les bateaux de navigation intérieure lorsqu’ils ne sont pas en mer), des tracteurs agricoles et forestiers, et des bateaux de plaisance lorsqu’ils ne sont pas en mer, et d’autre part, à l’électricité destinée au fonctionnement des véhicules routiers. L'Annexe établit la Méthode de calcul et de déclaration par les fournisseurs de l'intensité d'émission de gaz à effet de serre sur l'ensemble du cycle de vie de l'energie destinée au transport.

Policy: Resolución Nº 151/2018 - Aprueba las Normas para la Aplicación del Tratado de Cooperación en Materia de Patentes.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba las Normas para la Aplicación del Tratado de Cooperación en Materia de Patentes. El Tratado de Cooperación en materia de Patentes que entró en vigor en la República de Cuba el 16 de julio de 1996 y la Resolución No. 72 de 11 de julio de 2002, que derogó a la Resolución No. 66 de 15 de julio de 1996, ambas del Ministro de Ciencia, Tecnología y Medio Ambiente, definen las funciones de la Oficina Cubana de la Propiedad Industrial en calidad de Oficina receptora y de Oficina designada, así como los requisitos que deben cumplir las solicitudes internacionales para su tramitación. Estas Normas, que constan de 22 artículos, establece que la Oficina Cubana de la Propiedad Industrial actúa como Oficina receptora, designada o elegida, con respecto a las solicitudes internacionales presentadas en su sede en virtud del Tratado de Cooperación en materia de Patentes. La Oficina otorga una fecha de presentación de la solicitud internacional si está redactada en idioma español y cumple requisitos específicos.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 378 validating the National Anti-Corruption Plan for 2018-2020.
Policy_Content: National Anti-Corruption Plan for 2018-2020 is a nationwide multi-sectoral policy document aimed at improving the system of prohibitions, restrictions and requirements established for the purposes of combating corruption; ensuring the uniform application of the legislation of the Russian Federation for combating corruption in order to increase the effectiveness of mechanisms to prevent and resolve conflicts of interest; improving anti-corruption measures in the area of corruption in the area of procurement of goods, works and services for state or municipal needs by certain types of legal entities; improvement of the provisions of Federal Law No. 230-FZ of December 3, 2012 "On Controlling the Correspondence of Expenditures of persons holding public office and other persons to their income" of the procedure for exercising control over expenditures and the mechanism of the return to the income of the Russian Federation of property with regard to which no information was provided, the procedure for exercising control over expenditures; a mechanism for the recovery of property with regard to which no information on its acquisition by legitimate income has been provided; ensuring completeness and transparency of the information on income and property-related obligations; increasing the effectiveness of awareness-raising, educational and other measures aimed at forming anti-corruption behavior of government and municipal officials, and the development of public legal consciousness; improving anti-corruption measures in the field of business, including the protection of business entities from abuse of authority by government officials; systematization and updating of the regulatory and legal framework to address the issues of countering corruption, elimination of gaps and contradictions in the field of countering corruption; and improving the effectiveness of international cooperation of the Russian Federation in the field of combating corruption, strengthening of Russia's international prestige.
Subject: General

Policy: Regulation (2018: 1462) on producer responsibility for packaging.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, made under the Swedish Environmental Code, lays down rules on the use of packaging by producers and define their responsibility in this respect. The purpose of this Regulation is to: a) Reduce the amount of packaging waste by ensuring that the manufacturing of packaging in such a manner that their volume and weight are reduced to it level required to maintain a good level of safety and hygiene, and that packaging is used only when necessary; b) Limit the harm to the environment of materials and substances in packaging; c) compel producers to provide or join a collective scheme that takes operational action and financial responsibility for collecting and processing packaging waste; d) ensure that packaging waste is taken care of in a healthy and environmentally acceptable manner; and (e) reach the recycling targets set out in this Regulation.

Policy: Regulation (2018:1428) on public climate adaptation efforts.
Policy_Content: This Regulation defines the duty of specified public agencies (including those involved in managing water resources) to have regard in its operations and the managing of state property to climate change considerations. An authority specified in article 1 shall, within its area of responsibility and within the framework of its assignments, initiate, support and evaluate the work on climate adaptation. If the authority manages or maintains state property, it shall also adapt activity to a changing climate. Specific tasks are also assigned to County Boards. The work on climate adaptation shall include an assessment of the impact of climate change on the agency's activities in a climate and vulnerability analysis. An authority shall further elaborate current government targets for its work on climate adaptation. It shall draw up a plan for the achievement of goals and targets. An authority shall report annually on the work on climate adaptation in the manner determined by the Swedish Meteorological and Hydrological Institute.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Environmental Authorisations (Scotland) Regulations 2018 (S.S.I. No. 219 of 2018).
Policy_Content: These Regulations provide a framework for the authorisation of environmental activities ("regulated activities") in Scotland. Regulated activities currently are activities involving either or both— (a) radioactive material; (b) radioactive waste (“radioactive substances activity”). The Regulations transpose provisions of Council Directive 2013/59/Euratom laying down basic safety standards for protection against the dangers arising from exposure to ionising radiation and repealing Directives 89/618/Euratom, 90/641/Euratom, 96/29/Euratom, 97/43/Euratom and 2003/122/Euratom. A registration or authorisation under the Radioactive Substances Act 1993 is deemed to be an authorisation. Activities which are not regulated under the Radioactive Substances Act 1993 but which are radioactive substances activities under these Regulations will generally require an authorisation of the Scottish Environment Protection Agency (SEPA). The Scottish Minister shall provide guidance to SEPA. Provision is made in respect to appeals to the Scottish Ministers and administrative procedures.

Policy: Law No. HO-360-N amending Land Code (No.185 of 2001).
Policy_Content: Land Code shall be supplemented with Article 6.1 of the following wording: “Land cover is the observable biophysical cover of the earth's surface. Land cover is classified as follows: (a) cultivated land - land used for cultivation of agricultural crops; it includes arable land with perennial plants, and in urban land horticultural land, and, partially, within forest land, arable land; (b) meadows - part of the land area, which is covered with herbaceous vegetation, including partially agricultural land, in particular, grasslands, pastures, land of protected areas and forest land classified as grasslands and pastures; (c) tree-covered areas - part of the land area, which is covered with tree species, including land of protected areas and forested land; (d) shrubland areas - part of the land area covered with shrub vegetation, including protected areas of land fund and, partially forest land covered by shrubbery; (e) flooded areas - part of the land area, which is occupied by waterbodies (rivers, natural resources, artificial reservoirs and lakes), include the water land of the land fund; (f) areas devoid of vegetation, including agricultural land, in particular urban agricultural land, common use land (public land used for industry, energy, communication, transport, communal infrastructure) and reserve land. The procedure for classification of land area coverage shall be approved by the Republic of Armenia the government.”
Subject: Forestry, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia

Policy: Law of Georgia on Public Safety (No. 2608-IIS of 2018)
Policy_Content: The Law provides for the main principles of public safety in Georgia. It regulates the organization of the national system of public safety; and the powers of the executive authority and of local self-governing bodies, and the rights and obligations of natural and legal persons in the field of public safety. It consists of 12 chapters: General provisions (I); National system of public safety, its subjects, and rights and obligations of natural persons (II); Prevention and preparedness for emergencies (III); Incident and emergency management (IV); Extinguishing fires, rescue and accident-rescue efforts (V); Restorative work (VI); State fire supervision and supervision of vital objects (VII); Emergency Management Service (VIII); Rules for hiring, training, re-training and service at Emergency Management Service (IX); Legal and social protection guaranties for servicemen (X); Types of service and providing service in the field of public safety (XI); and Transitional and final provisions (XII). The main principles of the Law are giving priority to the objectives of saving lives and preserving the health of the population; involving the population voluntarily in emergency response measures; publicity of information on public safety within the limits of law; and using a complex approach to accomplish public safety objectives.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reglamenta el artículo 46 de la Ley Nacional de Emergencias y Prevención del Riesgo, en lo relativo a la transferencia de recursos institucionales a favor de la Comisión Nacional de Prevención de Riesgos y Atención de Emergencias, para ser depositados en el Fondo Nacional de Emergencias destinados al financiamiento del Sistema Nacional de Gestión del Riesgo. El objeto del Reglamento es regular el procedimiento el cálculo, determinación y recaudación del tributo establecido en el artículo 46, así como la aplicación de las normas del Código de Normas y Procedimientos Tributarios en los trámites y procedimientos requeridos cumplir con el objeto señalado. En la aplicación de la presente normativa, se busca recaudar las sumas correspondientes al tres por ciento de las ganancias y del superávit presupuestario acumulado libre y total que reporten las Instituciones de la Administración Central, la Administración Pública Descentralizada y las Empresas Públicas, el cuál será depositado en el Fondo Nacional de Emergencias para el financiamiento del Sistema Nacional de Gestión del Riesgo.

Policy: Ordonnance n° 2018-594 du 27 juin 2018 portant création, organisation et fonctionnement de l’Autorité nationale de Régulation des Marchés publics.
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance crée l’Autorité nationale de Régulation des Marchés publics (ANRMP), et fixe son organisation et son fonctionnement. L’ANRMP a pour missions, en matière de commande publique de: définir les politiques et les stratégies de formation et d'information des acteurs de la commande publique; formuler des avis au ministre chargé des Marchés publics pour la définition et l'amélioration des politiques en vue des actions de réforme du système des marchés publics; définir les orientations pour l’animation et l’'alimentation du système d'information des marchés publics et du site Internet qui lui est consacré, et d'en assurer la surveillance; veiller à l'application des principes de bonne gouvernance, notamment par la mise en œuvre des moyens préventifs permettant de lutter contre la fraude et la corruption dans les marchés publics et les contrats de partenariats public-privé; réaliser des audits indépendants de la passation et de l'exécution des marchés publics et des contrats de partenariats public privé et d’assurer le suivi de la mise en œuvre des recommandations avec les administrations concernées; régler les litiges et différends nés à l’occasion de la passation des marchés publics et des contrats de partenariats public privé; procéder à des conciliations, le cas échéant, en matière d'exécution et de règlement des marchés publics et des contrats de partenariats public-privé; assurer le suivi des décisions portant sur le règlement des litiges qui lui sont soumis; prononcer des sanctions à l’encontre des acteurs privés de la commande publique, reconnus coupables de violations de la règlementation de la commande publique; proposer aux autorités compétentes des sanctions à l’encontre des acteurs publics de la commande publique, reconnus coupables de violations de la règlementation de la commande publique; créer et d'animer un cadre d'échanges et d'écoute de l'ensemble des acteurs du système de la commande publique.

Policy_Content: La presente Ley de protección a los ocupantes de zonas clasificadas como especiales, dispone que por el plazo de treinta y seis meses se suspenderá el desalojo de personas, la demolición de obras, la suspensión de actividades comerciales, agropecuarias y cualquier otra actividad lícita y proyectos existentes en la zona marítima terrestre, zona fronteriza y patrimonio natural del Estado, salvo aquellas que sean ordenadas mediante Resolución judicial o administrativa en firme, fundamentándose en la comisión de daño ambiental o cuando exista peligro o amenaza de daño al medio ambiente. Cuando se trate de zonas declaradas patrimonio natural del Estado, la aplicación de la moratoria estará sujeta al dictamen técnico favorable del Ministerio de Ambiente y Energía (MINAE).

The offences, which are set out in the Schedule to these Regulations, are enforced by the Offshore Petroleum Regulator for Environment & Decommissioning of the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy. For some offences, the Secretary of State may impose either a fixed or a variable monetary penalty; for others, only one of the penalties is available.

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal du 27 juin 2018 concernant la réduction des émissions nationales de certains polluants atmosphériques.
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement concerne la réduction des émissions nationales de certains polluants atmosphériques. Afin de progresser vers des niveaux de qualité de l'air n'entraînant pas d'incidence négative notable ni de risque pour la santé humaine et l'environnement, le présent règlement établit les engagements nationaux de réduction des émissions atmosphériques anthropiques de dioxyde de soufre (SO2), d'oxydes d'azote (NOx), de composés organiques volatils non méthaniques (COVNM), d'ammoniac (NH3) et de particules fines (PM2,5) et exige l'établissement, l'adoption et la mise en œuvre d’un programme national de lutte contre la pollution atmosphérique ainsi que la surveillance et la déclaration des émissions de ces polluants et d'autres polluants visés à l'annexe I, ainsi que de leurs incidences. Le présent règlement contribue également à la réalisation des objectifs suivants: 1° les objectifs de qualité de l'air fixés dans la législation de l'Union européenne et les progrès en vue d'atteindre l'objectif à long terme de l'Union européenne consistant à parvenir à des niveaux de qualité de l'air conformes aux lignes directrices relatives à la qualité de l'air publiées par l'Organisation mondiale de la santé; 2° les objectifs de l'Union européenne en matière de biodiversité et d'écosystèmes conformément au septième programme d'action pour l'environnement; et 3° l'amélioration des synergies entre la politique de l'Union européenne en matière de qualité de l'air et les autres politiques pertinentes de l'Union européenne, en particulier les politiques en matière de climat et d'énergie. Le présent règlement s'applique aux émissions des polluants visés à l'annexe I provenant de toutes les sources présentes sur le territoire national.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Keyword: Air quality/air pollution,Emissions,Public health,Risk assessment/management,Climate change,Monitoring,Governance,Pollution control,Policy/planning,Biodiversity,Ecosystem preservation,Energy conservation/energy production

L'article 5, paragraphe 1er, du présent règlement est applicable, en ce qui concerne les plafonds prévus à l'article 5 et à l'annexe I du règlement grand-ducal modifié du 8 novembre 2002 portant application de la directive 2001/81/CE du Parlement européen et du Conseil du 23 octobre 2001 fixant des plafonds d’émission nationaux pour certains polluants atmosphériques.

Policy: Kakamega County Trade and Markets Act, 2018 (No. 3 of 2018).
Policy_Content: The purpose of the Act is to promote and regulate trade in the County, promote local economic development, enable the County Government to attract and promote public private partnerships and private investments in trade; and enable the County Government to enter into joint trade ventures with other partners. Essentially, the Act provides that the trade county section shall, among other things, advise on the pricing of commodities within the County and ensuring laws relating to fair trading and consumer protection are adhered to. Furthermore, the Act provides for the establishment of markets in designated places, for the sale of marketable commodities. The Act also rules against indiscriminate establishment of markets without prior authorization and provides extensively for incidental matters to the establishment of a market, including a market management committee, collection of revenue at the markets, allocation of trading spaces etc. The Act also provides that public and environmental health officers should be liased with Department to ensure that every market complies with public and environmental health requirements.

Policy: Executive Order on the use of waste for agricultural purposes.
Policy_Content: The Executive Order lays down rules on how waste (as defined in articles 2 and 4) can be used for agricultural purposes without harmful effects on the environment, humans, plants and animals. The Order covers waste from households, institutions and companies, including biologically treated waste, process wastewater and sewage sludge, to the extent that the waste is intended to be used for agricultural purposes. Its provisions shall not apply if they contravene provisions on the prevention and control of livestock diseases, zoonoses or plant pests in other legislation. Waste that is included in Appendix 1 may, without prior permission pursuant to section 19 of the Environmental Protection Act, be used for agricultural purposes in accordance with the provisions in Chapters 5-10 of this Executive Order and the rules in the Executive Order on commercial animal husbandry, livestock manure, silage, etc. The use of waste that is not included in Appendix 1 for agricultural purposes requires a permit in accordance with § 19 of the Environmental Protection Act. The use of waste must not give rise to contamination of groundwater.

Policy: Organic Law for the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (Republic Act No. 11054).
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Organic Law is to establish a political entity, provide for its basic structure of government in recognition of the justness and legitimacy of the cause of the Bangsamoro people and the aspirations of Muslim Filipinos and all indigenous cultural communities in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao to secure their identity and posterity, allowing for meaningful self-governance within the framework of the Constitution and the national sovereignty as well as territorial integrity of the Republic of the Philippines. The executive function and authority shall be exercised by the Cabinet which shall be headed by a Chief Minister. The powers of Bangsamoro Government shall be vested in the Parliament which shall exercise those powers and functions expressly granted to it in this Organic Law, and those necessary for, or incidental to, the proper governance and development of the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region. The Chief Minister shall be elected by a majority vote of all the members of the Parliament. The constituent units of the Bangsamoro  Autonomous Region are the provinces, cities, municipalities, barangays, and geographical areas within its territorial jurisdiction.
Subject: General

Policy: Private Investment Law (No. 10/18).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 52 articles divided into nine Chapters, establishes the general principles and basis of private investments in the Republic of Angola, determining the benefits and concessions that the Government of Angola grants private investors and the criteria for accessing them, as well as establishing rights, duties and guarantees of private investors. The present Law is applied to private investments of any value, whether it is carried out by domestic or foreign investors. The present Law is not applicable to investments carried out by public domain companies in which the Government holds most capital. The present Law is not applicable, yet, to those sectors of activity whose investment regime is regulated by special law. Private investment and granting of benefits follow the following general principles: a) Respect for the principles and goals of national economic politics; b) Respect for private property and other rights; c) Respect for market economy regulations, in the basis of values and principles of healthy competition, morality and ethics between economic agents; d) Respect for free economic and corporate initiative, except for areas defined as being reserve of the Government by the Constitution and by law; e) Guarantees of investment safety and protection; f) Guarantees of free property and capital circulation, within the legal terms and boundaries; g) Respect for bilateral and multilateral agreements and treaties on the matter which the Government is part of.

Policy: Loi n° 12/AN/18/8ème L du 26 juin 2018 portant création du Centre du Leadership et d'Entreprenariat (CLE).
Policy_Content: La présente loi crée le Centre du Leadership et d'Entrepreneuriat (CLE) ayant pour missions de: faciliter le développement de l'entrepreneuriat à Djibouti.  En collaboration avec les autres acteurs étatiques et non étatiques, il est chargée de: assurer la coordination des acteurs engagés dans la promotion des activités d'appui à l'entrepreneuriat et développement d'entreprises; offrir des opportunités de croissance aux entreprises en les connectant aux clients potentiels et en veillant à leur mise à niveau; identifier les sources potentielles d'investissements ou de partenariat pour les PME et les jeunes entrepreneurs; fournir une expérience pratique, formation entrepreneuriale, et orientation pour la création, la gestion et le développement de l'entreprise; appuyer à la recherche des financements initiaux pour aider les start-ups à concrétiser et murir leur idée; servir de plateforme d'échanges d'informations, des opportunités, des outils, des besoins, etc. des différents acteurs des secteurs privés et publics; identifier les pôles de croissance et les opportunités pour les entreprises locales et les jeunes pousses. Les modalités d'organisation et de fonctionnement du CLE sont fixées par Décret pris en Conseil des Ministres sur proposition de l'Autorité de rattachement.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Decree No. 9.424 regulating art. 17 of Law No. 8.629 providing for the granting of credits for settlement projects to the beneficiaries of the National Agrarian Reform Programme.
Policy_Content: This Decree regulates art. 17 of Law No. 8.629 providing for the granting of credits for the installation of settlement projects to the beneficiaries of the National Agrarian Reform Programme. The management of credit concessions will be under the National Institute of Colonization and Agrarian Reform - INCRA. Credits will be granted as follows: support the installation in the settlement project and the acquisition of necessities; enable the implementation of productive projects to promote food and nutritional security and stimulate the generation of work and income; enable the implementation of a productive project under the responsibility of the woman holding the parcel; meet water security needs of families based on settlement projects located in semi-arid areas, recognized by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE) (to support solutions for abstraction, storage and distribution of drinking water for human, animal and irrigation use); enable the implementation and sustainable maintenance of agroforestry systems or the forest management of lots and legal reserve area with native vegetation in agrarian reform projects created or recognized by INCRA; enable the implementation and sustainable maintenance of forest or agroforestry systems or forest management of lots, legal reserve area and permanent preservation area, regarding agrarian reform projects created or recognized by Incra; enable the implementation and recovery of cocoa crops, in an agroforestry system; enable the construction of rural housing in agrarian reform projects created or recognized by INCRA; etc.

Policy: European Union (Withdrawal) Act (2018 C.16).
Policy_Content: The Act concerns legal implications of exit of the United Kingdom from the European Union. The principal purpose of the Act is to provide a functioning statute book on the day the UK leaves the EU. It ends the supremacy of European Union (EU) law in UK law, converts EU law as it stands at the moment of exit into domestic law, and preserves laws made in the UK to implement EU obligations. It also creates temporary powers to make secondary legislation to enable corrections to be made to the laws that would otherwise no longer operate appropriately once the UK has left, so that the domestic legal system continues to function correctly outside the EU. The Act also enables domestic law to reflect the content of a withdrawal agreement under Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union once the UK leaves the EU, subject to the prior enactment of a statute by Parliament approving the final terms of withdrawal. Direct EU legislation, so far as operative immediately before exit day, forms part of domestic law on and after exit day.
Subject: General

Policy: Marine and Coastal Act 2018.
Policy_Content: The purposes of this Act, consisting of 100 sections divided into 11 Parts, are: a) to establish an integrated and co-ordinated whole-of-government approach to protect and manage Victoria's marine and coastal environment; b) to provide for integrated and co-ordinated policy, planning, management, decisionmaking and reporting across catchment, coastal and marine areas; c) to repeal and partially re-enact the Coastal Management Act 1995; d) to establish objectives and guiding principles for ecologically sustainable planning, management and decision-making under this Act; e) to replace the Victorian Coastal Council with the Marine and Coastal Council; f) to abolish the Regional Coastal Boards; g) to provide for the preparation of a Marine and Coastal Policy, a Marine and Coastal Strategy, and a State of the Marine and Coastal Environment Report; h) to provide for the formation of regional and strategic partnerships to address regional and issue-based and integrated marine and coastal planning; i) to provide for other planning mechanisms in the form of environmental management plans and coastal and marine management plans; j) to provide for the giving of consents to use or develop, or undertake works on, marine and coastal Crown land and establish an application process; k) to allow coastal Catchment Management Authorities and the Melbourne Water Corporation to provide advice on matters relating to and affecting coastal erosion; l) to allow the Secretary to prepare and make guidelines to assist with the implementation of this Act; m) to create offences and other enforcement mechanisms relating to the unauthorised use or development of, or works on, marine and coastal Crown land; n) to amend various other Acts to provide for integrated and co-ordinated management of the marine and coastal environment of Victoria; and o) to provide for effective community engagement and education in planning and management.

La implementación del Programa alcanzará a los actores del sistema de producción y comercialización frutihortícola en el ámbito de todo el territorio nacional. Son objetivos del Programa propender a la inocuidad de los alimentos frutihortícolas, la adopción de tecnologías, prácticas de manejo integral de los recursos naturales y sistemas de producción, compatibles con el desarrollo sustentable en lo económico, social y ambiental, para contribuir a mejorar la calidad de los productos y procesos. Policy: Resolution No. 60/2018 approving the Strategy for Agro-silvopastoral and Environmental Development in the Maio Island.
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the Strategy for Agro-silvopastoral and Environmental Development in the Maio Island. This Strategy, consisting of twelve Sections, elaborates a planning strategy for the agro-silvopastoral system and the environmental sector on the island of Maio, in a participatory manner, based on its specificity, its endogenous potentialities and comparative advantages, aiming at its economic and social development. Its General Objective is to establish a short-, medium- and long-term strategy to create the capacity needed to produce inclusive socio-economic data to increase the income and well-being of the population of the island of Maio. Its Specific Objectives are: to improve the current state of the agro-forestry and environmental system of the island, in order to meet its needs, in the field of agricultural, silvopastoral and environmental production; to sustainably improve productivity, quality of production, transformation and market, through strategies for creating and disseminating opportunities in order to promote the local economy.

Policy: Resolución Nº 261 - Define la Frontera Agrícola Nacional y adopta la metodología para la identificación general.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución define la Frontera Agrícola Nacional como el límite del suelo rural que separa las áreas donde se desarrollan las actividades agropecuarias, las áreas condicionadas y las áreas protegidas, las de especial importancia ecológica, y las demás áreas en las que las actividades agropecuarias están excluidas por mandato de la ley. La Frontera Agrícola Nacional podrá incluir: 1) Áreas cuya categoría de manejo con régimen de uso o derivada de la zonificación ambiental elaborada por las autoridades ambientales, permitan las actividades agropecuarias, entre otras, la explotación forestal o reforestación con fines comerciales; 2) Áreas que se encuentran en zonas de muy alta amenaza por movimientos en masa en las que se adopten medidas encaminadas a prevenir o mitigar la situación de riesgo para el desarrollo de actividades humanas; 3) Áreas dedicadas a la pesca comercial en el ámbito continental e insular, de acuerdo con los requisitos para el otorgamiento de permisos y autorizaciones para el ejercicio de las actividades pesqueras y acuícolas, definidos por la Autoridad Nacional de Acuicultura y Pesca (AUNAP) o la normatividad vigente.

Policy: State program for the provision of targeted social assistance in the Republic of Tajikistan for 2018 – 2020.
Policy_Content: State program for the provision of targeted social assistance in the Republic of Tajikistan for 2018 – 2020 is a sectoral nationwide policy document designed to improve the social status of poor citizens and families. One of the main objectives of the State program shall be implementation of a set of measures for social support of low income families and vulnerable strata of the population. State support must be targeted and designated based on the actual assessment of the welfare of the applicants. State measures within the framework of social protection policy are based on constant analysis and interest in poverty reduction. During the first stage of implementation of the poverty reduction strategy for 2002-2006, two systems of allocating and paying state benefits to poor families began to operate in Tajikistan in 2001: the first is a benefit paid to poor families with children studying in general education schools and the second from 2004 to the present day is the payment of compensation to poor families for using electricity and natural gas. The main objectives of the State program are: (a) to help reduce the difficult situation and support poor citizens (families); (b) to create conditions to enable poor citizens (families) to improve their living standards; (c) to facilitate access of poor citizens (families) to electricity and their integration into public life; (d) reducing the poverty level of the population; and (e) efficient use of budget funds. Promotion of employment is one of the measures contributing to the improvement of the welfare of citizens in a difficult life situation and citizens (families) recognized as poor by established methods. Social support to citizens during unemployment, especially non-competitive employment in the labor market, is one of the main government priorities in promoting employment.

Policy: Law No. XIII-1283 amending Law No. VIII-1019 “On radiation safety”.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law shall be to establish legal framework for the protection against radiation that allows to protect people who suffer from exposure to radiation due to their occupational, medical and residential surroundings and the environment risks posed by ionizing radiation, and regulates relations between natural and legal persons arising from activities with sources of ionizing radiation, including radioactive waste management, as well also the competence of state institutions in the field of state radiation protection management. It shall be applicable to planned, existing and emerging exposure situations involving exposure to radiation that needs to be assessed from a radiation or environmental point of view in order to ensure long-term protection of human health. The source of ionizing radiation is an object emitting ionizing radiation or releasing radioactive materials, which can cause exposure. The basic principles of ensuring radiation protection shall be as follows: (a) responsibility for radiation protection by the operators; (b) regulation of protection against radiation and supervision in the aforesaid sphere by regulatory bodies; (c) management protection system against radiation risks; (d) justification of actions in the sphere of protection against radiation for the benefit of the population, in particular risk assessment related to  nuclear disasters; (e) optimization of protection against radiation; (f) limitation of the risks of exposure to radiation for the population; the limit shall not be applicable to medical exposure; (g) protection of the present and future generations; (h) nuclear accident prevention principle; (i) emergency preparedness and response principle; and (j) protection against natural ionizing radiation or ionizing radiation arising from activities not subject to regulatory control. Adding radioactive substances to foodstuffs, beverages, feeding stuff, cosmetics, toys, and jewelry and other commodities or products intended to be swallowed, inhaled, injected into the body or applied on the skin, with the exception of justified activities involving exposure for medical purposes, and import/export of radioactive substances shall be prohibited. This Law consists of XIII Chapters divided into 33 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II regards state radiation safety system management. Chapter III lists basic activities in the sphere of radiation subject to reporting. Chapter IV lists authorized licensed activities related to radiation safety. Chapter V establishes operators and staff duties in the sphere of radiation safety. Chapter VI regards healthcare of staff exposed to radiation. Chapter VII establishes criteria for exposure to radiation for medical purposes. Chapter VIII lists radioactive sources. Chapter IX regards physical protection against radiation sources. Chapter X regards training related to protection, including physical protection, against radiation. Chapter XI regards certification of operators in the sphere of radiation safety. Chapter XII deals with radioactive materials related to nuclear energy generation, certification, transport and packaging thereof. Chapter XIII regards international cooperation and exchange of information.

Policy: Law No. XIII-1285 amending Law No. VII-1190 on the management of radioactive waste.
Policy_Content: Article 11 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Criteria for the acceptance of radioactive waste in a storage shall be considered criteria for determining whether radioactive waste and its packaging are suitable for storage and repository storage.” Article 3 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Safety of radioactive waste and radioactive waste management facilities would be ensured throughout the period of radioactive waste management and operation, and subsequently through passive safety measures.” Article 5 establishes the competence of the Ministry of Energy in the sphere of radioactive waste management. Article 9 shall be amended to add the following wording: “The obligation of the producer of radioactive waste is to comply with the requirements for the management of radioactive waste in accordance with the requirements for the management of radioactive waste until it is transferred to the radioactive waste manager.” Article 10 shall be amended to add the following wording: “The State Enterprise Ignalina Nuclear Power Plant is a radioactive waste manager and is responsible for the management of radioactive waste discharged by radioactive waste operators and other radioactive waste generated during the operation and decommissioning of the Ignalina Nuclear Power Plant and other nuclear facilities, in particular: (a) collection radioactive waste and organize its transportation from other radioactive waste producers, perform initial, main and final treatment of radioactive waste and protect it; (b) disposal of radioactive waste; (c) closure of the repository of radioactive waste and supervise the closed repository; (d) management of radioactive sources and objects contaminated with radioactive materials left by the Government in accordance with the procedure established by the Government; and (e) performance of other obligations established in this Law and other acting legislation in the sphere of nuclear and radiation safety, radioactive contamination and radioactive waste.”
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force on 1 January 2019.

Policy: Law No. XIII-1284 amending Law No. VII-1190 on the management of radioactive waste.
Policy_Content: Article 2 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Non-controllable levels of radioactivity are the values of radiation concentrations in the absence of substances that are generated by activities involving sources of ionizing radiation, which must be notified to the Radiation Protection Center or the State Nuclear Power Safety Inspectorate or which must be legalized, and radiation protection requirements shall not be applicable. Radioactive waste - spent nuclear fuel and other gaseous, liquid or solid non-radioactive materials that do not meet the criteria for non-control and which are subject to regulatory control by the Radiation Protection Center or the State Nuclear Power Safety Inspectorate. Closed radioactive source is a radioactive source in which the radioactive substance is permanently sealed in a capsule or in a solid container in order to prevent the release of radioactive material under normal conditions of use. The recipient of a closed radioactive source is a natural or legal person who receives a closed radioactive source. A supplier of a closed radioactive source is a natural or legal person who supplies or assists in receiving a closed radioactive source.” Article 25 shall be amended to add the following wording: “The procedure for import, export, transit and transportation of radioactive waste and/or spent nuclear fuel in the Republic of Lithuania shall be established by the Minister of Health together with the Head of the State Nuclear Power Safety Inspectorate.”

Policy: Governmental Decree No. HG590/2018 validating the Concept for the reform of the national system of flood management, prevention and reduction of the consequences of floods.
Policy_Content: Concept for the reform of the national system of flood management, prevention and reduction of the consequences of floods is a nationwide policy document aimed at the establishment of fundamental principles and objectives regarding flood protection, as well as the harmonization of legal and institutional framework in the field of management, prevention and reduction of risks of floods. Floods are natural phenomena that cannot be avoided, but which can be prevented. The main technical solution associated with the development of measures to protect populated settlements and floodplain lands, is the construction of protective dams against floods and monitoring the condition of dams during their operation. Contrary to the provisions of the Scheme for the protection of settlements from flooding, data results leveling of protective dams and the availability of projects of automated warning systems the necessary work was not completed due to lack of funds.

Policy: Decision on the adoption of the Programme "Micro and small loans for rural development".
Policy_Content: This Decision, based on the provisions of the Croatian Law on small business encouragement, adopts the Programme "Micro and small loans for rural development". The goal of this Programme is to facilitate access to finance for micro, small and medium-sized enterprises in the agricultural, processing and forestry sectors through greater availability of loans, reduction of interest rates, and reduction of required collateral. The purpose of this Programme is to finance the following Rural Development Programme measures: Measure 4 - Investments in physical assets, sub-measure 4.1 Support for investments in agricultural holdings and sub-measure 4.2. Support for investments in processing, marketing and / or development of agricultural products; Measure 6 - Development of agricultural holdings and business, sub-measure 6.4. Investments in the development of non-agricultural activities in rural areas; Measure 8 - Investments in the development of forest areas and improvement of forest sustainability, sub-measure 8.6 Support for investments in forest technologies and in processing, mobilization and marketing of forest products.

Policy: Decision on the adoption of the Programme "Individual guarantees for rural development".
Policy_Content: This Decision, based on the provisions of the Croatian Law on small business encouragement, adopts the “Individual Guarantees for Rural Development" Programme. The Programme "Individual guarantees for rural development" is intended for small businesses and is co-financed by the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development. The purpose of this Programme is to encourage the activities of financial institutions and facilitate access to finance for micro, small and medium-sized enterprises in agriculture, processing and forestry through greater availability of credit and other forms of financing, reducing interest rates and reducing collateral. The goal of this Programme is to increase the number of small businesses receiving support, including newly established entities, increase the amount of private investment and increase employment.

Policy: Décret n°2018-0516/P-RM du 20 juin 2018 fixant l’organisation et les modalités de gestion du fonds pour le développement durable.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe l’organisation et les modalités de gestion du Fonds pour le Développement durable. Le Comité de Pilotage et le Comité de Gestion sont les organes d’administration et de gestion du Fonds. Le Comité de Pilotage est chargé de: fixer les orientations stratégiques du Fonds; examiner et approuver les programmes et projets soumis au financement du Fonds; examiner les rapports sur l’état de mise en œuvre des projets et programmes de développement des Régions; examiner et approuver le budget annuel du Fonds; examiner les rapports d’audit et de contrôle du Fonds; adopter le programme pluriannuel; apprécier le niveau de respect des engagements souscrits; commanditer des évaluations à mi-parcours et finales de la mise en œuvre des projets; formuler des recommandations sur l’état de mise en œuvre des projets et programmes et de la situation financière du Fonds; assurer une revue annuelle du mécanisme d’organisation et de fonctionnement du Fonds. Ses membres sont issus de ministères et des collectivités territoriales.
