Policy: Decree No. 330 validating the Regulation on the use of finances of the State Fund for Radioactive Waste Management.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes the procedure for the use of finances of the State Fund for Radioactive Waste Management. Managers of the finances allocated by the Fund shall be budgetary institutions operating in the sphere of radioactive waste management. Distribution of finances of the fund between managers and recipients shall be the Ministry of Environmental Protection. Finances shall be allocated for the following purposes: (a) design, construction, commissioning, operation, repair, reconstruction of industrial complexes for decontamination, transportation, processing, storage and the disposal of radioactive waste and infrastructure facilities that are technologically connected thereto; (b) design, construction, commissioning, operation, removal from operation or closure (preservation), repair, reconstruction of radioactive storage facilities waste, including those intended for long-term storage of radioactive waste, originating from reprocessing of spent nuclear fuel of Ukrainian nuclear power plants; (c) realization of a complex of search, evaluation, research, methodological, research and design works on the selection of sites to accommodate the geological storage for disposal of long-acting and high-level radioactive waste; (d) maintenance in ecological security of the territories where the storage facilities for radioactive waste; (e) extraction of radioactive waste from emergency, preserved and also active provisional storage facilities and transportation thereof to the storage facilities in exclusion zone; (f) radiation monitoring of the state of radioactive waste; (g) decontamination of territories, equipment, installations, materials, overalls, means of individual protection and other objects of radioactive waste management; (h) collection, sorting, classification, conditioning, transportation, processing of radioactive waste; (i) inventory and state registration of radioactive waste; and (j) liquidation of nuclear accidents and disasters.

Policy: Decree No. 17/2018 recreating in all the provinces of the country, the Provincial Service of Forests and Wildlife (SPFB).
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 10 articles, recreates in all the provinces of the country, the Provincial Service for Forests and Wildlife (SPFB). It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Provincial Service, as a provincial organ of the State which, according to the principles, objectives and tasks defined by the Government, aims at guiding, planning, controlling and ensuring the execution of activities in the areas of administration and management of forest resources at the provincial level. In particular, SPFB attributions are: management, protection, conservation and rational use of forest resources at the level of the Province; monitoring compliance with technical and administrative standards relating to forests; establishment of reforestation programmes at the provincial level. SPFB competencies are:  supervise the exploitation and use of forest and wildlife resources throughout the national territory; ensure the provincial implementation and dissemination of legislation on the use and sustainable management of forest resources; plan, organize and direct all activities of National Forestry Cadastre at provincial level; implement policies and development strategies in forestry area, regarding access, use and sustainable management; etc. In addition, it derogates from the structure of the Provincial Government, approved by Decree No. 21/2015, with regard to the functions of the Provincial Directorate of Land, Environment and Rural Development in the field of forests.

Policy: Decree No. 19/2018 establishing fees to be paid for licensing and provision of services in the context of activities involving the safe and peaceful use of nuclear energy or ionizing radiation.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 6 articles and two Annexes, establishes the fees due for the licensing and provision of services in the context of activities or practices involving the safe and peaceful use of nuclear energy or ionizing radiation contained in Annexes 1 and 2. The Decree establishes that the applicant for licence provided for in Annex 1 shall pay the fees specified therein to the competent Tax Department, within 30 days after notification of the favourable order granting the permit. The payment of the fee outside the period implies the payment of 5% of interests. Activities and practices of the National Health Service are exempt from the licensing and service fee.

Policy: Government Decree No. 373 validating the Regulation on the National Register of emissions and pollutants.
Policy_Content: Automated Information System "National Register of emissions and pollutants"(AIS PRVP) is a systematized register of data on emissions of pollutants into the air, water, soil and diffused sources, as well as on the transfer of waste and pollutants from waste water outside area, which must be allotted to the operators engaged in one or more of the activities specified in Annex 1. The scope of the "National Register of emissions and pollutants" shall be creation of an information resource, covering information on pollution of the environment, emission of pollutants air, water, soil and from diffuse sources, transfer of waste and pollutants, in order to facilitate access thereto by responsible persons, government agencies, economic agents and the general public. The main tasks of the "National Register of emissions and pollutants" shall be as follows: (a) promoting public participation in the decision-making process in the field of environmental protection; (b) improving the recording of pollutant emissions and transfers at national and local levels; (c) identification of the main sources of emissions and transfer of pollutants; (d) monitoring of trends in pollutant emissions; (e) integration and harmonization of reporting requirements in accordance with the Protocol "PRVP"; (f) simplification of the process of reporting by the operators on emissions and transfer of pollutants; (g) providing responsible persons with the necessary information on emissions and transfer of pollutants; (h) assistance in fulfilling international obligations; and (i) assistance in the prevention and reduction of environmental pollution.

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal du 24 avril 2018 relatif à la limitation des émissions de certains polluants dans l'atmosphère en provenance des installations de combustion moyennes
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement établit des règles visant à limiter et à surveiller les émissions atmosphériques de polluants en provenance des installations de combustion et, partant, à réduire les émissions atmosphériques et les risques que celles-ci sont susceptibles de présenter pour la santé humaine et l'environnement. Il instaure également des règles visant à surveiller les émissions de monoxyde de carbone (CO). Le présent règlement s’applique: 1. aux installations de combustion d'une puissance thermique nominale égale ou supérieure à 1 MW et inférieure à 50 MW, ci-après dénommées « installations de combustion moyennes », quel que soit le type de combustible qu'elles utilisent; et 2. à un ensemble formé par des installations de combustion moyennes en vertu de l'article 4, y compris un ensemble dont la puissance thermique nominale totale est supérieure ou égale à 50 MW, à moins que cet ensemble ne constitue une installation de combustion relevant du chapitre III de la loi modifiée du 9 mai 2014 relative aux émissions industrielles; quelle que soit l’affectation des bâtiments où sont comprises ces installations.

Policy_Content: The procedure of agricultural insurance with state support is extended to the objects of commodity aquaculture (commodity fish farming). Policy: Decree-Law No. 18/2018 approving the structure, organization and functioning of the Ministry of Tourism and Transport (MTT).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 23 articles divided into three Chapters, approves the structure, organization and functioning of the Ministry of Tourism and Transport (MTT). It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of MTT as a government department, whose mission is to design, propose, coordinate, execute and evaluate public policies in the areas of tourism, air transport, etc. MTT in particular is entitled to: a) design, propose, coordinate and implement strategic policies on tourism and air transport; b) develop a concerted and sustained action, articulating the tourism policy with the management and conservation of the natural resources with social, cultural and environmental realities necessary for the qualification, diversification and competitiveness of the national tourism sector; c) promote infrastructures to support tourism activities, and to implement policies and strategies to follow up these activities; d) inventory the existing tourist offer and to forecast its potential growth potential, and to work, in articulation with sectoral agents, in the consolidation of tourist products; e) participate actively in the elaboration of territorial management instruments and in actions of tourism planning and supply structuring; f) encourage and support national entrepreneurship in the areas of tourism and air transport, and make feasible infrastructural and business investments conducive to the country's balanced development; promote the valuation of strategic tourism products; etc.

Policy: Order No. 187 of the Minister of Public Health validating Sanitary rules “Sanitary and epidemiological requirements for collection, management, use, disinfection, transportation, storage and disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes Sanitary and epidemiological requirements for collection, management, use, disinfection, transportation, storage and disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste, classified as solid domestic waste and medical waste. Collection and temporary storage of industrial waste is shall be performed by physical persons and legal entities in the operation of facilities, buildings, edifices, structures and other sites, the activity of which generates industrial waste, with subsequent removal autonomously or by specialized entities through the conclusion of relevant contracts for further disinfection, burial, use or disposal. Collection and temporary storage of industrial waste shall be performed at production facilities in special sites(s) corresponding to the hazard class of the waste. Waste as far as it accumulates shall be collected separately for each waste group according to the hazard class. Waste shall be classified according to the degree of impact on human health and the environment into five classes of hazard: (a) Class 1 - extremely hazardous; (b) Class 2 - highly hazardous; (c) Class 3 - moderately hazardous; (d) Class 4 - low hazard; and (e) Class 5 - non-hazardous. Waste may be accumulated and temporarily stored for a period not exceeding six months, up to their transfer to third parties involved in management, recycling and disposal, and also removal of waste that cannot be recycled or disposed of. Wastes in liquid and gaseous state are stored in sealed containers. As it accumulates waste must be removed from the territory of the industrial facility or neutralized at the production site. Permissible volume of industrial waste at the industrial site is determined autonomously by business entities. Collection, management, application, disinfection, transportation, storage and burial of domestic waste shall be performed by specialized organizations. In small inhabited areas, in the absence of specialized waste collecting organizations, managing landfill sites and solid domestic waste dumping sites, autonomous waste collecting and transportation shall be organized under supervision of the local government. Food waste of public catering, trade and educational facilities, sanatorium-resort organizations shall be collected in containers with lids, stored in the cooled room or in the refrigerating chamber.

Policy: Decreto Nº 41091-MINAE ─ Oficializa la Política Nacional de Adaptación al Cambio Climático 2018-2030.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto ficializa, para efectos de aplicación obligatoria, la Política Nacional de Adaptación al Cambio Climático, la cual se ejecutará en el período comprendido entre los arios 2018-2030. Todas las dependencias del Sector Público serán responsables de la implementación de la Política Nacional de Adaptación al Cambio Climático dentro de su ámbito legal respectivo, y en particular las instituciones de los ejes: Turismo, Recurso Hídrico, Biodiversidad y Bosque, Agropecuario y Pesca, Salud, Infraestructura y Energía. El objetivo general de la Política Nacional de Adaptación al Cambio Climático se enfoca en transitar hacia un modelo de desarrollo resiliente de la sociedad costarricense, que evite las pérdidas humanas y modere los daños materiales generados por los efectos adversos del cambio climático, contribuya a la calidad de vida de las poblaciones más vulnerables y aproveche las oportunidades para innovar y transformar los sectores productivos y asegurar la continuidad de los servicios públicos.

Policy: Order No. 163 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on state nature biosphere reserve "Prioksko-Terrasnoe".
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that on state nature biosphere reserve "Prioksko-Terrasnoe" shall be constituted in the Serpukhov district of Moscow region with a view of performing the following tasks: (a) protection of natural areas for the purpose of conservation of biological diversity and conservation in the natural state of protected natural complexes and objects; (b) organization and conduct of scientific research, including keeping Annals of nature; (c) performance of state environmental monitoring; (d) ecological education and promotion of cognitive tourism, including on the basis of the Central Bison Breeding Kennel and (e) assistance in training of scientific research staff and environmental protection personnel. Any activity contrasting the statute of the reserve shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve, including: (a) commercial, artisanal and sport hunting; (b) industrial fisheries, artisanal and sport fishing; (c) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, hunting gear, as well as with wildlife products, except for authorized officials; (d) exploration and mining; (e) soil disturbance; (f) modification of hydrological regime of soil; (g) procurement of soft resin, clear cutting, procurement of non-timber forest resources and medicinal plants; (h) transit passage and grazing of cattle; (j) placement of hives and apiaries; (i) ploughing up, except for forest fire prevention measures; (j) haymaking; (k) construction, reconstruction, repair and operation of capital construction facilities, including line structures, not related to the fulfilment of tasks and the functioning of the reserve; (l) explosive works; (m) burning of vegetation; (n) logging along watercourses and waterbodies; (o) allotment of land plots for housing construction, gardening and horticulture; (p) introduction of wild fauna and wild flora species for acclimatization purposes; (q) application of pesticides, mineral fertilizers and chemical plant protection products and growth stimulants, the use of toxic chemicals for the protection of forests, including for scientific purposes; (u) stay with dogs, except for service dogs, keeping unleashed dogs and training of dogs; (v) flight of aircraft and helicopters below 2000 meters above the territory of the reserve; (w) destruction and damaging of noticeboards, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs and equipped ecological paths and recreation areas; Policy: Recreation Areas Management Regulation 2017.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of 72 sections divided into ten Parts, implements the Recreation Areas Management Act 2006 by providing specifications on the management of continuing recreation areas as follows: (1) Each continuing recreation area is described in schedule 1. (2) A copy of a plan mentioned in schedule 1, part 1 may be inspected, free of charge, during business hours at the department’s head office. (3) In this section: continuing recreation area means an area of land— (a) set apart and declared to be a recreation area under the repealed Act; and (b) continued in existence as a recreation area under section 235 of the Act. The Regulation provides for permits required under the Act and prescribes restrictions on the use of vehicles, the taking of animals and plants and the depositing of waste into recreation areas. Policy: Decree approving the Regulation on the promotion to specific agricultural practices for the maintenance of the natural environment.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 23 articles and three Annexes, approves the Regulation on the promotion to specific agricultural practices for the maintenance of the natural environment. The Agriculture and Livestock Act of 22 June 2000 establishes as one of its main objectives the preservation of the natural environment of Andorra through the maintenance of traditional agricultural and livestock practices. With this objective, it creates and establishes the operating mechanisms of different types of public aid aiming to promote the survival of systems of income-livestock breeding that must ensure the regular presence of cows, horses, sheep and goats, both in the lowlands of the valleys and in the common pastures. The Government also establishes the procedures for the owners of agricultural holdings to obtain other types of aid, such as the one created under article 19 of the Law and which is aimed at the promotion of specific agricultural practices appropriate for the maintenance of the natural environment. This Regulation establishes criteria, conditions and amounts of granting of two new aid for the holders of agricultural holdings: one aimed at promoting the recovery of land for agricultural use and another to ensure the conservation of plants representative of local habitats. This Regulation is also framed in specific actions included in the National Landscape Strategy, and the National Strategy for Biodiversity, approved by the Government on 19 October 2016. Annexes deal with the following issues: Aid for the recovery or improvement of parcels for agricultural use (Annex 1); Aid for the maintenance of plant biodiversity (Annex 2); Technical prescriptions that must comply with the plots that aspire to the aid for the maintenance of the plant biodiversity (Annex 3).

Policy: Basic Environment Plan, 2018.
Policy_Content: This is the first Basic Environment Plan prepared after the adoption of the SDGs and the Paris Agreement. Recognizing this, the Plan should appropriately respond to these new international developments as well as to changing domestic situations. In doing so, it is important to utilize the concepts of SDGs by addressing multiple issues in an integrated manner. It is particularly important to recognize that the basic approach adopted in this Plan is different from that adopted previously. In the previous plans, priorities were set separately in each of the environmental fields with a focus upon directly addressing specific environmental issues. This Plan, on the other hand, sets up six interdisciplinary cross-cutting strategies, such as specific measures to solve several different issues in a complementary manner. By doing so, this Plan aims to adopt and embody the basic approach of the "Integrated Improvements on Environment, Economy and Society (II2ES)" proposed in the Third Basic Environment Plan (pag. 1).

Policy: Décret n° 2018-123 du 17 avril 2018 portant approbation des statuts de l’Agence Territoriale de Développement Agricole de l'Alibori Sud Borgou Nord-2KP.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée l'Agence Territoriale de Développement Agricole de l'Alibori Sud-Borgou Nord-2KP. Cette zone couvre le principal bassin cotonnier du Bénin. En plus du coton comme culture locomotive, le maïs et le sorgho y seront davantage développés pour bénéficier de l’arrière effet des engrais utilisés sur le coton. Il sera intégré dans le système un modèle d’élevage intensif de bovin, d’ovin, de caprin et de volaille. La production laitière y sera développée. Des actions (Recherche-Développement, exploitations modèles, etc.) seront menées sur le soja en vue de son extension progressive. Son objet de veiller à une meilleure combinaison de l’approche filière et de l’approche territoriale ainsi que l’application des instruments et démarches y afférents, notamment : la sélection des filières prioritaires pour le pôle;  les interventions sur les maillons pertinents des filières à développer/renforcer;  le renforcement des relations entre les différentes catégories d’acteurs;  l’établissement des partenariats stratégiques pour des réponses aux problèmes des producteurs, des transformateurs, des services financiers, des commerçants de produits agricoles et leurs dérivés, et des consommateurs;  la promotion des aménagements hydroagricoles, le développement de la mécanisation agricole et la réalisation des infrastructures structurantes dans le pôle.

Policy: Ley Nº 30754 - Ley Marco sobre Cambio Climático.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley Marco sobre Cambio Climático tiene por objeto establecer los principios, enfoques y disposiciones generales para coordinar, articular, diseñar, ejecutar, reportar, monitorear, evaluar y difundir las políticas públicas para la gestión integral, participativa y transparente de las medidas de adaptación y mitigación al cambio climático, a fin de reducir la vulnerabilidad del país al cambio climático, aprovechar las oportunidades del crecimiento bajo en carbono y cumplir con los compromisos internacionales asumidos por el Estado ante la Convención Marco de las Naciones Unidas sobre Cambio Climático, con enfoque intergeneracional y de género. El Estado, en sus tres niveles de gobierno, de manera articulada y participativa, adopta las medidas de adaptación y aprovechamiento de oportunidades frente al cambio climático, las mismas que tienen por finalidad garantizar un territorio resiliente y sostenible, priorizando el uso eficiente del agua en las actividades industriales y mineras; el ordenamiento territorial y ambiental; el desarrollo de ciudades sostenibles; y la prevención y gestión de riesgos climáticos; entre otras.

Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée l’Agence Territoriale de Développement Agricole du Borgou Sud-Donga-Collines. Elle couvre une zone de diversification coton-vivrier-anacardier. Cette zone abrite un système d’intégration agro-sylvo-pastorale portant sur l’anacardier et le coton comme cultures locomotives. S’y ajoutent le maïs, le riz, les racines et tubercules (manioc et igname), les légumineuses (niébé, soja et arachide), et le manguier, ainsi que l’élevage intensif de bovin, d’ovin, de caprin et de volaille. Des actions sur l’extension du soja s’y développent également. Son objet de veiller à une meilleure combinaison de l’approche filière et de l’approche territoriale ainsi que l’application des instruments et démarches y afférents, notamment : la sélection des filières prioritaires pour le pôle;  les interventions sur les maillons pertinents des filières à développer/renforcer;  le renforcement des relations entre les différentes catégories d’acteurs;  l’établissement des partenariats stratégiques pour des réponses aux problèmes des producteurs, des transformateurs, des services financiers, des commerçants de produits agricoles et leurs dérivés, et des consommateurs;  la promotion des aménagements hydroagricoles, le développement de la mécanisation agricole et la réalisation des infrastructures structurantes dans le pôle.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Fisheries, Cultivated plants

Policy: Décret n° 2018-128 du 17 avril 2018 portant approbation des statuts de l’Agence Territoriale de Développement Agricole de l'Ouémé-Atlantique-Littoral-Mono.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée l’Agence Territoriale de Développement Agricole de l'Ouémé-Atlantique-Littoral-Mono. Elle couvre la zone de pêcherie et de maraîchage du complexe fluvio-lagunaire du sud-Bénin et des vallées du Mono et de l’Ouémé. L’aquaculture, la riziculture et le maraîchage sont les activités dominantes. L’ananas est une culture émergente particulièrement au niveau du plateau d’Allada. Les communes de la plaine du fleuve Ouémé constituent la zone à plus fortes potentialités agricoles du pôle. Le maïs, le manioc et le petit élevage sont également développés dans ce pôle. On note aussi des plantations villageoises de palmier à huile, notamment dans la sous-zone de la dépression de la Lama. Une attention particulière y sera également accordée pour des mesures de gestion des troupeaux transhumants. Son objet de veiller à une meilleure combinaison de l’approche filière et de l’approche territoriale ainsi que l’application des instruments et démarches y afférents, notamment : la sélection des filières prioritaires pour le pôle;  les interventions sur les maillons pertinents des filières à développer/renforcer;  le renforcement des relations entre les différentes catégories d’acteurs;  l’établissement des partenariats stratégiques pour des réponses aux problèmes des producteurs, des transformateurs, des services financiers, des commerçants de produits agricoles et leurs dérivés, et des consommateurs;  la promotion des aménagements hydroagricoles, le développement de la mécanisation agricole et la réalisation des infrastructures structurantes dans le pôle.

Policy: Council of Ministers’ Decision No. 4 of 2018 relating to Water Users Association Regulation.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of 43 articles divided in VIII Chapters, aims to manage the use of irrigation water in a sustainable way on the local level, and to achieve the maximum benefit from the available water resources. Chapter I sets out definitions and general provisions. Chapter II deals with (1) association's licensing procedures (applications - that shall be submitted to the Ministry according to the form approved by both the Ministry and the Authority - related documents, reviews, and rejections) and (2) association's functions. Main functions are (i) setting plans and programs necessary to develop the management of irrigation water; (ii) representing the interests of all water users within the association's area of work; (iii) operating, maintaining and managing the agricultural irrigation and drainage system; (iv) producing or buying water from licensed resources and then redistributing it in a fair and timely manner to all farmers within the irrigation unit; (v) amicable settlement of disputes in relation to water sharing; (vi) setting the prices for water sale; (vii) collecting the costs of water usage from the users; (viii) approving the agricultural crop pattern and the irrigated areas for each crop; (ix) assessing the agricultural irrigation and drainage systems in use to set the mechanisms of distributing water, to prevent wasting and misuse, and determine water shares. Chapter III deals with association membership, which is optional to all water users, whether it was wholesale or from any joint traditional or non-traditional water resource. The articles establish conditions of membership, applications and member's rights and commitments, and loss of membership. Chapter IV concerns the management of the association, with tasks divided between General Assembly and Board of Directors. Main tasks of the General Assembly are (i) election of members of the board of directors; (ii) discussion and approval of plans and programs of the association's activities; (iii) approval of the association's annual budget; and (iv) approval and amendment of the association's internal bylaws. The Board of Directors manages the Association and shall be competent, between others, of the following (i) preparation of water distribution schedules among the beneficiaries; (ii) determination of water prices; (iii) cooperation with the official and non-official entities, and representing the association in front of the administrative and judiciary authorities.

Policy: Order No. 149 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on national park “Alkhanay”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that on state nature reserve “Alkhanay” shall be constituted in Buryat autonomous area with a view of performing the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural sites and objects; (b) preservation of historical and cultural heritage; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) creating conditions for regulated tourism and recreation; (e) development and implementation of scientific methods of nature protection and environmental education; (f) implementation of state environmental monitoring; and (g) restoration of disturbed natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) exploration and mining; (b) modification of hydrogeological regime and soil disturbance; (c) allotment of land plots for horticulture and peri-urban agriculture; (d) construction of main roads, pipelines, power lines and other communications, as well as construction and operation of economic and residential facilities, except for objects of the tourist industry, museums and information centers, objects associated with the functioning of the national park and residential areas located within the boundaries of the national park; (e) timber extraction; (f) procurement of soft resin; (g) commercial hunting; (h) industrial and coastal fisheries; (i) procurement of edible and non-edible non-timber forest resources; (j) disturbance of natural habitats of wild fauna and wild flora; (k) collection of zoological, botanical and mineralogical specimens except for scientific research purposes envisaged by schedules; (l) introduction of live organisms for acclimatization purposes; (m) transit passage and grazing of cattle; (n) logging along watercourses and waterbodies; (o) organization of mass sports and entertainment events, organization of tourist camps and fires outside specially reserved areas; (p) unauthorized archaeological excavations, collection and export objects of historical and cultural heritage; (q) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, hunting gear, as well as with wildlife products, except for authorized officials; (r) explosive works; (s) burning of vegetation; (t) clear cutting; (u) waste disposal; (v) washing, movement and parking of motor vehicles outside common access roads; (w) destruction and damaging of noticeboards, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs and equipped ecological paths and recreation areas; (x) ploughing up; (y) application of toxic chemicals, plant protection means, fertilizers and growth stimulators; and (z) haymaking and stay with dogs (except for service dogs), keeping unleashed dogs and training of dogs.

Policy: Water Law No. 77 of 2018.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 112 articles divided in 10 Sections, aims at regulating, developing, and rationalizing the exploitation of water resources, and protecting them from depletion and pollution and improving the efficiency of transport and distribution systems. It also concerns maintaining and operation of water facilities in order to ensure their sustainable management. The Ministry of Energy and Water has the power to manage public water resources. Article 3 states that every beneficiary shall enjoy any water resource, in a way that does not harm these resources or the interests of others and prohibits the exploitation of groundwater resources without prior authorization. Article 4 lists the general objectives through sustainable water management, such as (i) providing citizens with drinking water; (ii) achieving wastewater disposal; (iii) fighting floods, drought and emergency or chronic pollution; (iv) meet the water requirements for agriculture, livestock, fishing, inland fisheries, mineral water extraction, industry and power generation; (v) conserving and restoring the aquatic environment, as well as terrestrial ecosystems and associated wetlands; and (vi) using, whenever possible, non-traditional water sources. Article 5 recognizes the basic right of every person to obtain the water necessary for his needs, and this justifies obligating the beneficiaries to pay the subscription allowances for their use of water, and includes the sanitation between the elements of the right of water.

Policy: Food Safety Act No.35 of 2015.
Policy_Content: This Act consisting of 47 articles aims at ensuring the safety of food throughout its stages, from the farm to its consumption by humans, and establishing mechanisms to ensure the effective application of these rules. Must comply with it any person engaged in any activity dealing with food or animal feed intended for human consumption or agricultural products. For this reason, anyone who works in the field of food has to verify that the food produced or imported is in conformity with the approved specifications and is suitable for human consumption and does not result harmful to human, animal or environmental health. The Act deals with (i) requirement for farmers, such as use of pesticides, veterinary medicines, fertilizers or feed, safety and quality of plant or animal production, obtainment of the necessary licenses to carry out their activities; (ii) protection of food and feed from pollution during transportation; (iii) safety and hygiene conditions in food sale; (iv) registers to record all information concerning food related operations; (v) necessity of establishing standards to be met in genetically modified foods and vending machines.

Policy: Law No.78 of 2018 on Air Quality Protection.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 33 articles divided in VII Parts aims at reducing air pollution through the air quality management and air pollution sources, addressing and regulating major issues pertaining to local stationary and mobile sources of air pollution. Part II, dealing with Understanding, Monitoring and Assessment, proposes (i) an Assessment Survey ” for understanding the state and cause of ambient air pollution; (ii) the establishment of National Program for Ambient Air Quality Monitoring, composed of stationary and mobile stations; (iii) the establishment of a National Emission Inventory for all ambient air pollution sources and emissions; and (iv) a National Report on Ambient Air Quality. It is necessary also (i) to define limit and alert threshold values pertaining to ambient air quality; and (ii) to define emission limit values of stationary and mobile sources. Part III about the Prevention recommends the development of a National Strategy for Ambient Air Quality Management aiming to improve air quality together with local plans for Ambient Air Quality Management. Part IV concerns Controls that must be performed on Stationary and Mobile Sources of Pollution. Control need to be conducted also through restrictions on fuel trading emissions not compliant with limit values and bad or harmful odors. Part V deals with Information Management, Research and Capacity Building Promotion for the creation of a database on ambient air quality measurements, the information exchange among the local administrations and the development of scientific research on understanding, monitoring, assessment, prevention, controlling and surveillance of ambient air quality pollution.

Policy: Co-operative Societies Law (2018)
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law is to create favourable management conditions for co-operative societies - voluntary associations of persons the purpose of which is to promote efficient implementation of the joint economic interests of members thereof. The society may receive support for rural development if it conforms to the requirements laid down in laws and regulations. The Cabinet shall determine the conformity criteria of societies and the procedures for evaluating such societies. The Ministry of Agriculture shall evaluate the conformity of the society, take a decision to grant the status of conformity or to refuse to grant the status of conformity and to cancel the status of conformity, as well as shall perform supervision of the activity of the conforming societies. The Ministry of Agriculture may delegate the task referred to in Paragraph two of this Section to a private person or another public person in accordance with the procedures laid down in the State Administration Structure Law. If the conformity evaluation has been delegated to a private person or a public person, the decision which has been taken in relation to the State administrative tasks delegated thereto may be contested to the Ministry of Agriculture. The decision of the Ministry of Agriculture may be appealed to the District Administrative Court. The Cabinet shall determine the price list for paid services provided within the scope of the State administrative tasks.

Policy: Law No. XIII-1078 amending Law No. XI-1375 "On energy based on renewable sources".

Article 20 (1) establishes that electricity producers from renewable sources have the right to install power plants using solar energy, wind and biomass energy sources with an installed capacity of up to 10 kW if the plant is set up by a natural person. The total installed power of solar power, wind and biomass energy sources shall not exceed 100 MW, of which: (a) 70 MW of power is allocated to natural persons; and (b) 30 MW of power is allocated to legal persons.

Policy: Ley Nº 30744 - Ley que facilita la inversión en tierras para ganar al mar, ríos y lagos, por causas naturales o artificiales.

La Agencia de Promoción de la Inversión Privada (PROINVERSIÓN) tiene la calidad de organismo promotor de la inversión privada para los proyectos de asociación público-privada y proyectos en activos que se desarrollen para ganar terrenos al mar, ríos y lagos, por causas naturales o artificiales, dada la relevancia nacional de dichos proyectos. De manera previa a la adjudicación del proyecto, PROINVERSIÓN, sin excepción y bajo responsabilidad, debe contar con la opinión de la Autoridad Marítima Nacional o de la Autoridad Portuaria Nacional, según corresponda, sin perjuicio de las demás que se requieran conforme a las normas de la materia. Policy: National Water Policy.
Policy_Content: This National Water Policy provides the guiding principles and broad policy direction for the water sector in Pakistan and deals with some related issues such as climate change threats. Pakistan is rapidly becoming a “water scarce” country. The Policy seeks to respond to this water crisis. It reaffirms the right of all citizens of Pakistan to equal and affordable access to clean drinking water and appropriate sanitation facilities. Irrigated agriculture is the backbone of the country’s economy, and consumes around 95 percent of the nation’s water resources, the balance is used for domestic and industrial requirements. Pakistan is heading towards a situation of water shortage, which poses, among other things, a threat to food security. Another threat is floods caused by Glacial Lake Outburst Floods (GLOF). The objective of the National Water Policy is to take cognizance of the emerging water crisis and provide an overall policy framework and guidelines for a comprehensive plan of action. The Policy is a national framework within which the provinces can develop their master plans for sustainable development and management of water resources. The water resource is a national responsibility but irrigation and agriculture, as well as rural and urban water supply, environment and other water-related subsectors are provincial subjects.

Policy: National Multi-Sector Nutrition Policy 2018–2022.
Policy_Content: The National Multi-Sector Nutrition Policy 2018–2022 has been developed following the review of the National Nutrition Policy and Strategic Plan 2007–2012. The Policy was reviewed through a consultative process that involved a range of stakeholders including the local leaders and communities, line ministries, civil society, development partners, and the private sectors. The process has taken into consideration the lessons learnt, gaps identified and emerging issues. This new Policy aims at ensuring that evidence-based, high impact nutrition interventions are developed and implemented at scale. The Policy will be implemented in line with the overarching National Development Strategy, which considers nutrition as one of the priority area under the social development thematic area. The Policy is aligned with the Scaling Up Nutrition movement, global declarations and commitments, which Malawi is signatory such as the Sustainable Development Goals and the World Health Assembly targets. The Government of Malawi is indebted to all the people and institutions that were involved in reviewing the Policy.

Policy: Strategy for fight against corruption 2018–2019 (Brčko District).
Policy_Content: This publication contains the full text of the Brcko District Strategy for fight against corruption 2018–2019. The Strategy intends to create a general framework for a resolute and comprehensive fight against corruption, which implies the determination of priority areas for action, but also certain starting commitments and ways of acting together. Based on that, the general goal of the Strategy is to establish priorities in the Brčko District of BiH in terms of preventing corruption and fighting corruption, principles and mechanisms of joint action of all implementing entities, and to create, that is, to improve the preconditions for reducing the real and perceived level of corruption and affirm positive social values such as integrity, accountability and transparency. The following strategic goals should be achieved by implementing this Strategy: 1. Prevention of corruption; 2. Anti-corruption; 3. Developing awareness of the harmfulness of corruption and cooperation with civil society; 4. Coordination, monitoring and evaluation of anti-corruption activities.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto reforma el que crea la Comisión Nacional de Patrimonio Cultural Inmaterial (CONAPACI), adscrita al Ministerio de Cultura y Juventud, como un órgano de carácter técnico, encargado de coordinar y asesorar en la salvaguarda, protección y revitalización del patrimonio intangible costarricense. Se entiende por patrimonio cultural inmaterial (o intangible) los usos, representaciones, expresiones, conocimientos y técnicas, así como los instrumentos, objetos, artefactos y espacios culturales que las comunidades, los grupos y en algunos casos los individuos, reconocen como parte integrante de su patrimonio cultural. Este patrimonio cultural inmaterial, que se transmite de generación en generación, es recreado constantemente por las comunidades y grupos en función de su entorno, su interacción con la naturaleza y su historia, infundiéndoles un sentimiento de identidad y continuidad y contribuyendo así a promover el respeto de la diversidad cultural y la creatividad humana.

Policy: Natural Resources Law No. 19 of 2018.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 39 articles aims at natural resources development, together with their sustainable exploitation, and to regulate mining activities. The Law establishes that (i) natural resources are considered property of the State, whether they are on the surface of the earth or in its interior, or in territorial waters, rivers, and inland seas; (ii) it is not permissible to explore, exploit, transfer or trade in natural resources without obtaining a permit or license; (iii) any activities of survey, exploration and exploitation of petroleum, oil shale, coal and strategic minerals shall be conducted in accordance with a Regulation issued for this purpose; (iv) mining is considered a public interest and no survey permit, exploration license or mining right may be granted for Governmental, private or Waqf land unless approved by their owners or by whom authorized on land use (art.12 gives details of related procedures); (v) prior approval and supervision of the related authorities is requested to survey, explore or mine within holy places or antiquity sites, railway lands, municipal areas, and reservoirs, oil and sewage pipelines lands; (vi) it is impermissible for the licensee to possess or obtain water from any lake or sea or river or stream or water passage or dam or underground reservoir or a canal abutting any spot within the license or permit area or passing by it or to divert it from its course without prior approval.

Policy: Executive Decree No. 38/18 approving the Statute of the Local Government of Bié.
Policy_Content: This Executive Decree approves the Statute of the Local Government of Bié Province. Thise Statute, consisting of 47 articles divided into four Chapters and four Annexes, establishes the organization and functioning of the Government of the Bié Province. For the purpose of administrative organization, the Province is structured in Municipalities, Cities, Villages, Communities, Settlements, and Urban Districts. The relations between the local organs of the State Administration at the provincial, municipal and community level are developed in accordance with the principles of unity, hierarchy, subsidiarity and institutional coordination. The Governing Bodies of the Province shall ensure in their territory to carry out economic, social and cultural tasks and programmes of local and national interest, in compliance with the Constitution, Laws and Decisions of the Head of the Executive Branch in the field of Territory Administration, Education, Health, Integrated Economic Development, Trade, Industry and Mineral Resources, Agriculture, Fisheries and Livestock, Social Action, Family and Gender Equality, etc. Chapters deal with: Province Administration; Advisory Bodies of the Provincial Governor; Career of the General Regime - Inspectorate - Social Worker and Organizational Chart of the Provincial Government of Bié.

Policy: Decreto Nº 41086-MAG ─ Reglamento a la Ley Nº 9036, de transformación del Instituto de Desarrollo Agrario (IDA) en el Instituto de Desarrollo Rural (INDER).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Reglamento a la Ley que transforma el Instituto de Desarrollo Agrario (IDA) en el Instituto de Desarrollo Rural (INDER), con el objeto de establecer un marco general que facilite la ejecución eficiente y eficaz de la Ley Nº 9036, al definir sus alcances, orientada al Desarrollo Rural Territorial (DRT), y los mecanismos de coordinación y articulación interinstitucional que sean necesarios para regular las relaciones entre el INDER, los entes públicos, privados y sociedad civil, que participan en el desarrollo rural territorial. Serán beneficiarios las personas jurídicas sin fines de lucro y físicas que cumplan con los principios de la Ley, quienes podrán recibir uno o varios de los bienes y servicios que brinda la Institución a través de los Fondos de Tierras (FT) y del Fondo de Desarrollo Rural (FDR) o cualquier otro beneficio establecido en la Ley Nº 9036 y en el presente Reglamento.

Policy: Decreto Nº 41127-MINAE ─ Crea el Sistema Nacional de Métrica para el Cambio Climático (SINAMECC).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea el Sistema Nacional de Métrica para el Cambio Climático (SINAMECC), que constituye la plataforma oficial de coordinación y vinculación institucional y sectorial del Estado costarricense para facilitar la gestión y distribución del conocimiento e información en materia de cambio climático. El SINAMECC operará como un submódulo del Sistema Nacional de Información Ambiental (SINIA) y estará vinculado al Sistema de Estadística Nacional (SEN). La coordinación, operación y ejecución estará bajo la responsabilidad de la Dirección de Cambio Climático (DCC). El SINAMECC permitirá la compilación y gestión de los datos e información producidos por el Estado en la materia cubierta por este decreto y, cuando sea pertinente, del sector privado, la academia y la sociedad civil y garantizará su divulgación, respetando la confidencialidad de información que posea dicho carácter, de conformidad con la normativa vigente.

Policy: Decreto Ley Nº 358 - Ley sobre la entrega de tierras estatales ociosas en usufructo.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto-Ley autoriza la entrega de tierras estatales ociosas en concepto de usufructo gratuito por tiempo determinado a personas naturales, y por tiempo indeterminado a personas jurídicas, para que las exploten racional y sosteniblemente atendiendo a la aptitud de los suelos, en función de la producción agropecuaria, cañera, forestal y de frutales. A la producción forestal y de frutales se le pueden asociar cultivos diversos y la cría de animales, según resulte conveniente y factible, y conforme a las regulaciones establecidas. La constitución del usufructo se formaliza mediante contrato escrito entre la entidad estatal que tiene la administración de las tierras ociosas y el solicitante, previa aprobación de la entrega mediante Resolución emitida por el Delegado o Director Municipal de la Agricultura, o en su caso, del Delegado o Director Provincial, según lo dispuesto en el Reglamento del presente Decreto-Ley.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 10/2018 creating and approving the Statute of the Institution for Quality of Timor-Leste, IP (IQTL, IP).
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law creates and approves the Statute of the Institution for Quality of Timor-Leste, IP (IQTL, IP). This Statute, consisting of 25 articles divided into four Chapters, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Institution. IQTL, IP, is the national regulatory authority for Qualification, Standardization and Metrology and its mission is to implement, coordinate and manage the national quality system, promote, coordinate and develop actions necessary for its function as a national metrology laboratory. In particular, IQTL, IP is responsible for: Implement, manage and coordinate a national quality system aimed to increased productivity, competitiveness and innovation in the public and private sectors; Propose measures to define national policies relating to the national quality system, for standardization, qualification and metrology; Implement and manage the national metrology laboratory, ensuring the development of national standards of measurement units and their traceability to the International System (SI) and promoting their dissemination throughout the national territory; Manage the legal metrological control system of measuring instruments, recognize competent entities for the delegated exercise of such control; Establish the quality identifying marks of the national quality system; Promote and develop training actions within the scope of quality, namely qualification, standardization and metrology, etc.

Policy: Order No. 150 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on state nature reserve "Olekminsky".
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that on state nature reserve "Olekminsky" shall be constituted in Sakha (Yakutia) with a view of performing the following tasks: (a) protection of natural areas for the purpose of conservation of biological diversity and conservation in the natural state of protected natural complexes and objects; (b) organization and conduct of scientific research, including keeping Annals of nature; (c) performance of state environmental monitoring; (d) ecological education and promotion of cognitive tourism; and (e) assistance in training of scientific research staff and environmental protection personnel. Any activity contrasting the statute of the reserve shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve, including: (a) commercial, artisanal and sport hunting; (b) industrial fisheries; (c) artisanal and sport fishing, except for cases envisaged by this Regulation; (d) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, hunting gear, as well as with wildlife products, except for authorized officials; (e) exploration and mining; (f) soil disturbance; (g) modification of hydrological regime of soil; (h) procurement of soft resin, clear cutting, procurement of non-timber forest resources and medicinal plants; (i) transit passage and grazing of cattle; (j) placement of hives and apiaries; (j) ploughing up, except for forest fire prevention measures; (k) haymaking; (l) construction, reconstruction, repair and operation of capital construction facilities, including line structures, not related to the fulfilment of tasks and the functioning of the reserve; (m) explosive works; (n) burning of vegetation; (o) logging along watercourses and waterbodies; (p) allotment of land plots for housing construction, gardening and horticulture; (q) introduction of wild fauna and wild flora species for acclimatization purposes; (r) application of pesticides, mineral fertilizers and chemical plant protection products and growth stimulants, the use of toxic chemicals for the protection of forests, including for scientific purposes; (s) waste disposal; (t) passage and parking of motor vehicles outside common access roads, navigation of vessels outside watercourses of common access; (u) collection of zoological, botanical and mineralogical specimens; (v) stay with dogs, except for service dogs, keeping unleashed dogs and training of dogs; (w) flight of aircraft and helicopters below 2000 meters above the territory of the reserve; (x) destruction and damaging of noticeboards, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs and equipped ecological paths and recreation areas; and (y) disturbance of wild animal species and feeding thereof by visitors.

Policy: Order No. D1-277 by the Minister of Environment “On the reorganization of environmental departments”.
Policy_Content: The Minister orders reorganization of the regional environmental protection departments subordinated to the Ministry of Environment and to validate the Regulation on Environmental Protection Department under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Environment. Environmental Protection Department shall perform the following tasks: (a) state supervision over environmental protection, except for forest management, afforestation and protection of forests; (b) implementation of the state policy in the sphere of environmental protection (pollution control, rational use of natural resources, waste (except radioactive waste) management), use of chemicals and GMOs the deliberate release thereof into the environment, control of landscape, biodiversity, soil and other natural resources; and (c) prevention of environmental disasters and emergency response coordination. The department shall perform the following functions: (a) control of natural and legal persons performing activities causing environmental impact and managing natural resources; (b) enforcement of environmental legislation and compliance by natural and legal persons with the legislative acts governing environmental protection and requirements related to the management of natural resources; (c) compliance by natural and legal persons with legislative requirements related to subsoil management, surface water and groundwater management, atmospheric air protection, plant protection, wild fauna management; (d) legal proceedings against natural and legal persons for the infringement of the environmental legislation; (e) emissions control; (f) control of natural and legal persons to comply with the emission and release into the environment; (g) supervision over waste formation and waste management, including non-domestic waste (packaging materials); (h) correct application of environmental fees and taxes for environmental pollution; (i) supervision over compliance with the provisions of permits for environmental pollution, environmental protection norms and standards; (j) enforcement of environmental monitoring; (k) application of liability and compensation for the infringement of environmental legislation and environmental damages; and (l) environmental risks analysis.

Policy: Decree No. 266 of the Council of Ministers amending Ministerial Decree No. 2056 regarding state supervision over industrial safety, safe transportation of hazardous substances and ensuring nuclear and radiation safety.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes that the provisions shall not be applicable to enforcement of legislation related to nuclear and radiation safety at nuclear power plants. The competent authority shall conduct planned and unscheduled inspections of compliance by the subjects of supervision with the requirements of normative legal acts in the field of nuclear and radiation safety, as well as measures of technical (technological inspection, verification) character and shall carry out preventive measures. The grounds for conducting unscheduled inspections include: availability of information in possession of the State Nuclear Supervisory Authority (Gosatomnadzor), including information received from state bodies and other organizations, foreign states or individuals, on committed infringement of the requirements of normative of legal acts in the field of nuclear and radiation safety or risk of harm to life and health of citizens, environment, state security; the need to control the removal of violations identified in the result of the previously planned or unscheduled inspection, including the expiry of the period of conceded for removal of violations, issued by the State Nuclear Supervisory Authority (Gosatomnadzor); and the need for rapid assessment of the actual status of subjects of supervision and conditions of their activities, identify and prevent causes and conditions, contributing to the violation of the requirements of regulatory legal acts related to nuclear and radiation safety.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 189 validating the Regulation on the procedure for establishing protection zones, their dimensions, regime of use of land allotted for these purposes, and protection of land of railway transport within the limits of allotted right of way.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree regulates the issues of for determining land area, regime of land tenure of protection zones and protection regime of land of railway transport within the limits of right of way in order to ensure safe operation of the participants of the transportation process. Protection zones of railway transport land are established to ensure the safety of the population and the safe operation of railway infrastructure facilities, the safety, strength and stability of structures, devices and other railway transport facilities in places prone to landslides, flooding, erosion, mudslides and the emergence of mobile sands and other dangerous impacts on land plots adjacent to the lands of the railroad right of way. Protection zones are classified as industrial, transport, communications, energy, defense and other lands. In order to mitigate the negative impact on buildings and structures for housing and civil purposes, sanitary protection zones are established.

Policy: Decree No. 9.334 creating the National Plan for  Strengthening Forest Harvesting and River Bank Communities (Planafe).
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 8 articles, creates the National Plan for the Strengthening the National Plan for  Strengthening Forest Harvesting and River Bank Communities (Planafe). This Plan has the purpose to: integrate and adapt public policies aimed at improving the quality of life and the conservation of the environment of harvesting and river bank communities; and to support the National Policy for the Sustainable Development of Traditional Peoples and Traditional Communities (PNPCT), created by Decree No. 6.040 of 7 February 2007. Planafe will observe the principles and guidelines regarding development, harvest, river bank communities, sustainable development and the environmentally balanced exploitation of socio-biodiversity resources. Planafe objectives are: integrate, adapt, articulate and propose actions to access health policies, education, infrastructure, promotion of sustainable production, income generation, access to territories and natural resources, and environmental and territorial management in areas of traditional use and occupation by harvesting and river bank communities; ensure the basic rights of these communities, with a view to overcoming poverty; promote social participation in the planning, monitoring and evaluation of Planafe; encourage the conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity by harvesting and river bank communities; enable social and productive inclusion of these communities, especially women and youth; increase productivity, with a view to increasing the income of the harvesting and river bank families; develop mechanisms to support the structuring of socio-biodiversity product chains; develop incentives to pay for environmental and ecosystem services provided by these communities; encourage the land regularization of social interest of the territorial spaces occupied by harvesting and river bank communities; and seek sources of financing from international organizations that will allow the increase of Planafe's actions.

Policy: Urban and Regional Planning (No. 5 of 2018).
Policy_Content: This Act establishes a legal framework for spatial planning in Namibia. "Spatial planning” means - (a) the preparation, approval and review of a national spatial development framework, regional structure plan or urban structure plan; (b) preparation, approval and review of zoning schemes; (c) regulation of development; and (d) land management, which is the regulation and management of land use and conferring of land use rights through the use of zoning schemes and other procedures set out in this Act; to facilitate the allocation of land to the uses that provide the greatest sustainable physical, economic and social benefits and well-being. The objects of this Act are to - (a) provide for a uniform, effective and integrated regulatory framework for spatial planning in Namibia; (b) provide for principles and standards of spatial planning; (c) decentralise certain aspects of spatial planning in Namibia; (d) ensure that spatial planning promotes social and economic inclusion; (e) ensure that there is equity in the spatial planning system; (f) redress past imbalances in respect of access to land, land ownership and land allocation; and (g) promote the national land reform objectives.

Policy: Decree No. 247 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on the procedure for the development of flood risk management plan.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for the development of flood risk management plan with a view of reducing potential negative impact of flooding on vital activity of the population, environment, cultural heritage and economic activities. The management plan shall be elaborated for separate areas within the area of the river basin, which have a high risk of flooding. Classification of disasters by risks shall be applicable for classification of the risks of flooding. The management plan shall be elaborated by the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources, the State Water Management Agency and other state bodies concerned. The management plan shall be elaborated in accordance with the results of preliminary assessment of the risks of flooding and maps of flooding risks.

Policy: Law No. 4.247 providing for noise emission requirements and setting levels and times in which it is allowed.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 14 articles, provides for noise emission requirements and sets levels and times in which noise emission is allowed. This Law establishes the procedural norms for the exercise of administrative police power of the State of Rondônia regarding the measurement and control of noise pollution. The disturbance of the public's peace and well-being by the emission of sounds and noise by any sources or activities that disobey the premises established in this Law is prohibited. Maximum levels of sounds and noises from any source and nature in undertakings or commercial activities, of services, public or private, are: 60 decibels, in the nocturnal period; and 55 decibels, during the daytime period. In case of proven sound pollution, technicians of the competent body, in the exercise of the inspection action, have free access to the dependencies where the issuing sources are installed.

Policy: Décret n° 2018-385 du 4 avril 2018 portant création, organisation et fonctionnement du Conseil national du Tourisme.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée auprès du ministre chargé du Tourisme un Conseil national du Tourisme chargé d’assurer la liaison entre les administrations publiques concernées par le tourisme et les opérateurs privés intervenant dans le secteur du tourisme et de l’hôtellerie. Le Conseil national du Tourisme est chargé de : d’organiser des concertations sur les orientations et la stratégie de développement du tourisme définies par le Gouvernement : de proposer des mesures pour la définition de la politique de développement du tourisme : d’évaluer la mise en œuvre de la politique nationale de développement du tourisme. Le Conseil national du Tourisme est saisi par le ministre chargé du Tourisme de toutes question · dont l’examen lui paraît utile pour la réalisation des objectifs du Gouvernement en matière de tourisme et d’hôtellerie. Policy: Statute Law (Miscellaneous Amendments) Act, 2018 (No. 4 of 2018).

A ce texte sont joints 3 annexes (Annexe I : Formulaire de notification des concentration, Annexe II : Formulaire de notification des aides publiques, Annexe III Contenu des demandes d'exemption).

Policy: Order No. 01-7 / 158 of the State Committee of Industry, Energy and Subsoil Management validating the Regulation on state register of minerals and mineral deposits.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the rules and determines the procedure for keeping the state register of mineral deposits. Keeping state register of minerals and mineral deposits is an integral part of the system for recording the state fund of mineral resources. The state register of minerals and mineral deposits shall be administered by the authorized state body for the implementation of the state policy on subsoil management in order to ensure the geological study of the subsoil, the complex use of mineral deposits, as well as other tasks. The state register is a systematized, periodically updated and corrected collection of information drawn up in the form of registration cards related to minerals and mineral deposits, record sheets and record registration forms, characterizing the quantity and quality of the main minerals and other components, mining, hydrogeological, ecological and other conditions of the development of the mineral deposit, its geological and economic assessment, as well as data related to the identified mineral deposits. The following information and data shall be subject to recording in the state register of minerals and mineral deposits: (a) deposits with mineral reserves accounted for by the state balance sheets; deposits, mineral reserves of which are removed from the register of the state balance sheet of mineral reserves; (b) geologically and spatially separated areas of large deposits; manifestations of solid minerals for which the presence of at least one deposit of minerals is established; (c) deposits of all types of groundwater, as well as fields of therapeutic mud, thermal and medicinal water identified in the form of multi-form springs; (c) prospective areas of mineral reserves for which are estimated by category C2; (d) oil and gas deposits; (e) areolas of spreading of geochemical elements, geophysical anomalies, geophysical structures, and groundwater deposits. Record sheets of the state register shall be compiled on special forms according to the models in accordance with annexes 1-14 of this Regulation.
Subject: Mineral resources, Water
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Order No. 140 of the State Nuclear Regulatory Inspectorate validating the Regulation on arrangement and safe operation of localizing security system.
Policy_Content: The objective of this Order shall be prevention of risks and outbreak of technogenic disasters at nuclear power plants with a view of application of safety criteria to pressure reduction systems, heat dissipation, prevention of explosive and fire hazardous gas concentrations, cleaning of the environment of the localization zone of the accident. The Regulation shall be mandatory for all legal entities and natural persons who carry out or plan to carry out activities related to designing, manufacturing, construction (installation), testing and operation of localized security systems of power units of nuclear power plants. To limit emissions into the environment of radioactive substances and ionizing radiation released in the process of an accident beyond the limits of technological systems containing these substances, different localizing security system or their combinations with the installed functions in the project of the power unit are provided. Basic security functions of localizing security system shall be to protect the staff of nuclear power plants and the population against ionizing radiation and the reduction of concentration of radioactive substances in the area of localization of accident.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Executive Decree No. 36/18 approving the Statute of the Local Government of Bengo.
Policy_Content: This Executive Decree approves the Statute of the Local Government of Bengo Province. Thise Statute, consisting of 47 articles divided into four Chapters and four Annexes, establishes the organization and functioning of the Government of the Bengo Province. For the purpose of administrative organization, the Province is structured in Municipalities, Cities, Villages, Communities, Settlements, and Urban Districts. The relations between the local organs of the State Administration at the provincial, municipal and community level are developed in accordance with the principles of unity, hierarchy, subsidiarity and institutional coordination. The Governing Bodies of the Province shall ensure in their territory to carry out economic, social and cultural tasks and programmes of local and national interest, in compliance with the Constitution, Laws and Decisions of the Head of the Executive Branch in the field of Territory Administration, Education, Health, Integrated Economic Development, Trade, Industry and Mineral Resources, Agriculture, Fisheries and Livestock, Social Action, Family and Gender Equality, etc. Chapters deal with: Province Administration; Advisory Bodies of the Provincial Governor; Career of the General Regime - Inspectorate - Social Worker and Organizational Chart of the Provincial Government of Bengo.

Model form of the agreement is contained in the Annex 2. In order to conclude the agreement, the manufacturer submits to the authorized body a written application in an arbitrary form. The accompanying documentation shall include: (a) draft plan and schedule for the implementation of the industrial assembly agreement related to assembly of agricultural machinery with legal entities of the Republic of Kazakhstan in two copies, in the state and Russian languages, in the form according to the Annex 2; (b) information on business entity according to the form contained in the Annex 3; and (c) financial accountability reports with the indication of fixed assets valid at the date of submittal of the application.

Policy: Proclamation to Ratify the Protocol to the African Charter On Human and Peoples' Rights on The Rights of Women in Africa.
Policy_Content: This Proclamation provides for the ratification by Ethiopia of the Protocol to the African Charter On Human and Peoples Rights on The Rights of Women in Africa ("Maputo Protocol"), and specifies the reservations made by Ethiopia when signing the Protocol. Those reservations concern, among other things, marriage and inheritance. The Ministry of Women and Children Affairs of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia is given the responsibility to cooperate with other relevant organs to implement and follow-up the Protocol. The Protocol defines, among other things, the right of women to nutritious and adequate food and requires member States to take action to provide women access to clean drinking water, sources of domestic fuel, land, and the means of producing nutritious food and water. They shall also promote women’s access to and control over productive resources such as land and guarantee their right to property.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 176 validating the Regulation on the procedure for the use of reserve land.
Policy_Content: This Regulation defines the order of use of reserve land. Reserve land shall be considered all land not allotted for ownership or use. Reserve land shall be state property. The main purpose of the use of reserve land is agricultural production, constitution of protected natural territories, subsoil use (development of mineral deposits and construction of infrastructure facilities when using subsoil) and other purposes stipulated by the national legislation. Allotment of reserve land shall be performed by local state administration in accordance with location and territorial belonging of plots of land. The person concerned must submit to the local state administration application containing the following information and data: (a) specific purpose of the intended use of land plot; (b) location and dimensions (area) of land plot; (c) economic and other substantiation for the requested land plot; (d) estimated term and conditions of land plot use; and (e) absence of restrictions for allotment of land plot.
Subject: Land & soil, Mineral resources

Policy_Content: This Order establishes the third amendment of the implementation regime of operations 8.1.1 «Forestry of agricultural and non-agricultural land», 8.1.2 «Installation of agroforestry systems», 8.1.5 «Improving the resilience and environmental value of forests», and 8.1 .6 «Improving the economic value of forests», included in action 8 (Sustainable forestry), of measure 8 «Protection and rehabilitation of forest settlements» of the Mainland Rural Development Programme (PDR 2020). Amendments deal with administrative and legal proceedings; new definitions and requirements, as well as widening of the assistance granted on the basis of the standard unit cost tables and the readjustment of the available appropriations, with the reinforcement of the operation 8.1.5. In addition, it establishes that planned supports, including loss of income and maintenance premiums and other support for action 8.1. «Sustainable forestry» of the PDR 2020 can be combined, subject to the following conditions: a) Eligible investment up to a limit of EUR 2 million per ZIF or waste; b) Eligible investment up to a limit of 2 million euros for public entities and collective forest management entities; c) Eligible investment up to a limit of EUR 1 million for other beneficiaries.

Policy: Order No. 122 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating Forest Management Instruction.
Policy_Content: This Forest Management Instruction establishes the rules for carrying out forest management within the boundaries of forest areas, forest ranges and forest parks containing requirements for the composition, methods, directions and accuracy of forest management in forests located on forest fund lands, defense and security lands, lands of protected areas, and also on lands of inhabited areas on which the urban forests are located. Development of commercial, protection and reserve forests shall be performed within the forestry and forest park on the basis of the analysis of the state and use of forests, the prospects for their development, the development of protected areas, taking into account the documents of territorial planning (the territorial planning scheme of the Russian Federation, the territorial planning scheme of the subject of the Russian Federation, territorial planning schemes of the municipal district, the master plan of the residential area, the general plan of the city district). Based on the results of the design, a list of the forests for the designated purpose and categories of protection forests shall be compiled, containing the following information: (a) the name of the district forestries; (b) numbers of forest quarters or parts thereof; (c) areas of forest quarters or parts thereof expressed in hectares; and (d) the basis for the classification of forests according to their purposeful (specific) use. Forest inventory shall be performed according to the first, second, third taxation categories of forests, which determine the degree of detail and accuracy of the taxation work, depending on the intensity of forest use and the amount of measures taken for conservation, protection and reproduction of forests. Planning of the arrangements for the conservation, protection and reproduction of forests shall be performed for forest subcompartments concurrently with land-based forest valuation on the basis of an assessment of the complex of affecting factors and analysis of the effectiveness of the implementation of measures for the conservation, protection and reproduction of forests. All calculations related to the planning of forest care activities shall be performed on the basis of the results of the distribution of areas and stocks of forest plantations of commercial forest species by age, density, growth, forest species and forest inventory data.
Subject: Forestry
