Policy: Governmental Ordinance No. 138-r "On the main directions of activity of the state institution "Energy Efficiency Fund".
Policy_Content: The main activities of the state institution "Energy Efficiency Fund "shall be as follows: (a) support for energy efficiency initiatives, implementation of energy efficiency measures for buildings and energy saving, in particular in the residential sector in line with the national energy efficiency plan for reduction of volumes, carbon dioxide emissions for the purpose of implementation of the Paris Agreement, implementation of the acquis communautaire of the European Union and the Treaty establishing the Energy Community, ensuring compliance Ukraine's international obligations in the field of energy efficiency; (b) informing the owners (co-owners) of the buildings about the economic benefits the feasibility of implementing energy efficiency measures in order to increase their level of awareness and energy-efficient behavior; (c) involvement of financial contributions and assistance in the form of targeted grants or other methods based on the relevant agreement, in accordance with the Law of Ukraine "On the Energy Efficiency Fund"; (d) cooperation with partner banks in energy efficiency sphere; (e) monitoring, quality control and verification of energy efficiency projects; (f) participation in the development and implementation of legal, financial, organizational incentive and support measures for application of building energy efficiency measures and energy saving; (g) facilitating the reduction of energy consumption by residential customers through subsidies for payment of electricity, natural gas, heat, water and water services drainage, rent (maintenance of houses and structures and adjacent territories), removal of domestic waste and liquid sewage as a result of measures due to energy efficiency of the Fund's programs; and (h) targeted and efficient use of budgetary funds.

Policy: Ley Nº 10.521 - Régimen de Conservación de Áreas Naturales.
Policy_Content: En el marco de la Ley N° 6.964 (Régimen de Conservación de Áreas Naturales de la Provincia de Córdoba), la presente Ley crea la Reserva Forestal Natural Provincial Perisalina de Ambargasta y el Refugio de Vida Silvestre Provincial Salinas de Ambargasta, con los objetivos específicos de : a) preservar, proteger, conservar y recuperar los recursos naturales existentes dentro del área protegida y su manejo a perpetuidad; b) valorar para la sociedad los principales bienes y servicios ambientales que presta el área protegida, derivados de sus condiciones naturales y de las prácticas productivas sustentables que en la misma se desarrollen; c) proveer a la conservación de la diversidad biológica y su hábitat y los recursos naturales como elementos esenciales y atributos de identidad del sistema; d) respetar el estilo de vida y el hábitat del habitante del área, promoviendo su permanencia y valorizando sus costumbres y conocimientos ancestrales; e) impulsar el desarrollo del ecoturismo, como instrumento idóneo para la valoración del área protegida, para la educación, el desarrollo local y el financiamiento para su administración y gestión; f) promover y facilitar la investigación científica y tecnológica sobre el ecosistema, sus atributos y funciones que prestan, con el objeto de mantener y mejorar los servicios ambientales y las prácticas productivas que generan valores tangibles e intangibles para la sociedad en su conjunto; g) promover el desarrollo sustentable de las actividades productivas de modo compatible con la conservación de la biodiversidad y los sistemas naturales incluidos en el área protegida, contribuyendo al desarrollo económico y social dentro de la misma; h) propender al desarrollo.

Policy: Order No. 153 of the Ministry of Internal Affairs validating the Methodology for the development of maps of threats and risks of flooding.
Policy_Content: The objective of this Methodology shall be to establish the procedure for assessing and managing the risks of flooding, minimizing the flood-related negative impacts that have an impact on the health and life of people, the environment, the economy, and cultural heritage. The accuracy of the mapping of selected areas with potentially significant flood risks for areas of Ukraine's river basins is determined by preliminary flood risk assessment as territories with high or very high flood risk (with existing potentially significant flood risks or with potentially significant flood risks) should provide the necessary quantitative and qualitative analysis for the needs of preliminary assessment of flood risks in accordance with the Water Code of Ukraine. Displays of threats and risks of flooding (sources and scenarios of flooding) shall include: (a) maps of threats and risks of flooding developed for types of flooding that have established compliance with emergencies and their classification characteristics and assessed during the preliminary assessment of flood risks as territories with potentially significant flood risks; (b) maps of threats and risks of flooding that show areas with potentially significant flood risks, in particular from the following types of sources of flooding: 1) river source of flooding (flooding with river water); 2) atmospheric precipitation as a source of flood; 3) groundwater as a source of flooding; 4) seawater as a source of flooding (flooding by sea); 5) artificial structures as a source of flood; and 6) other sources of flood (if indicated); (c) maps of threats and flood risks containing information on areas that can be flooded in accordance with the following scenarios: 1) flood with a low probability - flooding, which can occur no more than once every 500 years (0,2%); 2) flood with an average probability - flooding, which can occur no more than once every 100 years (1%); 3) flood with high probability - flooding, which can occur no more than once every 10 years (10%); and (d) the development of maps of threats and risks of flooding from such types of sources of flood as seawater or artificial structures limited to a flood scenario with a low probability and only for areas where there is an appropriate level of protection; the development of maps of threats and risks of flooding caused by groundwater is limited to a flood scenario with low probability.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Order No. 154 of the Ministry of Internal Affairs validating the Procedure for monitoring the content of arsenic, cadmium, mercury, nickel and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons in the atmosphere.
Policy_Content: This Procedure is designed to take into account the target values of arsenic, cadmium, mercury, nickel and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons in the air to avoid, prevent or reduce their harmful effects on human health and the environment. It shall be applicable in the process of assessment of the air pollution level. Targets are used to determine the level of atmospheric air pollution by arsenic, cadmium, nickel and benzo(a)pyrene, which is a marker of carcinogenic risk for the content of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons. The evaluation of the contents of arsenic, cadmium, nickel, and benzo(a)pyrene is carried out by the state system of hydrometeorological observations and authorized laboratories in zones and agglomerations throughout the territory of Ukraine. According to the results of the measurements made shall be drafted: (a) a list of zones and agglomerations in which the levels of arsenic, cadmium, nickel and benzo(a)pyrene are lower than the corresponding targets; (b) lists of zones and agglomerations where the target indicators are exceeded; for such zones and agglomerations, areas of excess and sources of emissions are indicated; and (c) lists of zones and agglomerations, where the excess was due to the action of natural sources and the resuspension of PM10 particles.

Policy: Décret n° 2018-129 du 28 février 2018 portant mise en place du Comité d'Orientation et de Suivi du Programme National Foncier.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret met en place un Comité d’Orientation et de Suivi(COS) en vue de la concrétisation du Programme national Foncier (PNF) et de la mise en œuvre et la Nouvelle lettre de Politique Foncière (NLPF). Le COS a pour mission de vérifier la cohérence des activités du Programme National Foncier avec les orientations de la Lettre de Politique Foncière et d'assurer l’articulation et la synergie des opérations et investissements sectoriels nécessitant l’usage des terrains avec les règles et procédures de la procédure de la législation foncière. Le COS assure l'opérationnalisation effective des dispositifs institutionnels de la gestion foncière déconcentrés et décentralisés, dans la mise en œuvre des activités définies dans le Programme National Foncier (PNF) en cohérence avec les orientations et les axes stratégiques prescrites dans la NLPF. Ses activités sont axées sur 3 points principaux, le COS est ainsi chargé de: assurer la concrétisation, étapes par étapes, des activités du PNF; veiller à l'articulation et à la synergie des opérations et investissements sectoriels nécessitant l'usage des terrains avec les règles et procédures de la législation foncière en vigueur ; garantir le respect des accords de financement en matière foncière, conclus avec les Partenaires Techniques et Financiers ainsi que des traites internationaux concernant le secteur du foncier que Madagascar a signés et ratifiés. Le COS constitue un comité multisectoriel compose de membres désignés d'office et de référents issus des institutions publiques et des représentants du secteur prive émanant des différents acteurs, ainsi que des Partenaires Techniques et Financiers impliques dans le processus de la réforme foncière.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Decree No. 149 of the Cabinet of Ministers “On measures for large-scale introduction of market mechanisms in agriculture”.
Policy_Content: This Decree introduces state-guaranteed purchase prices for raw cotton (Annex 1), spiked cereals (Annex 2), the amount of state-guaranteed credits for cultivation of raw cotton (Annexes 3-1 — 3-14 and 4-1 — 4-14) and state-guaranteed credits for cultivation of spiked cereals (Annexes 5-1 — 5.14 and 6-1 — 6-14). Its establishes that beginning from 1 March 2018 trade of mineral fertilizers shall be performed exclusively through exchange trades, specifying terms and conditions of exchange trade. Annex 8 contains Regulation on crediting of farmers cultivating raw cotton and spiked cereals. Commercial banks shall open credit lines for borrowers to finance their costs for growing raw cotton and spiked grain crops on terms of fixed deadlines, repayment, payment, security and specific targeted use of credits. Loans shall be allocated for the following purposes: (a) payment of wages, taxes and other obligatory payments; (b) purchase of mineral fertilizers and chemical plant protection means; (c) purchase of fuels and lubricants; (d) payment for seed; (e) payment for mechanized services rendered by business entities, regardless of ownership, possessing agricultural machinery; (f) payment of leasing payments for agricultural equipment supplied under leasing terms (financial leasing); (g) payment for the services of water user associations (WUAs); (h) payment for the supplied electricity; and (i) payment of other costs and needs related to the cultivation of raw cotton and spiked cereals.

Policy: Presidential Resolution No. PP-3574 “On measures for radical improvement of financing production of raw cotton and spiked cereals.
Policy_Content: The President, in order to introduce large-scale market relations and radically improve the mechanisms of financing and settlement payments in agriculture, improve the financial and economic situation on this basis, improve the profitability of agricultural producers and their enterprises, ensure a sustainable growth in the volume of output, decrees to establish beginning from 1 March 2018 government-guaranteed prices for the purchase of raw cotton and spiked cereals applicable to varieties and classes that increase the profitability of producers and stimulate the cultivation of high-quality products; government purchase order shall not be applicable to raw cotton on lands with low soil fertility and yields of less than 15 quintals per hectare over the last 3 years. Debt of farms growing raw cotton and spiked cereals, formed as of 1 January 2018, related to servicing organizations, including intra-sectoral debt, as well as debt related to state budget and public trust funds shall be postponed and shall be applied writing off the accrued penalties and fines.

Policy: Decreto Nº 342/2018 - Aprueba el Reglamento del Decreto Ley Nº 290 sobre las invenciones y dibujos y modelos industriales.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Reglamento del Decreto Ley Nº 290 sobre las invenciones y dibujos y modelos industriales. Este Reglamento, que consta de 128 artículos divididos en dos Títulos, tiene por objeto regular la protección de las invenciones, ya sea por patentes o por modelos de utilidad, y de los dibujos y modelos industriales, a través de la concesión de derechos de propiedad industrial. El Decreto regula los siguentes sectores con respecto a invenciones y dibujos y modelos industriales: presentación de solicitudes de patentes y registros; documentos que acreditan el derecho de prioridad; conversión de la forma de protección; invenciones no accesible al público; inscripción de la solicitud; remuneración a inventores o autores; requerimientos oficiales; procedimiento de concesión licencias obligatorias; certificaciones, etc.

Policy: Decreto Nº 343/2018 - Del Sistema de Propiedad Industrial.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto tiene por objeto establecer los principios, objetivos, bases e indicaciones para el diseño e implantación del Sistema de Propiedad Industrial de la República de Cuba. El Sistema de Propiedad Industrial constituye el conjunto de relaciones funcionales para la gestión de la propiedad industrial en la República de Cuba y en otros mercados de interés, que se fundamenta en los principios de política, normas nacionales, tratados y acuerdos internacionales suscritos en la materia; está integrado por la Oficina Cubana de la Propiedad Industrial como órgano rector y los actores del Sistema, que comprende, entre otros, a los órganos, organismos de la Administración Central del Estado, organizaciones superiores de dirección empresarial, entidades nacionales, empresas y entidades. La Oficina Cubana de la Propiedad Industrial, como parte de la función rectora en el Sistema, dirige, ejecuta y controla la política del Estado y el Gobierno en materia de propiedad industrial, a nombre del Ministerio de Ciencia, Tecnología y Medio Ambiente, al tiempo que propicia la integración con los actores del Sistema.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen.

Policy: Decreto Nº 341/2018 - Decreto de la Oficina Cubana de la Propiedad Industrial.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto refuerza la Oficina Cubana de la Propiedad Industrial (OCPI), constituída como entidad autofinanciada, con personalidad jurídica y patrimonio propio, adscrita al Ministerio de Ciencia, Tecnología y Medio Ambiente. Esta Oficina es rectora del Sistema de Propiedad Industrial; tiene la misión de conferir el registro de los derechos de Propiedad Industrial en la República de Cuba y prestar servicios científico-tecnológicos especializados en la materia, para contribuir al desarrollo de la ciencia, la tecnología y la innovación, la inversión nacional y extranjera, la industria y el comercio. Dicha Oficina tiene las funciones siguientes: elaborar, proponer y ejecutar tanto la política sobre el Sistema de Propiedad Industrial, así como la legislación en materia de propiedad industrial; asesorar al Estado, el Gobierno, la Administración Central del Estado y otras entidades, en la materia; representar a Cuba ante la Organización Mundial de la Propiedad Intelectual y demás organizaciones internacionales, en temas relacionados con la propiedad industrial; proponer la adhesión o renuncia de Cuba a los acuerdos internacionales en materia de propiedad industrial; velar por el cumplimiento de las obligaciones de los acuerdos internacionales; conferir y tramitar el registro de los derechos de propiedad industrial; prestar servicios científico-tecnológicos tanto basados en la información tecnológica, legal y comercial de propiedad industrial, así como para asesorar los proyectos de inversión nacional y extranjera, contratos de transferencia de tecnología, acuerdos de transferencia de material biológico, acuerdos gubernamentales y de colaboración económica y científico-técnica, así como otros proyectos que involucran la propiedad industrial; preservar el acervo documental de la propiedad industrial; realizar la promoción y difusión de la actividad de propiedad industrial; organizar la formación académica de postgrado sobre esta materia; establecer acuerdos de cooperación en la materia con otras instituciones nacionales y extranjeras; aplicar las tarifas para el registro de las modalidades; orientar las secciones provinciales y puestos de trabajo de propiedad industrial en las provincias; regular la actividad de los agentes oficiales; y compilar las estadísticas sobre la propiedad industrial.

Policy: Décret n° 2018-224 du 28 février 2018 portant ratification et publication de l’Accord cadre portant création de l’Alliance solaire internationale (ASI) signé le 15 novembre 2016, à Marrakech au Maroc.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret ratifie et publie l’Accord cadre portant création de l’Alliance solaire internationale (ASI) signé le 15 novembre 2016, à Marrakech au Maroc. Les Parties, à travers ASI, coopèrent pour apporter une réponse collective aux principaux obstacles communs à un déploiement d'énergie solaire à l'échelle de leurs besoins. Policy: Order No. 74 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on the requirements for the content of the program of industrial environmental control, the procedure and deadlines for submitting a report on the organization and the results of the implementation of industrial environmental control.
Policy_Content: This Order validates the Program of industrial environmental control that shall be developed and approved by legal entities and individual entrepreneurs performing economic and (or) other activities in Category I, II and III facilities (high, moderate and insignificant environmental impact), for each facility, taking into account its category, technologies and features of the production process, as well as the negative impact on the environment. Legal persons and individual entrepreneurs subject to Federal state ecological supervision must submit report to the territorial body thereof. The Program must contain sections: (a) general provisions; (b) information on the inventory of emissions of pollutants into the atmosphere and their sources; (c) information on the inventory of discharges of pollutants into the environment and their sources; (d) information on the inventory of non-domestic and domestic waste and their location; (e) information on units and (or) officials responsible for the implementation of industrial environmental control; (f) information on internal and (or) external testing laboratories (centers) accredited in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation on accreditation in the national accreditation system; and (g) information on the frequency and methods of industrial environmental control, sampling points and measurement methodology (methods).

Policy: Petroleum Products Law No.11 of 2018.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 36 articles aims to divide powers and competences between the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources and the Energy and Minerals Regulatory Commission (EMRC) regarding the production, circulation and management of petroleum products in Jordan. The Ministry handles the following powers and mandates (i) prepare and develop the strategy and policy of the sector and submit them to the Council of Ministers for approval; (ii) care for the Kingdom’s interests in the sector at regional and international level; (iii) encourage investment and competition in the sector; (iv)  adopt the necessary measures to maintain a strategic reserve of crude oil and petroleum products, including the method of managing this reserve and how to finance it, and identify the procedures related to the implementation of the contingency plan to supply petroleum products; (v) contribute to building an integrated information system; (vi) develop draft laws related to the Sector. EMRC handles the following powers and mandates (i) grant permits or licenses; (ii) control the permit holder and the licensee to ensure their compliance with the provisions of this Law; (iii) participate in developing standard specifications or technical rules of plant, facilities, and materials related to the work of the Sector; (iv) take part in setting the necessary requirements for meeting the environmental conditions to be satisfied by the plants and facilities.In particular, the Council of Commissioners handles the following powers and mandates (i) issue licenses and permits in connection with the import, sale, export, transport, storage, and refining of crude oil, petroleum products,  biofuel, or coal; (ii) set principles and criteria related to the sector; (iii) set proper performance rules, safety, security, and sustainability criteria.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Resolución Nº 68-2018 ─ Establece el Sistema de Trazabilidad y Control Forestal del Ministerio de Ambiente.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución establece el Sistema de Trazabilidad y Control Forestal del Ministerio de Ambiente y modifica Reglamento de la Ley Forestal de la República de Panamá, entre otras cosas, añadiendo el Título II sobre el aprovechamiento forestal de troncos sumergidos, y el Título III sobre Control de la Producción Firestal, cuyo capítulo 1 establece el Sistema de Trazabilidad y Control Forestal (STCF), el cual dispone que el Ministerio de Ambiente implementará, en el menor tiempo posible un STCF, habilitando progresivamente las regiones que se encuentren preparadas para hacer uso del sistema. Este sistema permitirá la gestión responsable del bosque y plantaciones forestales privadas y del Estado con el objetivo de dar seguimiento al flujo de la madera desde el bosque, lago y plantaciones forestales a los patios de acopio internos y externos, industrias y/o empresas de transformación y comercialización, por medio del registro de la información desde el sitio del aprovechamiento, conforme a un plan de manejo forestal; permiso anual de corta; plan de abastecimiento, procesamiento y comercialización; plan de reforestación y el control estadístico. En las regiones habilitadas no podrá efectuarse el aprovechamiento y movilización de los productos forestales sin el uso del STCF, de conformidad con las condiciones y excepciones establecidas por MIAMBIENTE.

Policy: Hibah Order, 2018.
Policy_Content: This Order provides for the law governing the transfer of the possession of a property of the donor made voluntarily and without any consideration by the donor to the donee during the lifetime of the donor (so called hibah). Any provision in this Order that is inconsistent with Hukum Syara shall be invalid to the extent of such inconsistency. In relation to any matter which is not expressly provided for in this Order, the Syariah Court shall apply Hukum Syara. All words and expressions used in this Order and not defined therein but defined in the Interpretation and General Clauses Act (Chapter 4) shall have the meanings respectively assigned thereto in that Act to the extent that they do not conflict with Hukum Syara. This Order applies to all matters in which at least one of the parties professes the Islamic religion. A hibah shall not be valid unless: a) the property belongs to the donor; b) declaration of the hibah is made, either expressly or impliedly, by or on behalf of the donor; c) acceptance of the hibah is made, either expressly or impliedly, by or on behalf of the donee; d) the possession of the property is delivered by the donor to the donee either physically or symbolically depending on the nature of such property; e) the property is a determinate property and not its usufruct only; and f) the property exists at the time the hibah is made.

Policy: Governor Regulation of Central Java No. 16 of 2018 concerning Instructions for Implementing Regional Regulations of Central Java Province No. 5 of 2016 Concerning Protection and Empowerment of Farmers.
Policy_Content: This Governor Regulation, consisting of 36 articles divided into twelve Chapters, establishes Instructions for Implementing Regional Regulations of Central Java Province No. 5 of 2016 concerning Protection and Empowerment of Farmers. The scope of this Regulation includes: a) procedures for approving the use of land owned by the region for the purpose of agricultural land; b) certainty of farming and guarantee of marketing of agricultural products; c) early warning system and coping with climate change impacts; d) insurance; e) procedures for granting, quantities and requirements for the introduction of assistance and subsidies; f) counseling; g) Facilitation assistance granting free state land designated as agricultural areas; and h) Young farmer generation empowerment. It lays down the Procedures for Approval of Regional Land Use for Agricultural Purpose as follows: 1) Local governments provide guarantees for the provision of agricultural land using regional land for agricultural purposes. Early warning system is submitted periodically as follows: a) climate information every month by the Bureau of Meteorology, Climatology and Geophysics (BMKG); b) Planting calendar every month by the Institute for Agricultural Technology Assessment (BPTP); c) Forecasting Plant Pest Organisms every season by the Department of Agriculture and Plantations of Central Java Province; d) Flood alert information, Drought and pest attack every month by the Department of Agriculture and Plantations of Central Java Province; e) Information on outbreaks of animal diseases is transmitted every month by the Department of Animal Husbandry and Animal Health, Central Java Province.

Policy: Order No. 64 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Procedure for examination of  applications for obtaining the right to use of subsoil for the extraction of groundwater used for potable water supply or technological supply of water to industrial facilities or agricultural facilities, in subsoil plot not classified as those of local significance, or for geological exploration of subsoil plots, not classified as subsoil plots of local significance, for the purposes of prospecting and assessing groundwater deposits and its extraction.
Policy_Content: This Order regulates the Procedure for examination of applications for obtaining the right to use of subsoil for the extraction of groundwater used for potable water supply or technological supply of water to industrial facilities or agricultural facilities, in subsoil plot not classified as those of local significance, or for geological exploration of subsoil plots, not classified as subsoil plots of local significance, for the purposes of prospecting and assessing groundwater deposits and its extraction. The issuance of permits for the right of use of subsoil for the aforesaid purposes shall be the competence of the ad-hoc Commission set up by the Federal Agency on Subsoil Management. The applicant must file the application containing the following data: (a) name and legal form, location of legal person intending obtain the right of use of a plot of subsoil; (b) surname, name, patronymic (if any), place of residence, data of an identity document - for an individual entrepreneur intending obtain the right to use of a plot of subsoil; (c) requisites for the conclusion of state expertise of stocks mineral, geological, economic and environmental information on the areas of subsoil destined for allotment for use; (d) copies of constituent documents, sealed  by the applicant (if the seal is available) and by the signature of the authorized person – for legal entity; (e) information on the financial capabilities of the applicant regarding performance of works related to the planned use of subsoil; (f) documentation attesting availability of technological equipment and qualified staff; (g) proposals of the applicant related to extraction of groundwater for potable water supply and for technological uses; (h) map of subsoil plot destined for extraction of groundwater; (i) date referred to technological indices for extraction of groundwater; (j) consent of subsoil manager (in case of request of use of already allotted subsoil plot); (k) copy of certificate of state registration of a natural person as individual entrepreneur; (l) taxpayer identification data; (m) copy of certificate of registration of legal entity in the Unified state register of legal entities; (n) certificate of waterworks (if available); and (o) copy of the conclusion of state expertise of groundwater deposits attesting reliability and correctness of the assessment of groundwater deposits.

Policy: Governor’s Decree No. 22 validating the Regulation on protection zone of nature monument of regional significance “Steppe slopes and forests along the Picha River”.
Policy_Content: The scope of creation of protection zone of nature monument of regional significance “Steppe slopes and forests along the Picha River” shall be prevention of adverse anthropogenic effects thereon. The protection zone shall be located on land of state forest fund and land of inhabited areas of the local municipal units. The boundaries of protection zone are indicated on site around the perimeter by special warning signs and notice boards. Any activities causing negative (adverse) impact on natural complexes of nature monument shall be prohibited, in particular: (a) placement of cemeteries, cattle burial grounds, domestic and non-domestic waste disposal, radioactive, chemical, explosive, toxic, poisonous and hazardous substances disposal; (b) aerial measures for combating pests and plant diseases; (c) placement of gas stations, fuel and lubricant warehouses, service stations used for technical inspection and repair of vehicles, and washing of motor vehicles; (d) placement of special storage points for pesticides and agrochemicals and application thereof; (e) discharge of effluent and drainage water; (f) exploration and mining of widespread minerals; (g) timber extraction if it entails damages to nature monument; (h) damaging forest plantations, vegetation and soil cover; and (i) making fires, organization of rest areas, bivouacs, tourist stations, camps (except for specially equipped areas) and staging points. The following activities shall be authorized within the boundaries of protection zone: (a) recreational development; (b) scientific research; (c) ecological education; (d) collection of berries, mushrooms, fruits, edible nuts by citizens for individual personal needs without disturbance of natural growing conditions thereof and within authorized time periods; and (e) performance of the arrangements for conservation and reproduction of wild fauna and wild flora species, rare and endangered species of mushrooms, wild fauna and wild flora.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Law No. 1506 “On grain and products of its processing”.
Policy_Content: This Law defines the legal, organizational and economic basis for the circulation of grain and products of its processing, quality requirements for grain destined for food, as well as for animal feeding and seed production in the Republic of Tajikistan. Grain classification is carried out on the basis of a set of biological and technological indicators in accordance with the standards and technical regulations regarding grain and products of its processing. The objectives of this Law shall be as follows: (a) reducing consumer dependence on the external grain market, achieving a balance between the required and actual levels of grain production; (b) the establishment of the legal framework of the state control system of the turnover of grain and products of its processing in order to create favorable conditions for economic entities; (c) promotion of commercialization, the turnover of grain and products of its processing, the development of the grain market and the formation of a competitive environment; (d) establishing the order of quantitative and qualitative accounting of grain and its products; and (e) assistance in optimizing the production structure of grain by adaptation thereof to the climatic conditions and market conditions, improving the production technology, storage and sale of grain and products of its processing. The circulation of grain and products of its processing shall be based on the following principles: (a) guaranteed interests of citizens and environmental protection; (b) efficiency and free competition in the production of grain and products of its processing; (c) accounting and reporting in the production of grain and products of its processing; (d) the use of modern technologies for the production of grain and products of its processing; (e) informational transparency regarding the turnover of grain and products of its processing; (f) forecasting and planning for the production of grain and products of its processing; and (g) ensuring compliance with standards and technical regulations, labor safety and environmental protection requirements. Sowing of grain shall be performed with the consideration of selection achievements, zoning of its varieties, as well as a complex of modern agrotechnological measures. This Law consists of 6 Chapters divided into 34 Articles. Chapter 1 lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 regards circulation of grain and products of its processing. Chapter 3 regards state regulation and support of circulation of grain and products of its processing. Chapter 4 regards quality of grain and products of its processing. Chapter 5 regards state reserves of grain and products of its processing. Chapter 6 lays down final provisions.

Policy: Decreto Nº 41032-PLAN-MINAE-RE ─ Oficialización de la Política Nacional de Producción y Consumo Sostenible.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto oficializa, para efectos de aplicación obligatoria, la Política Nacional de Producción y Consumo Sostenible, la cual se ejecutará entre los años 2018-2030, que tiene como objetivo adoptar gradualmente patrones de producción y consumo sostenible que contribuyan al bienestar de la población en general y de las generaciones futuras, mediante la articulación de los instrumentos de planificación nacional en un marco de coordinación interinstitucional e intersectorial. La presente Política está conformada por 7 ejes estratégicos, que son: Producción Sostenible (no alimentaria), Sistemas Agroalimentarios Sostenibles, Turismo Sostenible, Estilos de Vida Sostenibles, Construcción Sostenibles, Compras Públicas Sostenibles, y un último eje de Fortalecimiento Institucional. Adicionalmente, se han identificado 2 ejes transversales por la estrecha relación con los demás ejes estratégicos, estos son la generación de empleos verdes y la aplicación de las tecnologías de información y comunicación (TICs).

Policy: Orden APM/189/2018 - Determina cuando los residuos de producción procedentes de la industria agroalimentaria destinados a alimentación animal, son subproductos con arreglo a la Ley de residuos y suelos contaminados.
Policy_Content: La presente Orden determina cuando los residuos de producción procedentes de la industria agroalimentaria destinados a alimentación animal, son considerados subproductos con arreglo a la Ley de residuos y suelos contaminados. Los requisitos para la consideración como subproductos de los residuos de producción procedentes de la industria agroalimentaria, son que los residuos de producción procedentes de la industria agroalimentaria, cuando se destinen a alimentación animal y estén incluidos en uno de los tres listados comunitarios de sustancias autorizadas para la alimentación animal, serán considerados subproductos, conforme a lo establecido en el artículo 4º de la Ley de residuos y suelos contaminados, siempre y cuando cumplan todos y cada uno de los requisitos establecidos en la legislación europea, estatal y autonómica relativas a la alimentación animal. En caso de que los requisitos mencionados no se cumplan, los residuos de producción procedentes de la industria agroalimentaria no serán considerados subproductos conforme a la Ley de residuos y suelos contaminados, y por tanto no podrán ser destinados a alimentación animal, debiendo gestionarse conforme a lo establecido en la Ley con el fin de asegurar su correcta gestión y proteger adecuadamente la salud humana y el medio ambiente.

Policy_Content: This Regulation defines the procedure for the performance of hydrometeorological activities of an authorized body in the field of hydrometeorology, which includes keeping hydrometeorological information by the authorized body in the field of hydrometeorology of the State Hydrometeorological Register of Producers (individuals and legal entities); determines the procedure for the provision by natural and legal persons with hydrometeorological information of environmental monitoring and information products, and also determines the procedure for performance of hydrometeorological activities of an authorized body in the field of hydrometeorology together with departmental hydrometeorological organizations and services, legal entities and individuals. Departmental hydrometeorological organizations and services, legal entities and individuals engaged in hydrometeorological activities, have the right to conduct hydrometeorological observations and monitoring of the state of the environment exclusively for official use. The release of various types of information and forecast products, as well as its distribution, shall be prohibited. Producers of hydrometeorological information (departmental hydrometeorological organizations and services, legal entities and individuals performing hydrometeorological activities) that are not part of the State Hydrometeorological Service, must pass state registration of producers of hydrometeorological information in the authorized body in the field of hydrometeorology (in the State Register).

Policy: Resolución Conjunta 1/2018 – Buenas Prácticas Agrícolas. Productos fitosanitarios.
Policy_Content: Por medio de la presente Resolución Conjunta, el Ministerio de Agroindustria y el Ministerio de Ambiente y Desarrollo Sustentable determinan, en el marco de sus respectivas competencias y en el contexto del dominio originario de los recursos naturales que corresponde a las jurisdicciones provinciales, que las actividades de aplicación de productos fitosanitarios para la agricultura en la actividad agrícola en general, y en especial en zonas de amortiguamiento o “buffer”, deben realizarse conforme a buenas prácticas agrícolas y sujetas a sistemas de control y monitoreo adecuados. Asimismo crean el Grupo de Trabajo Interministerial sobre Buenas Prácticas en materia de Aplicaciones de Fitosanitarios con el objeto de elaborar los principios que deben regir las políticas públicas nacionales de sus respectivas competencias, sobre las aplicaciones de fitosanitarios en la agricultura y la alimentación, y de formular recomendaciones respecto de cómo mejorar la adopción de las buenas prácticas de aplicación de fitosanitarios.

Policy: Presidential Decision No. 14/18 creating the Interministerial Commission whose objective is to promote the registration of Rural Land in favour of Local Communities.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decision creates the Interministerial Commission, whose objective is to promote the registration of Rural Land in favour of Local Communities. The Commission, coordinated by the Minister of State and Chief of the President's Civil House of the Republic, is responsible for surveying these lands, analyse their use and promote the granting of land rights. Policy: Decree-Law No. 12/2018 approving the Statute of the Agency for the Integrated Management of Rural Fire (AGIF).
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law approves the Statute of the Agency for the Integrated Management of Rural Fire (AGIF). The reformulation of the principles for the forest fire protection system, which reflects the current concept of Protection of the Forest against Fire (DFCI) for Protection of Rural Fire (DCIR), is based on the Integrated Management System for Rural Fire (SGIFR), aimed at the protection and sustainability of forest areas (GFR), and for the safeguarding of people and property (Rural Fire Protection - PCIR). AGIF, IP, has as its mission the strategic planning and coordination and evaluation of the Integrated Management of Rural Fire Management System (SGIFR), through the integration of public policies with effects on the accumulation of vegetal fuel, the behavior of the population and the activity of the agents, the planning, control and evaluation of the system, including knowledge management, promotion of the specialization and professionalization of SGIFR agents, evaluation of operations and qualified intervention in high risk events, with the objective of contribute to increase the level of protection of people and property and the resilience of the country to rural fires and reducing their impact on the ecosystems and the economic and social development of the country.

Policy: Order No. 82 of the Ministry of Agrarian Policy and Food validating the Regulation on the procedure for compilation and submittal of requests for information managed by the State Agency of Forest Resources or its territorial bodies and forms of the requests.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for compilation and submittal of requests for information managed by the State Agency of Forest Resources or its territorial bodies and forms of the requests. Access to information shall be ensured through provision of public information in accordance with submitted request for access to public information and open data. Requests for access to information can be submitted by natural persons, legal persons and non-governmental associations of citizens. Request for access to information can be either individual or collective. Written request for public information can be filed either in arbitrary form or by filling in the appropriate forms of queries. All the filed requests for information shall be registered by the State Agency of Forest Resources or its territorial bodies. Maximum period of examination of the request shall be 20 working days. Annexes contain the forms of requests for public information.

Policy: Décret n° 2018-050 du 15 février 2018 portant création et mise en place de l’Unité Chargée de la Politique de développement des Energies Renouvelables (UC/PDER).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée une Unité Chargée de la Politique de développement des Energies Renouvelables (UC/PDER). L'Unité Chargée de la Politique de développement des Energies Renouvelables a pour mission d'apporter de l’assistance technique au Gouvernement dans la définition de la politique de développement des énergies renouvelables et dans la supervision de sa mise en œuvre.  A ce titre, elle est chargée de: effectuer des études en vue de l’élaboration et de la mise à jour de la politique de développement des énergies renouvelables et de l’efficacité énergétique; faire le suivi de la mise en œuvre de la politique de développement des énergies renouvelables et de l’efficacité énergétique; apporter du conseil ou de l’assistance technique en matière de contrôle de la qualité de l’exploitation des infrastructures de production et de distribution des énergies renouvelables; apporter une assistance à maitrise d'ouvrage pour tous travaux, opérations au projets relatifs à la politique de développement des énergies renouvelables et de l’efficacité énergétique.  Les activités de l'Unité seront menées en synergie avec les structures gouvernementales compétentes notamment le Ministère en charge de l'Energie.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Order No. 57 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Administrative Regulation related to performance by the government authority of a subject of the Russian Federation in the field of forest relations of state function for state expertise of forest management projects related to public forest.
Policy_Content: This Administrative Regulation establishes the terms and sequence of administrative procedures (actions) of the state authority of a subject of the Russian Federation in the field of forest relations when providing the state service for state expertise of forest management projects related to public forest. Applicants shall be natural and legal persons, including state and municipal institutions, state enterprises, and historical heritage centres of the presidents of the Russian Federation, which has ceased to exercise their powers, to which forest plots were allotted for permanent (unlimited) use or on lease. Information related to the provision of the aforesaid state service shall be public. Provision of state service shall be performed by the authorized government bodies. The result of state service shall be the issuance of the conclusion of state expertise that can be either positive or negative. The applicant shall file application containing the following information and data: (a) application containing full and abbreviated name and legal form of the applicant, taxpayer identification number, motivation code for registration with the tax authorities, location and postal address, bank account details for the legal entity; surname, name, patronymic, address of the place of residence (registration), data of the identity document - for the natural persons; (b) date, registration number of forest plot lease contract or the right of permanent (unlimited) management of a forest plot, cadastral number of forest plot; (c) location, area of forest plot, type and time period of forest management; and (d) information and data related to forest management project.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 94 validating the Regulation on the issues of medical waste management and handling of mercury-containing products in healthcare organizations of the Kyrgyz Republic.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree regulates the issues of medical waste management and handling of mercury-containing products in healthcare organizations with a view of ensuring sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population, preventing harmful effects on human health and environment and improving systematization of the rules for handling waste from healthcare organizations. It determines the requirements for separation, collection, packaging, labeling, accounting, storage, transportation, decontamination and/or disposal of all types of medical waste, as well as other waste generated in healthcare organizations, with the exception of radioactive waste. Medical waste shall be classified in 5 categories: 1) class A - epidemiologically safe medical waste, close in composition to solid household waste; 2) class B - epidemiologically hazardous medical waste; 3) class C - extremely epidemiologically hazardous medical waste; 4) class D - toxicologically hazardous medical waste of I-IV hazard classes; and 5) Class E - radioactive medical waste. Collection and storage of mercury-containing products shall be authorized only in closed and locked rooms equipped with supply and exhaust or exhaust ventilation. In the absence of such an opportunity, the possibility of natural ventilation should be provided in the indicated rooms.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 45/18 approving the Statute of the Ministry of Environment (MINAMB).
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Statute of the Ministry for Environment (MINAMB). The Statute, consisting of 33 articles divided into four Chapters and three Annexes, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned institution under the Ministerial Department of the President of the Republic and Head of the Executive Branch. Its mission is to propose the formulation, conduct, execution and control of the Executive's policy on the environment in the field of protection, preservation and conservation of environmental quality, pollution control, areas of conservation and enhancement of the natural heritage, as well as the preservation and rational use of natural resources. Policy: Decree No. 77 of the Cabinet of Ministers regarding some issues of the State Inspectorate for Energy Supervision.
Policy_Content: The State Inspectorate for Energy Supervision of Ukraine is the central executive body whose activities are directed and coordinated by the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine through the Minister of Energy and Coal Industry and which implements state policy in the field of supervision (control) in the sectors of electricity and heat supply. The main tasks of the State Inspectorate for Energy Supervision shall be as follows: (a) implementation of state policy in the field of supervision (control) in the sectors of electricity and heat supply; (b) submission to the Minister of Energy and Coal Industry of proposals for ensuring the formation of state policy in the field of supervision (control) in the fields of electricity and heat supply; and (c) organization and implementation of state policy in the field of supervision (control) in the sectors of electricity and heat supply. The State Inspectorate for Energy Supervision shall perform supervision in the following areas: (a) application of legislation on matters within its competence; (b) electrical installations and networks, rules and requirements on technical exploitation of electric power plants, stations and networks ensuring reliable and safe supply of electricity to consumers; (c) training of employees; and (d) compliance with regulatory documents.

Policy: Regulation No. 97 date 14.2.2018 amending and supplementing Regulation No. 419 date 25.6.2014 approving special requirements  for the issuance of types A, B, and C environmental permits, the permits transfer, and the detailed rules of procedure for permit application examination and issuance by the National Licensing Center.
Policy_Content: This Regulation amends and supplements Regulation 419 of 2014 in various sections. First, the name of the National Licensing Center is changed to the National Business Center. Further, the preliminary environmental impact assessment document, although still part of the permit application file, will no longer be supplied by the applicant but by the ministry responsible for the environment and its dependent agencies that are part of this process. The Ministry of Tourism and Environment, the National Environmental Agency, and the National Business Center are responsible for the regulation enforcement.

Policy: Forests (Community Forest Management) Regulations, 2018 (S.I. No. 11 of 2018).
Policy_Content: These Regulations concern management of specifies forest areas by local communities and related matters. Community forest management may be applied in (a) open areas; (b) local Forests; and (c) Game Management Areas. The Director of Forestry, in consultation with the Minister, may consider community forest management in any other type of forest. A local authority (as defined by the Local Government Act) shall, for forests within the jurisdiction of that local authority, identify local communities, and support and encourage them to apply to the Director for control, use and management of areas of forests for purposes of social, cultural and economic needs. An area proposed for community forest management shall be free of a forest concession or sawmilling licence.

Policy: Norm IBAMA No. 5 regulating the environmental control of potentially polluting activities related to the substances subject to control and elimination according to the Montreal Protocol.
Policy_Content: This Norm, consisting of 10 articles and one Annex, regulates the environmental control of potentially polluting activities related to the substances subject to control and elimination according to the Montreal Protocol. It specifies that any producer, importer, exporter, trader and user of any of the controlled substances, as well as regeneration and incineration plants, are required to: I - have updated registration in the CTF/APP, contemplating the activities related to substances controlled by the Montreal Protocol and other activities potentially polluting that are exercised by the company; II - inform IBAMA of the environmental license or exemption from environmental license provided by the competent state or municipal body; III - have a valid Certificate of Regularity. The Annex lists Survey forms to be completed and delivered to IBAMA in accordance with the activities developed in relation to the Montreal Protocol.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Ley Nº 2/2018 - Ley de coordinación intersectorial y de simplificación de los procedimientos urbanísticos y de ordenación del territorio de Extremadura.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto establecer el marco normativo que permita coordinar la emisión de informes sectoriales en los procedimientos para la aprobación de los instrumentos de ordenación urbanística y territorial, cuando su aprobación definitiva corresponda a los órganos urbanísticos y de ordenación del territorio propios de la Junta de Extremadura. Como regla general quedan sujetos a los trámites de coordinación intersectorial los procedimientos siguientes: a) la tramitación de planes generales municipales, sus revisiones y modificaciones de ordenación estructural; b) la tramitación, modificación y revisión de los planes territoriales; c) aquellos otros procedimientos que se determinen reglamentariamente por Decreto. En el acuerdo de aprobación inicial de los instrumentos de planeamiento territorial o urbanístico se podrá renunciar expresamente al trámite de coordinación intersectorial establecido en esta Ley.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, North Atlantic, North-East Atlantic, Southern Europe

Policy: Ordonnance n° 2018-144 du 14 février 2018 modifiant l’article 169 e) de la loi n° 2014-138 du 24 mars 2014 portant Code minier.
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance abroge les dispositions de l’alinéa e) de l’article 169 de la loi n° 2014-138 du 24 mars 2014 portant Code minier. Les conventions minières en cours de validité et les permis d'exploitation accordés avant l'entrée en vigueur de la présente ordonnance ne sont pas affectés par les dispositions de l'article 169 susvisé. Les permis d'exploitation délivrés au cours de l'année 2018 bénéficient, pendant une durée de deux ans suivant la date de la première production commerciale, d'un abattement du taux de l’impôt sur les bénéfices industriels et commerciaux.

Policy: Décret n° 2018-150 du 14 février 2018 portant aménagement des modalités de paiement de la redevance d’occupation des terrains industriels pour les industriels transformant le bois grumes.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe l’aménagement des modalités de paiement de la redevance d’occupation des terrains industriels pour les industriels transformant le bois grumes. A cet effet, il est accordé aux unités industrielles de transformation du bois grumes situées dans les zones A et B, pour les années 2018, 2019 et 2020, un abattement de 60% sur le montant de la redevance d'occupation des terrains industriels, tel que prévu par l'annexe du décret n°2015-810 du 18 décembre 2015 fixant le montant et les modalités de paiement de la redevance d’occupation des terrains industriels.

Policy: Décret n°00060/PR/MAEPG du 14 février 2018 portant réorganisation de la Commission Nationale de la FAO.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret porte sur la redéfinition des missions et l'organisation de la Commission Nationale de la FAO (CNFAO) dont la mission est d'appuyer le Gouvernement dans ses relations avec le système des Nations Unies dans les domaines de l'alimentation et de l'agriculture. A ce titre, elle est notamment chargée de: assurer la coordination interministérielle dans les domaines de compétence de la FAO; assurer la participation la plus active de la République Gabonaise aux conférences, séminaires et ateliers de formation organisés par la FAO; proposer au Gouvernement toute action à caractère national touchant aux objectifs poursuivis par la FAO; participer à l'élaboration et au suivi du Cadre de Programmation Pays en abrégé CPP; faire connaître les activités de la FAO et promouvoir ses idéaux.

Policy: Ley Nº 7 - Ley que adopta medidas para prevenir, prohibir y sancionar actos discriminatorios.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene como objetivo prohibir y establecer la responsabilidad por todo acto de violencia que atente contra la honra, la dignidad, la integridad física y psicológica de las personas, proteger el derecho al trabajo en condiciones de equidad y establecer políticas públicas para prevenir estos actos, conforme a las convenciones sobre Derechos Humanos ratificadas por la República de Panamá. Para lograr el objetivo previsto, el desarrollo de la Política pública se enfocará en: 1) Sensibilizar, prevenir y prohibir con miras a erradicar el hostigamiento, acoso sexual o moral, racismo y sexismo en el ámbito laboral, educativo, comunitario y en cualesquiera otros ámbitos; 2) Imponer responsabilidades y sanciones, garantizando con ello los derechos humanos, la dignidad, el respeto y el bienestar de toda mujer u hombre de cualquier edad.

Policy: Regulation No. 247 on infection prevention measures against certain antibiotic resistant bacteria in pigs.
Policy_Content: This Regulation seeks to prevent the spread of certain antibiotic resistant bacteria from humans to pigs for public health purposes. It applies to people who have contact with live pigs or live in buildings or areas where pigs are kept. Such persons shall be obliged to wear protective clothing/equipment in circumstances specified by this Regulation until a negative test has been obtained. Documentation must be submitted to the Norwegian Food Safety Authority on request. The obligation to use protective equipment in section 4 is triggered if he or she has during the past 12 months: a. had contact with an animal that this knew was positive for antibiotic resistant bacteria or later received knowledge that the animal was positive during contact b. visited or worked in livestock herd abroad c. been admitted to a health institution, received dental treatment or underwent a comprehensive health examination, i abroad d. work as a health worker abroad e. Stayed in an orphanage or refugee camp abroad f. stayed abroad for more than six consecutive weeks, or g. tested positive for antibiotic resistant bacteria.
Subject: Livestock, General

Policy: Decision No. 26 of the Collegium of Eurasian Economic Commission validating the Regulation on the procedure for the formation and maintenance of the unified register of agricultural crops varieties.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for the formation and maintenance of the unified register of agricultural crops varieties. The unified register is formed and maintained by the Commission in the Russian language on the basis of information included in the national registers on agricultural plant varieties, submitted by by the authorized bodies to the Commission in electronic form by means of the integrated information system of the Eurasian Economic Union. Authorized bodies shall submit for inclusion in the unified register the following information (in Russian): (a) genus and type of agricultural plant (to be specified also in Latin); (b) the name of the variety; (c) the registration number of such a variety in the National Register; (d) information about the variety that is subject to legal protection under the legislation of a member state of the Eurasian Economic Union (if any); (e) the year of entry of the variety in the national register; (f) the tolerance zone or the light zone; (g) information concerning the originator of the variety (if available in the National Register): full name, address of the legal entity or surname, name and address of a legal entity or the surname, first name and patronymic, place of residence of a natural person; (i) information on the variety's characteristics and properties; and (j) description of the economic and biological characteristics of the variety (if any).
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 43/18 approving the Statute of the Ministry of Planning.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Statute of the Ministry of Planning. This Statute, consisting of 24 articles divided into four Chapters and three Annexes, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned institution, entitled to perform the following activities: plan the national development by formulating proposals and coordinating the implementation of public policies for the development of the national economy and by coordinating actions in the area of economic integration, economic cooperation development and international business; participate in the implementation of policies and macroeconomic management; propose measures aimed at promoting sustainable economic development; ensure the structuring and define methodologies for the implementation of the National Planning System; coordinate the elaboration, monitoring and evaluation of the National Planning System's instruments; participate in the public investment programming process, monitor its implementation and carry out the respective evaluation; promote cooperatives as a means of sustainable development; coordinate the programming, management and implementation of the actions in the framework of the planning stages, etc.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 42/18 approving the Statute of the Ministry of Industry (MIND).
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Statute of the Ministry of Industry (MIND). This Statute, consisting of 20 articles divided into four Chapters and two Annexes, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Ministry. The Ministry of Industry has the following duties: to ensure the implementation of the national policy in the field of industrial transformation and processing; develop programmes related to industrial development; support industrial operators by promoting discipline in the conduct of their activities; promote and guarantee the quality of industrial products; approve technical regulations relating to the quality of products, industrial processes and industrial safety; promote the application of the system of guarantee and protection of industrial property and geographical indications; ensure the national supervision of the exercise of industrial activities, preventing and suppressing non-conformity and infringements; promote the collaboration with other public services, with competence to intervene in the system of supervision of the national industry; support and encourage the increase of national industrial production; encourage, support and promote the rational use and transformation of national products of plant, mineral, forestry and animal origin, in order to create production chains and added value to national production, respecting the environment throughout the national territory; stimulate public and private investment contributing to the fundamental objectives of the country's economic and industrial development; etc.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock, Forestry, Mineral resources, Cultivated plants

Policy: Ley Nº 30728 - Modifica el Decreto Legislativo Nº 1195, Ley general de Acuicultura.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica la Ley general de Acuicultura, respecto a la Declaración de interés nacional (Artículo 2º) que queda redactado de la siguiente manera: “Artículo 2. Declarase de interés nacional la promoción y el fomento del desarrollo de la acuicultura sostenible como actividad económica que coadyuva a la diversificación productiva y la competitividad, en armonía con la preservación del ambiente, la conservación de la biodiversidad y la sanidad e inocuidad de los recursos y productos hidrobiológicos, destacándose su importancia en la obtención de productos de calidad para la alimentación y la industria, la generación de empleo, de ingreso y de cadenas productivas, entre otros beneficios. En tal sentido, el Estado promueve un entorno favorable, de acuerdo con el medio ambiente, para la formalización, el crecimiento sostenible y el fortalecimiento de esta actividad, brindándole apoyo a través de los diferentes órganos de gobierno y estableciendo un marco normativo que incentive la inversión privada.”

Policy: Resolución Nº 021-2018-OSINFOR ─ Metodología de cálculo del monto de las multas a imponer por el Organismo de Supervisión de los Recursos Forestales y de Fauna Silvestre (OSINFOR) por infracción a la Legislación Forestal y de Fauna Silvestre.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba la Metodología de cálculo del monto de las multas a imponer por el Organismo de Supervisión de los Recursos Forestales y de Fauna Silvestre (OSINFOR), por infracción a la Legislación Forestal y de Fauna Silvestre, que tiene por objetivo adecuar la metodología para el cálculo de las multas que impone el OSINFOR a los titulares de títulos habilitantes por incurrir en las infracciones tipificadas en los artículos correspondientes del Reglamento para la Gestión Forestal, del Reglamento para la Gestión de Fauna Silvestre, del Reglamento para la Gestión de las Plantaciones Forestales y los Sistemas Agroforestales y del Reglamento para la Gestión Forestal y de Fauna Silvestre en Comunidades Nativas y Comunidades Campesinas. La finalidad de la Metodología es determinar la cuantía de la multa a aplicar por la comisión de infracciones a Ley forestal y de fauna silvestre, observando los criterios de gradualidad que dispone la norma, a fin de establecer una sanción razonable y proporcional a la conducta infractora.

Policy: Kakamega County Lake Region Economic Bloc Act, 2018 (No. 6 of 2018).
Policy_Content: By this Act, the member Counties, including the County Governments of  Bomet, Bungoma, Busia, Homa Bay, Kakamega, Kericho, Kisii, Kisumu, Migori,Nandi, Nyamira, Siaya, Trans Nzoia and Vihiga establish the Economic Bloc to have the capacity of a body corporate with full legal personality. Policy: Conservation and Enforcement Measures (version of 2018).
Policy_Content: The Conservation and Enforcement Measures (CEM) of the  Northwest Atlantic Fisheries Organization (NAFO) shall apply to all fishing vessels used or intended for use for the purposes of commercial fishing activities conducted on fisheries resources in the (NAFO) Regulatory Area. Each Contracting Party shall ensure that every fishing vessel entitled to fly its flag operating in the Regulatory Area complies with the relevant provisions of the CEM and each fishing vessel operating in the Regulatory Area shall perform the relevant duties set out in the CEM and comply with the relevant provisions of the CEM. The CEM is divided into 8 Chapters: Conservation and Management Measures (I); Protection of Vulnerable Marine Ecosystems (VMEs) in the Regulatory Area From Bottom Fishing Activities (II);  Vessel Requirements and Chartering (III); Monitoring of Fisheries (IV); Observer Scheme (V); Joint Inspection and Surveillance Scheme (VI); Port State Control (VII); Non-Contracting Party Scheme (VIII). It is completed by a large number of Annexes.

Policy: General environmental protection during fishing (Conservation Measure 26-10 of 2018).
Policy_Content: This Measure of the Commission for the Conservation of Antarctic Marine Living Resources (CCAMLR) expresses concern that certain activities associated with fishing may affect the Antarctic marine environment. In this contexts, it introduces measures to minimize such arising from fishing-related activities in the context of mitigating incidental mortality of non-target species and protecting the marine environment in accordance with Article IX of the International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships (MARPOL). Measures concern disposal of plastic bags, discharge of waste (including offal and poultry waste), return of fish to sea, and introduction of poultry in certain areas.

Policy: Estrategia Nacional para la Igualdad de Género 2030.
Policy_Content: La Estrategia Nacional para la Igualdad de Género es un instrumento estratégico transversal concebido como hoja de ruta, integral e integradora, para orientar el accionar del Estado en materia de igualdad de género a mediano plazo. La estrategia concibe la política de género como política de Estado y propone delinear un horizonte de igualdad de género al 2030. A tal fin integra un conjunto de aspiraciones, directrices político-institucionales y lineamientos estratégicos capaces de influir en las decisiones de política pública. Se acompaña de este modo a la Agenda 2030 y los Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible, ambos esfuerzos de la Oficina de Planeamiento y Presupuesto (OPP) en la definición de la Estrategia Nacional para el Desarrollo 2050. La aspiración estratégica a 2030 es alcanzar el desarrollo sostenible con igualdad sustantiva de género, que garantiza el ejercicio pleno de los derechos humanos e incluye la diversidad de mujeres y varones. El documento se compone de un prólogo y las siguientes Partes: I) Justificación; II) Antecedentes; III) Marco conceptual: la igualdad sustantiva de género; IV) Las deudas con la igualdad de género; V) Caminos para la igualdad de género al 2030; VI) Claves para la implementación; VII) La viabilidad de la Estrategia Nacional para la Igualdad de Género; VIII) Anexo: participantes e instancias de consulta.

Policy_Content: L’objectif global de la Stratégie Nationale relative à la Foresterie Communautaire (SNFC) est de proposer un cadre opérationnel pour le développement du processus de foresterie communautaire en RDC et de garantir qu’il soit conduit de manière transparente et consensuelle entre les parties prenantes et conformément aux textes juridiques en la matière. Spécifiquement , la SNFC vise à garantir aux communautés locales des espaces juridiquement sécurisés en leur permettant de valoriser les ressources forestières qu’ils renferment ; contribuer de manière substantielle à la réduction de la pauvreté, à la paix et à la cohésion sociale en milieu rural et développer des mécanismes de partage des revenus issus de l’exploitation des concessions forestières des communautés locales; développer une expertise locale et communautaire outillée pour bien assurer la gestion des concessions forestières des communautés locales octroyées; s’assurer que la foresterie communautaire joue un rôle positif dans le processus de planification territoriale (zonage des forêts et aménagement du territoire).

Policy: National Resilience Strategy (NRS): Breaking the Cycle of Food Insecurity.
Policy_Content: This National Resilience Strategy of Malawi is a cross-sectoral document aiming at creating a country (i) resilient to economic and environmental shocks; (ii) able to sustain inclusive growth, food and nutrition security; (iii) able to achieve an improved well-being for all Malawians; and (iv) transitioned from recurrent humanitarian appeals to protective and productive investments in complementary interventions targeting food insecure and poor households. It is composed of 4 pillars as follows (1) Resilient Agricultural Growth, including smallholder farming interventions; access to inputs, training, and asset creation; diversification in the production and marketing of crops, forestry, livestock, and fisheries, and reduce dependence on maize; (2) Risk Reduction, Flood Control, and Early Warning and Response Systems; (3) Human Capacity, Livelihoods, and Social Protection; and (4) Catchment Protection and Management to develop and adopt integrated watershed management (IWM) approaches, other land management approaches to restore and expand Malawi's natural resource assets, and manage ecosystems.

Policy: National biodiversity Strategy and action plan for the period 2018-2023.
Policy_Content: The Government of the Republic of Macedonia on its 58th session hold on 13th of March 2018 has adopted the National Biodiversity Strategy and Action Plan for the period 2018-2023. The National Biodiversity Strategy and Action Plan of the Republic of Macedonia was developed in the framework of the project “Support to the Republic of Macedonia for revision of the National Biodiversity Strategy and Action Plan (NBSAP) and development of the Fifth National Report to the Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD)“. The Strategy contains six mutually supportive and inter-dependent targets (and 20 actions) that correspond to the Aichi Targets: 1. Full implementation of the EU Acquis on nature conservation, especially the Birds Directive (Directive on the conservation of wild birds, 2009/147/EC) and Habitats Directive (Directive on the conservation of natural habitats and of wild fauna and flora, 92/43/EEC) aiming to preventing further loss of biodiversity; 2. Maintaining and enhancing ecosystems and their services by establishing green infrastructure and restoring at least 15% of degraded ecosystems; 3. Enhancing contribution of the agriculture and forestry to biodiversity conservation and sustainable management; 4. Improved management of fish stock and achieving maximum sustainable yield; 5. Increased control of invasive alien species and their pathways; 6. Intensified contribution of the EU to averting global biodiversity loss.

Policy: Regulation respecting the energy efficiency of electrical or hydrocarbon-fuelled appliances.
Policy_Content: This Regulation regards certification and labelling for energy efficiency purpose of electrical or hydrocarbon-fuelled appliances listed in the schedules 1 and 2. The compliance of an appliance is tested and verified according to the applicable test procedure specified in Schedule 1 and according to any specification in Schedule 1. An appliance listed in Schedule 2, as defined in the Energy Efficiency Regulations, 2016 (SOR/2016-311), must comply with the energy efficiency standards applicable to the appliance in accordance with the Regulation, based on the period during which its manufacturing is completed. An appliance listed in Schedule 1 or 2 must be labelled with an energy efficiency verification mark issued by a body accredited by the Standards Council of Canada to operate a certification program in respect of energy efficiency. The verification mark certifies that the appliance has been tested and that, as the case may, its energy performance or compliance with the applicable energy efficiency standards have been verified. For the purposes of the first paragraph, an external power supply may be marked with roman numerals authorized by an accredited body. An appliance listed in Schedule 1 or 2 must be provided with at least one permanent label bearing the identification of its manufacturer, its model number and its date of manufacturing or bearing a code identifying that date, such as the appliance’s serial number. An appliance referred to in section 24 of the Act respecting energy efficiency and energy conservation standards for certain electrical or hydrocarbon-fuelled appliances (chapter N-1.01) must be provided with a permanent label obtained from the Minister certifying that it is demonstrated that the energy consumption equal to or lower than that permitted by regulation results from the various authorized standards. A label or a mark provided for in sections 3 and 4 must be affixed so that it is easily located and read without having to disassemble a part of the appliance. The label or mark may be affixed on the exterior of the appliance package. A manufacturer of appliances listed in Schedule 1 or 2 keeps up to date a register containing at least the name of the certification body referred to in section 3.

Policy: National Forest Landscape Restoration (NFLR) Strategy.
Policy_Content: This National Forest Landscape Restoration Strategy is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at (i) addressing the challenges that the country faces from unpredictable climate shifts and landscape degradation; (ii) developing a process of regaining ecological functionality and enhancing human well-being through reforestation and restoration of degraded forest landscapes; (iii) assist the country to achieve several national environment and development goals included in other related policies such as the National Forest Policy, the National Climate Change Management Policy, and the National Agriculture Policy; and, in general, (iv) creating enabling conditions that incentive and reward the sustainable use of natural resources. The Strategy builds on the results of a participatory National Forest Landscape Restoration Assessment (NFLRA) which was carried out throughout the country. Main involved stakeholders are (i) farmers, rural communities, and traditional authorities; (ii) Government; and (iii) NOGs and private sector. Main interventions regard (i) agricultural technologies; (ii) community forests and woodlots; (iii) forest management; (iv) soil and water conservation; and (v) river-bank and stream-bank restoration.
