Policy: Antimicrobial Resistance National Strategy Framework 2018 – 2024.
Policy_Content: This National Antimicrobial Resistance Strategy Framework is a nationwide multi-sectoral document developed with the main purpose to (i) to define the principles and short to medium term interventions needed to preserve the effectiveness of antimicrobials for future generations; (ii) improve the appropriate use of antibiotics in human and animal health to limit the transfer of antimicrobial residues and AMR organisms in the food chain; (iii) improve the effective management of antibiotic-resistant organisms and prevent their transmission; (iv) create an enabling environment for the successful and sustainable implementation of the strategic objectives. The Strategy represents the interdepartmental collaboration from a One-Health perspective which highlights antimicrobial resistance surveillance in people, animals, and the environment at all levels of the agricultural food chain. To achieve the aforementioned goals, the Framework set out the following 5 Strategic Objectives (i) strengthen, coordinate, and institutionalize interdisciplinary and intersectoral efforts; (ii) improve the appropriate use of diagnostic investigations; (iii) optimize surveillance and early detection of AMR and antimicrobial use; (iv) enhance infection prevention and control and biosecurity; and (v) promote appropriate use of antimicrobials in human and animal health. To achieve these objectives, the Government will focus on (i) legislative and policy reforms; (ii) education; (iii) communication; and (iv) research.

Policy: Kenya Climate Smart Agriculture Implementation Framework.
Policy_Content: This Climate Smart Agriculture Implementation Framework (KCSAIF) is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at providing guidance in mainstreaming Climate Smart Agriculture (CSA) together with providing options for implementing the Kenya Climate Smart Agriculture Strategy 2017-2026, launched in March 2017. The Framework envisions a climate resilient and low carbon growth sustainable agriculture that ensures food security and contributes to national development goals in line with Kenya Vision 2030. Focal points of the document are (i) exploration of climate smart practices relating to sustainable intensification of crop, agro-forestry, livestock and fisheries production; (ii) adaptation and mitigation practices in livestock production systems; (iii) efficient management of agricultural commodity value chains; (iv) opportunities to leverage climate finance for CSA; (v) knowledge sharing and effective learning; (vi) strengthening key institutions and systems; and (vi) mainstreaming CSA elements into national policies and development planning process.

Policy: National Action Plan to Combat Antimicrobial Resistance in Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan 2018-2022.
Policy_Content: This National Action Plan is a five-years document in alignment with WHO Global Action Plan to combat Antimicrobial Resistance. Jordan is committed to implement this National Action Plan through its health system and using holistic and multi-sectoral approach – referred to as One Health approach, in view of the fact that AMR is not just a health issue but it has grave potential to impede economy, food security and health of the people. Policy: National Action Plan on Prevention and containment of Antimicrobial Resistance 2019 - 2023.
Policy_Content: This NAP is a nationwide sectoral document,  aligned with WHO five objectives, aiming at reaching the main goal of "one health" approach  for strengthening systems to counter infectious diseases and related issues that threaten human, animal, and environmental health. The NAP is structured around 14 main objectives covering six areas of interest (1) Awareness, education and behavioral change; (2) Surveillance and laboratories capacity; (3) Infection Prevention, hygiene and sanitation; (4) Rational use of antimicrobial; (5) AMR in Migrants; and (6) Research. The 14 main objectives are (i) increase national awareness of AMR among target groups within 5 years up to 85%; (ii) improve knowledge on AMR and related topics; (iii) enhance behavior change towards better use of Antimicrobial medications; (iv) set up a national surveillance system for antimicrobial resistance; (v) build laboratory capacity to produce high-quality microbiological data for patient management and support surveillance activities in both human and animal sectors; (vi) identify research priorities for AMR surveillance; (vii) strengthening the Infection Prevention and Control (IPC) program in Libya; (viii) establishing bio-security (hygienic practices) in veterinary settings and animal husbandry, health food industry and agriculture; (ix) sanitation and hygiene at community level; (x) sanitation and hygiene at migrants’ camps; (xi) ensure sustainable access to high quality antimicrobial medicines; (xii) ensure appropriate use of antimicrobial agents in human; (xiii) improve and ensure appropriate use of antimicrobial in animals; and (xiv) establish the national surveillance system for antimicrobial use and consumption.

Policy: Decreto Nº 41068-PLAN ─ Define el Índice de Desarrollo Social (IDS).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto define el Índice de Desarrollo Social (IDS), como un instrumento para dar seguimiento y evaluar el grado de desarrollo relativo de las zonas geográficas del país a partir de información suministrada por las diferentes instituciones públicas. El IDS es un índice cuyo rango de variación oscila entre 100 puntos (mejor situación) y O puntos (situación más desfavorable) y comprende cinco dimensiones: económica, participación social, salud, educación y seguridad. Está compuesto por diecinueve indicadores relativos al consumo mensual de electricidad residencial, viviendas con acceso a Internet residencial, abstencionismo en elecciones nacionales, abstencionismo en elecciones de alcaldes, nacimientos con bajo peso al nacer, estudiantes de primaria con desnutrición, sobrepeso, obesidad o baja talla, mortalidad en personas menores de 5 años, nacimientos en madres solteras menores de 19 años, viviendas con cobertura residencial de agua potable, cobertura del programa de segundo idioma, cobertura del programa de informática educativa, escuelas sin servicio de electricidad, escuelas sin servicio de agua por cañería, aulas escolares en mal estado, rezago en educación primaria, centros educativos unidocentes, cobertura en educación pública secundaria, homicidios dolosos y defunciones en accidentes de tránsito.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 3/2018 approving the Maritime Authority System (SAM).
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 10 articles divided into two Chapters, approves the Maritime Authority System (SAM). It establishes that the National Maritime Authority (AMN) is created as the superior structure for administration and coordination of the bodies and services that, integrated in the Coast Guard, have competencies or develop actions within the ambit of SAM. SAM is the institutional framework formed by entities, bodies or services at the central, regional or local level which, with coordinating, executive, advisory or police functions, exercise powers of maritime authority. The purpose of SAM is to ensure compliance with the law in maritime areas under national jurisdiction, within the international law and other legislation in force. SAM is responsible for the following sectors: safety and navigation control; preservation and protection of natural resources (such as: underwater cultural heritage; marine environment, etc.); prevention and control of pollution; maritime signaling, navigation aids and warnings; supervision of economic activities of living and non-living resources; safeguarding human life at sea and maritime rescue; civil protection affecting the sea and the coastal zone; protection of public health; prevention and repression of crime; coastal and maritime safety and sea and river borders, etc.

Policy: Decree No. 107 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on the national hydrological reserve “Servech”.
Policy_Content: The national hydrological reserve "Servech" shall be located in the Glubokoe and Dokshitsy districts of the Vitebsk region for the purpose of maintaining the hydrological regime of the lake Servech, river Servech and their inflowing streams, conservation in a natural state of unique natural-vegetative marsh complexes, wild-growing plants and wild animals belonging to species, included in the Red Book of the Republic of Belarus, as well as their places of growth and natural habitats thereof. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of hydrological reserve "Servech": (a) drainage and land reclamation; (b) exploration of mineral deposits and mining; (c) waste disposal; (d) effluent waste water discharge; (e) collective gardening and horticulture; (f) industrial and housing construction; (g) timber extraction and logging; (h) building of bonfires; (i) burning out of vegetation; (j) application of plant protection chemicals by aviation method; (k) procurement and harvesting of wild flora; and (l) plowing of land at a distance of 100 meters from the coastline.

Policy: Regulation No. 69 date 7.2.2018 approving the conditions and the rules of procedure for the selection of the gas suppliers of last resort.
Policy_Content: This Regulation approves the terms & conditions and the rules of procedure for the selection of gas suppliers of last resort. The terms and conditions aim at guaranteeing effective, transparent, and non-discriminatory competition between the interested applicants. Accordingly, the line ministry after consulting the Energy Regulatory Authority (ERA) publishes the notification for the opening of the selection procedures at the Public Procurement Bulletin.  ERA drafts the operational rules for the supplier of last resort and approves the methodology of tariff calculation based on the stipulations of Law  102/2015 on the natural gas sector. Further, the Regulations lays down the requirements regarding the content of the application file. The supplier selection is conducted by a special assessment committee established by the order of the line Minister and composed of seven expert members. The committee decision is then submitted to the Minister who's responsible for moving it along for the approval of the Council of Ministers. Further, the regulation stipulates the terms & conditions for the termination of the supplier's of last resort operations. The Ministry of Infrastructure and Energy is the responsible authority for the Regulation implementation.

Policy: Ley Nº 1/2018 - Ley de medidas urgentes para garantizar la sostenibilidad ambiental en el entorno del Mar Menor.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto la adopción de medidas urgentes para la ordenación y sostenibilidad de las actividades agrarias y garantizar su aplicación en el entorno del Mar Menor y la protección de sus recursos naturales, mediante la eliminación o reducción de las afecciones provocadas por vertidos, arrastres de sedimentos y cualesquiera otros elementos que puedan contener contaminantes perjudiciales para la recuperación de su estado ecológico. La presente disposición será de aplicación a la laguna costera del Mar Menor, así como a los términos municipales de San Pedro del Pinatar, San Javier, Los Alcázares, Torre Pacheco, Fuente Álamo, Cartagena, La Unión y Murcia que forman parte de la cuenca hidrográfica del Campo de Cartagena vertiente al Mar Menor. El ámbito territorial de la Ley comprende la cuenca vertiente al Mar Menor perteneciente a la Región de Murcia, exceptuando las superficies de sus islas y de la Manga. En este ámbito se identifican tres zonas distintas: Zona 1, que se corresponde con los territorios ribereños más cercanos a la laguna en los que las prácticas agrarias y otras actividades humanas tiene un impacto más directo e inmediato sobre aquella; o que, por sus condiciones físicas, suponen un mayor riesgo de contaminación; Zona 2, el resto de territorios incluidos en la zona regable con aguas del Trasvase del Campo de Cartagena; Zona 3, el resto de los territorios de la cuenca vertiente al Mar Menor.  En todas las zonas delimitadas, el cumplimiento del Código de Buenas Prácticas Agrarias de la Región de Murcia, contenido en el anexo V, tendrá carácter obligatorio.

Policy: Decree No. 53.911 establishing the basic structure of the Secretariat for the Environment and Sustainable Development.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 9 articles, establishes the basic structure of the Secretariat for the Environment and Sustainable Development, under Law No. 14.733 of 15 September 2015. This Secretariat aims to perform the following activities: acting as the central body and coordinator of Sustainable Development and the State System of Environmental Protection (SISEPRA); promoting integrated policies for ecologically sustainable development; control, recovery, protection and environmental preservation; promoting the monitoring of the environment quality and the sustainable management of the environmental resources; developing policies for the preservation and conservation of biodiversity and ecosystems; regulating and promoting the licensing of activities considered potentially causing environmental degradation; acting in the development of the state policy of biotechnology, genetic engineering, technologies and substances considered as potentially hazardous; coordinating the State System of Conservation Units (SEUC); acting as an organ of the State System of Water Resources and coordinate policies of sustainable development of hydrographic basins; promoting technical and financial support to municipalities and civil society regarding environmental management, agroecology and sustainable development; coordinating the State Environmental Council (CONSEMA), the State Water Resources Council (CRH); coordinating the Economic Ecological Zoning (EEZ); working in partnership with municipalities, creating standardized procedures; etc.

Policy: Ley Nº 1.725 – Aprovechamiento racional de los inmuebles rurales pertenecientes al dominio privado del Estado provincial.

Policy: Definition of
Policy_Content: This Final Rule of the Environmental Protection Agency and the Department of the Army adds an applicability date to the "Clean Water Rule: Definition of ‘Waters of the United States" to maintain the status quo by adding an applicability date to the 2015 Rule and thus providing continuity and regulatory certainty for regulated entities, the States and Tribes, and the public while the agencies continue to consider possible revisions to the 2015 Rule. Thus the 2015 Rule will not be implemented until February 6, 2020. Until the applicability date of the 2015 Rule and subject to further action by the agencies, the agencies will continue to implement nationwide the previous regulatory definition of "waters of the United States" and will continue to interpret the statutory term "waters of the United States" to mean the waters covered by those Regulations.  The original Rule was challenged by (state) court proceedings.

Policy: Order No. 87 of the Ministry of Energy and Coal Industry validating the Methodology for calculating the fee for conversion of reactive electricity.
Policy_Content: This Methodology establishes the procedure for calculating the payment for the flow of reactive electricity between the energy supplier and non-residential consumers for the services that the energy supplier provides to the non-residential consumer, if the latter operates electromagnetically unbalanced electrical installations, and is used for targeted economic stimulation of the initiative of the non-residential consumer to compensate for the flow of reactive electricity. This Methodology defines the conditions for the calculation and analysis of the modes of electric networks of electric power systems, energy suppliers and non-residential consumers of electricity for the determination of economic equivalents of reactive power. The calculations for the flow of reactive electricity shall be applicable to the facilities of consumers of electricity with a permitted power of 16 kW or more.

Policy: Loi n° 2018-7 du 6 février 2018, complétant le code pénal en vue de renforcer la protection des agriculteurs contre les vols.
Policy_Content: La présente loi complétant le code pénal en vue de renforcer la protection des agriculteurs contre les vols En effet, il est ajouté au code pénal l'article 263 bis: « Sera puni de dix ans d'emprisonnement quiconque aura commis le vol de :  machines et matériels agricoles, aussi multiples ou uniques qu'ils soient. Sont considérés comme machines et matériels agricoles au sens du présent article, les tracteurs, les remorques, les charrues, les camions destinés au transport du produit, le matériel de récolte, les matériels et équipements d'irrigation et les moteurs et pompes à eau ; produits agricoles (sont considérés comme produits agricoles au sens du présent article, les légumes, les fruits et les céréales avant ou après la récolte et le sparte dans son palmier) ; bétail, aussi multiple ou unique qu'il soit (est considéré comme bétail au sens du présent article, les chevaux, les camélidés, les bovins, les ovins et les caprins. Afin d'établir l'infraction de vol, il peut être fait usage de tout procédé récent ou traditionnel, servant à détecter la trace de la chose volée et de la localiser ».

Le comité technique interministériel de suivi de la réforme des secteurs de l’eau et de l’électricité est chargé de veiller à la mise en œuvre de la réforme des secteurs de l’eau et de l’électricité décidée par le Gouvernement. Policy: Ley Núm. 71 de 2018 - Ley para declarar la política pública del Gobierno de Puerto Rico en torno al desarrollo agrícola de los terrenos comprendidos dentro del Valle de Añasco, declararlo como una reserva agrícola.
Policy_Content: En el marco del desarrollo de la agricultura (que a su vez propende a la creación de empleos y al desarrollo económico), por la presente Ley se declara la política pública del Gobierno de Puerto Rico en torno al desarrollo agrícola de los terrenos comprendidos dentro del Valle de Añasco. Dichos terrenos quedan declarados como una reserva agrícola. La Junta de Planificación coordinará con el Departamento de Agricultura todo el procedimiento necesario para reservar y destinar las fincas comprendidas dentro del Valle de Añasco al desarrollo exclusivo del mercado agrícola. Dicho procedimiento incluirá todo lo relacionado al estudio de las tierras, la promulgación de la resolución de Zonificación Especial y cualquier otro procedimiento necesario para lograr los fines de la presente medida.

Policy: Law on short-rotation woody crop cultures.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the establishment, cultivation and use of woody or other short-flowering crop plantations as regards the territory of the Republic of Croatia. The goal of this text is to create all necessary conditions for the production of biomass from crops as a renewable and environmentally friendly energy product, based on the principles of economic sustainability, social responsibility and environmental friendliness. The main purpose of this Law is to contribute to the energy and economic development of the Republic of Croatia by enhancing security of energy supply through the use of additional national energy sources, the development of rural space by stimulating economic activity at the local level by utilizing the additional production potential of agricultural and forest land, here closely related to crops aimed as biomass for bio-energy production purposes.

Policy: Free Irrigation Service Act (Republic Act No. 10969).
Policy_Content: The Act provides for Free Irrigation Service. It establishes that upon the day of entry into force of this Act, all farmers with landholdings of 8 hectares and below are hereby exempted from paying irrigation service fees (ISF) for water derived from national irrigation systems (NIS) and communal irrigation systems (CIS) that were, or are to be, funded, constructed, maintained and administered by the National Irrigation Administration (NIA) and other government agencies, including those that have been turned over to irrigators associations (IAs). Farmers with more than 8 hectares of land, corporate farms, and plantations drawing water for agricultural crop production; and fishponds and other persons, natural or juridical, drawing water for non-agricultural purposes from NIS and CIS, or using the irrigation systems as drainage facilities, shall continue to be subject to the payment of ISF.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Water

Policy_Content: Item 3 shall be amended to add the following wording: “The structure of the state geological fund includes geological information on the geological structure of the subsoil, the quality and quantity of mineral resources contained therein and other subsoil resources, the conditions of their extraction or use, phenomena and processes occurring in the subsoil, information about which is contained in the reports based on the results of geological exploration of subsoil, maps, other text and graphic documents and materials, including: (a) text and graphic documents and materials containing information, obtained directly in the process of geological exploration of subsoil, extraction of fossil resources, the use of geothermal resources of subsoil, the exploitation of underground facilities not associated with mining, that constitute fund of primary geological information; (b) reports on the results of geological exploration of subsoil, maps, other text and graphic documents and materials included in the conclusive reports on the geological exploration of subsoil, obtained as a result of processing of primary geological information constituting a fund of elaborated geological information. The scope of the state geological fund shall be collection, processing, accumulation and systematization of information specified in part one of this paragraph. The State Geological Fund is maintained in the form of a database in the electronic format using geoinformation technologies and on paper carriers. Keeping and updating of the state geological fund in electronic form with the use of geoinformation technologies shall be performed as information resource operation. The structure of the database of the State Geological Fund shall be approved by the Ministry of Environment”.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force after its official publication.

The Statute, consisting of 25 articles divided into four Chapters and three Annexes, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the MINEA, as an auxiliary Ministerial Department of the President of the Republic. Policy: National Emission Ceilings Regulations 2018 (S.I. No. 129 of 2018).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement in the United Kingdom Directive 2016/2284/EU of the European Parliament and the Council relating to national emission ceilings for certain atmospheric pollutants, which implements at the EU level obligations under the United Nations Economic Commission for Europe 1979 Convention on Long-Range Transboundary Air Pollution and its 1999 Protocol to Abate Acidification, Eutrophication and Ground-level Ozone, which was revised in 2012. The Regulations, among other things, require the Secretary of State to prepare an annual inventory of emissions of certain pollutants occurring in the United Kingdom, and projections of such emissions in certain years specified in Schedule 1, to prepare an adjusted inventory of emissions in certain circumstances, and to ensure that specified atmospheric pollution does not exceed certain levels.

Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Statute of the Ministry of Health (MINSA). This Statute, consisting of 33 articles divided into seven Chapters and two Annexes, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned institution, as a Ministerial Department of the President of the Republic and Head of the Executive Branch. It is responsible to perform the following activities: define and implement the National Health Policy in urban and rural areas, promote the execution of the Executive's health programme and the corresponding normative and monitoring functions, aiming at universal coverage the country, contributing to social and economic development. Policy: National Forest Policy of 2018.
Policy_Content: This National Forest Policy is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at an effective management and utilization of forest and tree resources for sustainable supply of products and services to meet local, national and global needs so that forest and tree resources significantly contribute to national livelihood and the global community. In reviewing the National Forest Policy of 1998 the document  seeks to strike the balance between forest conservation and business. To achieve the goal, the Policy sets out the following strategic objectives for the sector (i) forest and tree resources effectively developed and sustainably managed; (ii) forest ecosystems effectively conserved; (iii) production of forest and tree products enhanced and sustained; (iv) investments in the development of forest and tree resources and industry enhanced; (v) sector capacity enhanced; (vi) regional and international cooperation enhanced; (vii) impacts of HIV and AIDS infections reduced; (viii) gender equity and equality enhanced; (ix) good governance principles enhanced; and (x) contribution to environmental conservation enhanced.

Policy: Resolución Nº 83 - Establece condiciones para promover las exportaciones de leche y derivados lácteos a partir de las Zonas Más Afectadas por el Conflicto (Zomac).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución establece las condiciones para promover las exportaciones de leche y derivados lácteos a partir de las Zonas Más Afectadas por el Conflicto (Zomac), con el fin de incentivar la exportación de leche y derivados lácteos, para lo cual las compras de volúmenes de leche para exportación podrán realizarse de acuerdo con la metodología de definición de Precio Competitivo de Exportación (PCE), que se adopta en la presente resolución, siempre y cuando se cumplan los requisitos establecidos. El Precio Competitivo de Exportación (PCE), es el precio en pesos colombianos ($COP) que el agente comprador pagará al proveedor de leche cruda por litro exportado o su equivalente en derivados lácteos destinado a exportación. Lo anterior con base en la fórmula establecida en el anexo metodológico y en concordancia con la información publicada quincenalmente por la Unidad de Seguimiento de Precios del Ministerio de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural.

Policy: Environmental Permitting (England and Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2018 (S.I. 110 of 2018).
Policy_Content: These Regulations principally amend the Environmental Permitting (England and Wales) Regulations 2016. They also amend the Air Quality Standard Regulations 2010, and the Air Quality Standard (Wales) Regulations 2010. These Regulations amends the principal Regulations to add provisions relating to the environmental permitting for regime medium combustion plants (“MCPs”). It transposes the Medium Combustion Plant Directive (Directive 2015/2193/EU), which lays down rules to control emissions of sulphur dioxide, nitrogen oxides and dust from MCPs.  It also amends Schedule 26 to the principal Regulations to remove the disapplication of the availability of enforcement undertakings in respect of offences in relation to a flood risk activity, as access to enforcement undertakings is now available under the Regulatory Enforcement and Sanctions Act 2008. Air Quality Standard Regulations 2010, and the Air Quality Standard (Wales) Regulations 2010 are amended as part of the transposition of the Medium Combustion Plant Directive. The amendments concern preparation of air quality plans.

Policy: Decreto Núm. 8 – Crea el Santuario de la Naturaleza Cerro Poqui.
Policy_Content: Por el presente Decreto se declara Santuario de la Naturaleza el área denominada Cerro Poqui, cuyos límites se detallan en el artículo 1º y en el mapa adjunto. El Santuario tendrá los siguientes objetos de conservación: a) el tipo forestal Roble-Hualo, representado por la presencia de Nothofagus oblicua (roble) y Nothofagus glauca (hualo); b) el bosque Higrófilo, comunidad vegetacional que se desarrolla al borde de las quebradas, zonas con napas freáticas superficiales y esteros; c) Alsodes cantillanensis, anfibio endémico, clasificado como "En Peligro"; d) Carnívoros presentes en el área: Leopardus guiña (güiña), Galictis cuja (quique) y Lycalopex culpaeus (zorro culpeo).

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 7 - Establece el Programa Redes Inteligentes Ecuador (REDIE).
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo establece el Programa Redes Inteligentes Ecuador (REDIE), como una política para contar con una red más eficiente y flexible, con alta disponibilidad y calidad en el suministro de energía, sustentada en los beneficios que brindan las tecnologías de la información y comunicación, a través del establecimiento de un marco de referencia único para la gestión y ejecución de las diferentes iniciativas asociadas a este Programa. Se crea el Comité Ejecutivo para la ejecución del Programa REDIE, que estará conformado por las máximas autoridades o sus delegados, del Ministerio de Electricidad y Energía Renovable (MEER), Agencia de Regulación y Control de Electricidad (ARCONEL), Centro Nacional de Control de Energía (CENACE), Corporación Eléctrica del Ecuador (CELEC EP), Instituto Nacional de Eficiencia Energética y Energías Renovables (INER) y un delegado de las Empresas de Distribución Eléctrica del país. Policy: Loi n° 2017-047 du 29 janvier 2018 sur le Développement de l’Industrie (LDI).
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet de définir un cadre juridique visant à soutenir le développement du secteur industriel à Madagascar. Elle vise à soutenir un développement des branches d’activités industrielles prioritaires susceptibles de favoriser la croissance économique durable, inclusive et d’encourager la mise en place d’une Industrie portée par le progrès scientifique et l’innovation technologique. A cet effet, elle met en place l’Agence Nationale de Développement de l’Industrie (ANDI) dont la mission est de suivre et contrôler l’évolution de toutes les branches d’activités dans le secteur industriel à Madagascar notamment dans tous ses aspects économiques, statistiques et techniques ; soutenir les initiatives de développement du secteur industriel et encourager la soumission de projets entrepreneuriaux industriels innovants notamment ceux qui concernent les filières d’excellence à promouvoir de manière prioritaire; assurer la mise à niveau et le développement durable des entreprises industrielles existantes et soutenir leurs conditions de viabilité technologique, technique, sociale et économique ; veiller à l’équilibre et à la préservation des intérêts des entreprises industrielles par rapport à ceux des producteurs, des collecteurs, des fournisseurs de biens et services et des clients finaux et consommateurs dans le but d’instaurer une chaîne de valeur viable sur le plan structurel qui soit à la fois productive et compétitive.

Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe le détail des compétences de l’Etat transférées aux Collectivités territoriales en matière de gestion des ressources forestières et fauniques dans leurs domaines respectifs. Les domaines forestiers des collectivités territoriales comprennent le domaine forestier de la Commune (le domaine forestier classé et le domaine forestier protégé; domaine forestier du Cercle (domaine forestier classé et domaine forestier protégé); et le domaine forestier de la Région (domaine forestier classé et domaine forestier protégé). En ce qui concerne le domaine faunique, il comprend le domaine faunique de la commune (zones d’intérêt cynégétique et les ranches de gibier créés dans le domaine forestier de ladite Commune ou concédés à elle par l’Etat); le domaine faunique du Cercle (zones d’intérêt cynégétique et les ranches de gibier créés dans le domaine forestier dudit Cercle ou qui lui sont concédés par l’Etat ; et le domaine faunique de la Région (zones d’intérêt cynégétique et les ranches de gibier créés dans le domaine forestier de ladite Région ou qui lui sont concédés par l’Etat).

Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée des Directions Générales des Départements Ministériels, et fixe son organisation et ses attributions des Directions Générales des Départements Ministériels. Policy: Maritime (Conventions) Act No. 39 of 2017.
Policy_Content: This Act declares that the provisions of any of the Conventions to which Vanuatu has acceded and that are listed in the Schedule and any regulation, guideline or rules made from such Conventions, shall have the force of law in Vanuatu. The list of Conventions includes: International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea, 1974; Protocol of 1978, relating to the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea; International Convention on Load Lines, 1966; International Convention for the Prevention of Pollutions from Ships, 1973 (MARPOL 73); Protocol of 1978 Relating to the International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships, 1973; Convention on the International Regulations for Prevention Collisions at Sea, 1972, as amended (COLREG 1972); International Convention on Tonnage Measurement of Ships, 1969 (Tonnage 69); Athens Conventions Relating to the Carriage of Passengers and their Luggage by Sea, 1974 (PAL 74); Protocol to the Athens Convention Relating to the Carriage of Passengers and their Luggage by Sea, 1974; Convention on Facilitation of International Maritime Traffic, 1965 (FAL 1965); Protocol of 1976 to the International Convention on Civil Liability for Oil Pollution Damage, 1969; and International Convention on Standards of Training Certification and Watchkeeping for Seafarers, 1978 (STCW 1978). Where the provisions of any of the Conventions to which Vanuatu has acceded conflict with the provisions of any other Act, the provisions of the Convention shall prevail.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 15/18 approving the Statute of the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry (MINAGRIF).
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Statute of Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry (MINAGRIF). This Statute, consisting of 40 articles divided into four Chapters and four Annexes, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned institution, as a Ministerial Department of the President of the Republic as head of the Executive Branch. Its mission is to propose the formulation, conduct, execution and control of the Executive's policy in the fields of agriculture, livestock, forests, food security and food in a sustainable development perspective. In particular, the Ministry is responsible to formulate and propose policies and strategies for national development in the fields of agriculture, livestock, forestry, food and food security, promoting and coordinating the actions necessary for its implementation; prepare proposals for development programmes related to the above mentioned sectors to be included in the National Development Plan; support economic activities related to the production, transportation, processing, packaging, industrialization and marketing of agro-livestock and forestry products; promote and support the development of family and business agriculture; promote and ensure the rational management of water resources for agriculture, etc.

IDENE has administrative and financial autonomy and is linked to the State Secretariat for Development and Integration of the North and Northeast of Minas Gerais (SEDINOR). IDENE has the competence to promote the economic and social development of the North and Northeast regions of Minas Gerais, with the following attributions:  assess the economic propulsion conditions of its area of ​​coverage and identify alternatives aimed at reducing regional inequalities; promote and coordinate development actions in strategic sectors for economic and social sustainability; elaborate, implement and monitor programmes and projects aimed at expanding and strengthening regional infrastructure, social inclusion with employment generation, work and income growth, and expansion and diversification of the economic base; to promote actions aimed at the implementation, strengthening and improvement of strategic productive arrangements and chains in regions with low economic propulsion; plan, coordinate, supervise, guide and execute a permanent or emergency plan, programme, project or activity to combat the effects of drought, in accordance with governmental guidelines, especially those emanating from the Semiarid Mining Council.

Policy: Regulation on conditions, criteria, contents and manner of classification of petrogeothermal resources and on the manner for study presentations.
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes necessary conditions, criteria, contents and relevant manner for the classification of petrogeothermal resources under different types of geothermal resources. This text further defines the manner of presentation of related studies. Petrogeothermal resources in the sense of this Regulation include geothermal resources, ie internal heat of the earth's crust accumulated in compact and/or porous rock masses, from which heat (geothermal) energy can be extracted, through geoprobes, geothermal collectors or energy piles. The classification of petrogeothermal resources is performed after the performed geological research by expert consideration of the results and determination of the degree of geological research of such rock masses, on the basis of which expert analysis and evaluation of qualitative and quantitative properties of degree masses shall be performed. Determining the degree of geological research referred determining/estimating petrogeothermal resources shall be performed on the basis of geological-hydrogeological, hydrometeorological, petrophysical, geothermal and constructive-technical criteria.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This text entered into force on the day after its publication in the Official Gazette (published on 26 January 2018).

Policy: Regulation on contents of the study on conditions of exploitation of groundwater or hydrogeothermal resources, ie petrogeothermal resources and the conditions and manner of performing technical control of the study.
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the contents of the study on conditions of exploitation of groundwater or hydrogeothermal resources, ie petrogeothermal resources, as well as the conditions and manner of performing technical control of such studies. The study on conditions of exploitation of groundwater or hydrogeothermal resources, or petrogeothermal resources contains: 1) general data on the study; 2) textual part; 3) graphic attachments; 4) documentation material. General data on the study of conditions of exploitation of groundwater or hydrogeothermal resources, or petrogeothermal resources shall contain relevant elements as listed in article 3.

Policy: Decree No. 47.347 approving the Statute of the State Environmental Foundation (FEAM).
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the Statute of the State Environmental Foundation (FEAM). This Statute, consisting of 46 articles divided into nine Chapters, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of FEAM, entitled to develop and implement public policies related to climate change, renewable energy, air quality, soil quality and the management of water liquid effluents and solid waste. Its specific duties are: promote the application of environmental management instruments; propose indicators and evaluate the environmental quality and effectiveness of policies to protect the environment; develop, coordinate, support and encourage studies, research projects and actions, individually or jointly with public and private entities, with the objective of promoting modernization and technological innovation in the sectors of industry, mining, tourism, agriculture, livestock and infrastructure, with emphasis on the rational use of environmental resources and renewable energy sources; provide the necessary technical support to the organs and entities that are part of the Sisema in the environmental regularization processes and within their scope of action; propose, establish and promote the application of norms regarding the conservation, preservation and recovery of environmental resources and the control of activities and ventures considered effective or potentially polluting or capable of causing environmental degradation in any way with federal, state and municipal agencies and entities.

Policy: Order No. 34/2018 amending the enforcement regime of operation 3.2.2 «Small investments in agricultural holding», and operation 3.3.2, «Small investments in processing and marketing of agricultural products», both of measure 3 «recovery of agricultural production» of the Mainland's Rural Development Programme (PDR 2020).
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the third amendment to the enforcement regime of operation 3.2.2 «Small investments in agricultural holding», and operation 3.3.2, «Small investments in processing and marketing of agricultural products», both of measure 3 «recovery of agricultural production» of the Mainland's Rural Development Programme (PDR 2020). Amended articles 6, 7 and 10 are replaced by the following matters concerning: tax requirements regularized before the tax administration and social security, without prejudice to paragraph 7; Applicants' requirements for support operation 3.2.2, «Small investments in the agricultural holding», must also fulfill the following conditions: a) Being the agricultural holding owner and carry our the registration in the Parcel Identification System; b) Having a turnover or direct payments with a sum equal to or lesser than EUR 100,000, in the year preceding the submission of the applications. The conditions laid down in paragraph 1(f) and paragraph 2(a) may be demonstrated until the date of acceptance of the grant, when the applicant has not carried out any activity yet, etc.

Policy: Ministerial Decision No.17 of 2018 on the conditions and controls of the places of storage of waste resulting from real estate and establishments of all kinds.
Policy_Content: This Resolution consisting of 7 articles aims at regulating the places and receptacles for waste temporary conservation - in order to preserve the general appearance of the country and the safety of the environment - until their disposal by the competent Municipality. Art.2 gives terms and conditions for places of waste conservation. Art.3 regards the spaces between buildings and plants to collect garbage. According to art.4 establishments operating in the commercial, service, tourist, restaurants and other public places producing a variety of waste should start collecting the waste by sorting it according to its type. The collected waste shall be emptied periodically or whenever necessary, by the competent Municipality or through a licensed contractor. The discharging entity shall periodically wash and disinfect places and receptacles.

Policy: Ministerial Resolution No.16 of 2018 on the controls of transport of waste, and the means to be followed in the disposal process.
Policy_Content: This Resolution consisting of 4 articles aims at regulating the waste transport and establishes at article 1 that the garbage may not be transported without means of transport belonging to the competent Municipality or the contractor appointed by it. The article specifies conditions and specifications relating to capacity, general state of the vehicle, linings, labeling, allocation and age of the means. The body responsible for transporting the waste must rehabilitate the drivers and make sure they are in possession of the necessary safety precautions while driving (art.2). Other provisions deal with timing and itinerary.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No.15 of 2018 specifying the buildings and establishments whose owners are committed to transport liquid waste at their expense.
Policy_Content: This resolution consisting of 2 articles aims at specifying in which cases the owners of buildings and/or facilities are committed to transport liquid waste at their expenses. In particular article 1 states that owners of real estate built in places where there is no sewers network are obliged to set up sanitary drainage facilities in accordance with the requirements specified by the competent Municipality, while the owners of the properties that have the sewage tanks are obliged to dispose of them as soon as they are filled at their own expense. Art.2 identifies the buildings and installations whose owners are committed to transport their liquid waste at their expense as follows depending on their use (i) commercial, such as markets, malls and shops; (ii) touristic, such as hotels, resorts and recreational clubs; and (iii) with profitability such as residential, commercial and administrative complexes and towers.

Policy: Décret n° 2018-102 du 24 janvier 2018 autorisant le traitement de données à caractère personnel pour la mise en œuvre du Projet Filets sociaux productifs.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret autorise le traitement de données à caractère personnel pour la mise en œuvre du Projet Filets sociaux productifs. II fixe également les conditions de mise en œuvre de ce traitement, en application de la loi n° 2013-450 du 19 juin 2013 relative aux données à caractère personnel. L'Unité de Gestion du Projet-Filets sociaux (UGP-Filets sociaux) est autorisée à effectuer le traitement des données à caractère personnel des ménages résidant sur le territoire ivoirien pour la mise en place du Projet Filets sociaux productifs. Le traitement de données à caractère personnel a pour finalités de: assurer le transfert monétaire au profit des ménages les plus pauvres; constituer progressivement le registre social unique des ménages pauvres et vulnérables; identifier les ménages potentiellement pauvres et vulnérables. Les données ne peuvent faire l’objet d'un transfert hors du territoire national, sauf autorisation préalable de l’Autorité de protection.

Policy: Decree No. 47.344 approving the Regulation of the State Forest Institute (IEF).
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the Regulation of the State Forest Institute (IEF). This Regulation, consisting of 66 articles divided into 18 Chapters and one Annex, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Institute, which is linked to the State Secretariat of Environment and Sustainable Development (SEMAD). The IEF has the competence to develop and implement the forest and biodiversity policies of the State, aiming at maintaining the ecological balance, conservation, preservation, sustainable use and recovery of ecosystems, and responsible to: promote the mapping, inventory and monitoring of the State's vegetation; deal with the necessary information for the implementation and management of the Rural Environmental Cadastre (CAR); support the definition of priority areas for the conservation of biodiversity and for the creation of conservation units; carry out activities related to the creation, implementation, protection and management of conservation units; promote the conservation and recovery of native vegetation by encouraging reforestation among other environmental management instruments; promote research and studies related to the maintenance and restoration of the ecological balance; control the exploitation, use and consumption of raw materials from biodiversity and planted forests; promote the preservation, conservation and rational use of wildlife resources, as well as the development of activities aimed at the protection of terrestrial and aquatic wildlife.

Policy: Decree No. 8.673 amending Decree No. 11.671 on the Renewable Energy Programme of the State of Paraná.
Policy_Content: This Decree amends Decree No. 11.671 on the Renewable Energy Programme of the State of Paraná. Amendments deal with the promotion of the production and consumption of energy from renewable sources, especially biomass, wind and solar, contributing to the sustainable development of the State of Paraná, with priority for regions of lower human development. In addition, it deals with financial issues and specifies new definition of Renewable Energy as the electric, thermal, or contained in liquid and/or gaseous fuel, which originates from the use of organic vegetable waste from agriculture, urban, gastronomy, animal waste and waste from slaughter and its use, human sanitary sewage, as well as the electricity generated from the use of wind power and solar energy, through photovoltaic panels. The Secretariat for Planning and General Coordination (SEPL), is in charge of coordinating the Programme, being authorized to create a Working Group with the participation of representatives to be appointed by the Secretariats of Agriculture and Supply (SEAB), Economy (SEFA), Science, Technology and Higher Education (SETI), the Environmental Institute of Paraná (IAP) and the Paraná Energy Company of Energy (COPEL).

Policy: Resolución Núm. 85 exenta – Aprueba Bases Metodológicas para la Determinación de Sanciones Ambientales – Actualización, de la Superintendencia del Medio Ambiente.
Policy_Content: En virtud de la presente Resolución se aprueba el documento que contiene las Bases Metodológicas para la Determinación de Sanciones Ambientales – Actualización, de la Superintendencia del Medio Ambiente. Las Bases Metodológicas tienen por función constituir un instrumento de apoyo a la toma de decisiones, entregando una referencia útil para efectos de la definición de la sanción a aplicar en un caso concreto, contemplándose en el ejercicio de la potestad sancionatoria de la Superintendencia el necesario espacio para la flexibilidad y adecuada discrecionalidad que exige la determinación de una sanción, considerando las circunstancias específicas y particulares de cada caso. El documento se basa en los siguientes principios orientadores: a) la sanción debe estar dirigida a evitar futuros incumplimientos y cambiar el comportamiento del infractor; b) la sanción debe eliminar los beneficios económicos asociados al incumplimiento; c) la sanción debe ser flexible, consistente y considerar las circunstancias especí- ficas del caso y del infractor.

Policy: Law No. 4513. Energy Communities and other provisions.
Policy_Content: The law introduces a new institution aimed at boosting the use of renewable sources of energy by businesses, local authorities and individuals so that in addition to energy consumers they become energy producers.  The law defines an Energy Community (E.C.) as a civil partnership with the aim of promoting social and solidarity economy and innovation in the energy sector. Such a Community aims also at (i) promoting energy production, storage, own consumption, distribution and supply of energy produced sustainably, (ii) strengthening energy self-sufficiency in municipalities located on the islands, as well as (iii) improving energy efficiency at the local and regional level through activities in the fields of Renewable Energy Sources (RES), High Efficiency Combined Heat and Power generation (CHP), rational use of energy, energy efficiency, sustainable transport, and management of energy production demand, distribution and supply. The law consists of two parts. Part A (articles 1-12) sets forth the necessary procedures for the establishment and functioning of Energy Communities while Part B (articles 13-32) provides for necessary amendments to existing relevant legislation.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Law shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Policy: Law No. 17.492 providing for the urban territorial responsibility, parceling of the soil, and new urban modalities, for urban and rural purposes within the State of Santa Catarina.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 52 articles divided into four Titles, establishes the general rules governing the occupation and use of land for the purposes of urban activities and the land parceling in urban or rural areas. The parceling of urban land in the State must be done through the urban modalities provided for in this Law, subject to the provisions of pertinent federal and municipal legislation. Land subdivision in the Territory of Santa Catarina must be adequate to the structuring elements of the municipalities, detailed in the Executive Plans, considering the following: conservation of the original basin hydrological conditions and alternatives of rainfall; green areas; geological characteristics and topography of the territory; adequacy of the proposed urban layout to the existing circulation system in the Municipality, guaranteeing its extension, observing the topographical characteristics of the soil and the structuring elements of the territory, etc. The parceling of the soil for urban purposes must observe the urban and environmental requirements. In addition, the implementation of land parceling for urban purposes, depends on the approval of the project by the licensing authority, and will be formalized by the issuance of the urban and environmental licence.

Policy: Public Procurement and Disposal of Public Assets (General) Regulations, No. 5 of 2018
Policy_Content: These Regulations are made in accordance with the Public Procurement and Disposal of Public Assets Act [Chapter 22:23]. The Regulations provide to apply to all situations under the Act except the leasing of facilities or amenities for sporting purposes or for a specific event, for a period not exceeding twelve months and accommodation for office space or other purposes, so long as the lease is not for a period of more than three years. The Regulations provide for the registration of bidders and contractors and the compilation of annual list of registered bidders and contractors, which list is published in the Gazette and the Authority’s website. The Regulations provide procedures that independent procurement agents must follow when engaged for procurement proceedings. The Regulations also provides that where procurement is shared, the accounting officers of the procuring entities shall agree in writing on the functions to be shared, the mechanisms for implementation of the procurement, the procedure for approving the procurement, reporting and monitoring, the limitations or exceptions to the procurement contract and the costs to be paid by each of the procuring entities. The Regulations further provide for market consultations to be conducted transparently without favour to any potential bidder. To further the mandate of the Act, the Regulations place financial thresholds for procurements. To ensure integrity and transparency, the Regulations require the keeping of procurement records, the regular submission of reports to the Authority, the ethical responsibilities of bidders and contractors, among others. The Regulations provide for the procedure for the disposal of public assets and requires the disposal committees to keep records.

Los términos de referencia son aplicables a las autoridades ambientales y a los particulares dentro del trámite de licenciamiento ambiental para la elaboración del EIA para proyectos de Sistemas de Transmisión de Energía Eléctrica. El interesado en obtener la licencia ambiental, deberá verificar que no queden excluidos de la evaluación aspectos que puedan afectar y/o producir deterioro grave a los recursos naturales renovables o al ambiente o introducir modificaciones considerables o notorias al paisaje. De la misma manera, podrá suprimir o no aportar parcialmente alguna de la información solicitada en los términos de referencia, que considere que no es pertinente y que por lo tanto no aplica a su proyecto, obra o actividad.

Policy_Content: El presente Reglamento Orgánico del Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería (MAG), establece como sus objetivos: 1) Mejorar las capacidades competitivas de las familias rurales de pequeños y medianos productores agropecuarios, la juventud rural y sus organizaciones, mediante la mejora en la productividad, el conocimiento y transferencia tecnológica, la diversificación productiva, el fortalecimiento agro empresarial, que posibilite su articulación a los mercados externos e internos y aumentar el acceso, uso y control de los recursos y servicios para mejorar la calidad de vida de los habitantes de los territorios rurales; 2) Fomentar y desarrollar la seguridad y soberanía alimentaria y nutricional del país, mediante el apoyo de buenas prácticas de producción sostenible y orgánica en sistemas productivos familiares y comerciales, que contribuyan a la mejora en la calidad de vida de las familias rurales; 3) Impulsar el mejoramiento y sostenibilidad de la gestión institucional, mediante servicios que respondan a las necesidades de los ciudadanos y la institución; 4) Desarrollar las tecnologías de información y comunicación del MAG, mediante la interconexión e interoperabilidad, un modelo de datos y servicios integrados bajo el concepto de e-agricultura, que contribuya a brindar un servicio de calidad a sus usuarios; 5) Promover la articulación y coordinación interinstitucional de la gestión técnica y operativa del MAG, que propicien una gestión integrada de productos y servicios a los productores y sus organizaciones en los territorios rurales.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock

Policy: Lineamientos del Programa de Modernización de los Registros Públicos de la Propiedad y Catastros (2018).
Policy_Content: El presente documento contiene los Lineamientos del Programa de Modernización de los Registros Públicos de la Propiedad y Catastros. Su finalidad es instrumentar mecanismos de colaboración y coordinación interinstitucional, que permitan alinear las acciones conjuntas de modernización registral y catastral correspondientes, ejecutadas por todos los actores y agentes participantes en el Programa y en cada una de las entidades federativas del país que se adhieran al mismo. Una de las líneas de acción es propiciar la modernización de catastros y de registros públicos de la propiedad, así como la incorporación y regularización de propiedades no registradas. El objetivo general es contribuir a promover el ordenamiento y la planeación territorial como articuladores del bienestar de las personas y el uso eficiente del suelo, mediante instituciones registrales y catastrales modernizadas, eficientes y eficaces que generen información de la propiedad inmobiliaria vinculada y de calidad que brinde certeza jurídica y sirva de soporte a las políticas públicas.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 12/18 approving the Statute of the Ministry of Mineral Resources and Petroleum (MIREMPET).
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Statute of the Ministry of Geology and Mining (MGM). The Statute, consisting of 27 articles divided into four Chapters and three Annexes, establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned institution, as an auxiliary Ministerial Department of the President of the Republic and Head of the Executive Branch. The Ministry is responsible for formulating, conducting, executing and controlling the Executive's policy regarding geological and mineral activities, petroleum, gas and biofuels, namely for the exploration, research, development and production of minerals, crude oil and gas, for refining, petrochemical, storage, distribution and commercialization of mineral and petroleum products, as well as for the production and commercialization of biofuels. In particular, it aims to formulate and propose the general bases of the national policy on mineral, petroleum and biofuel resources; prepare and propose the programme for the development of mineral, oil and biofuel resources, in accordance with the National Plan and ensure the control and enforcement of its execution; promote studies of inventory of the potential of the country's mineral, oil and biofuel resources; study and propose legislation regulating the activities of the sector; ensure the implementation of actions that fall within the Executive's policy regarding the exploitation of mineral, oil and biofuel resources; etc.
Subject: Energy, Mineral resources

Policy: Law No. 17.479 providing for the use of Discarded Moulding Sands (ADF).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 5 articles and one Annex, establishes the requirements for the use of Discarded Moulding Sands (ADF). The use of ADF, in the most environmentally appropriate manner, will be used for the production of asphalt concrete, concrete and mortar for concrete artifacts, the manufacture of tiles, bricks and other articles of clay for ceramic articles, laying of pipes and of paving, base, sub-base, subgrade reinforcement for roads, highways, urban roads and for daily coverage in landfills. The careful use of these sands ADF will contribute to an increase in the life of the sanitary and industrial landfills as well as to the preservation of natural resources, as recommended by the National Solid Waste Policy, established by the Federal Law No. 12.305 of 2 August 2010. The authorization aims to contribute to sustainable development, with a view to harmonizing the components of economic growth, social equity and environmental quality. The Annex specifies the procedures on the use of discarded sands.

Policy_Content: This Order amends Order No. 134/2015 on the regime of operation 8.1.3 "Forest Prevention against biotic and abiotic agents". Amended articles deal with the regime for the implementation of operation 8.1.3, "Forest prevention against biotic and abiotic agents" and operation 8.1 .4 "Restoration of forest affected by biotic and abiotic agents or by catastrophic events", both of which are included in Action 8.1, "Sustainable Forestry" of Measure 8, "Protection and Rehabilitation of Forest Settlements", of the Continent Rural Development Programme (PDR 2020). Amendments provide for new supports programme under the Measure 8 'Protection and Rehabilitation of Forest Settlements' of the PDR 2020 which can be combined with others, provided that the following conditions are met: a) Eligible investment up to a limit of EUR 2 million per ZIF; b) Eligible investment up to a limit of 2 million euros, for public entities and collective forest management entities; c) Eligible investment up to a limit of EUR 1 million for the remaining beneficiaries.

Policy: Order No. 15-A/2018 establishing technical standards to be considered in the preparation of afforestation and reforestation projects, the respective analysis, decision-making process, and their implementation.
Policy_Content: This Order, consisting of 6 articles and one Annex establishes technical standards to be considered in the preparation of afforestation and reforestation projects, the respective analysis, decision-making process, and their implementation. The afforestation and reforestation actions, as well as the elaboration and analysis of the respective projects, must comply with the guidelines established in the appended Annex in order to guarantee the maintenance of the forests as an inseparable resource of other natural resources such as water, soil, air, fauna and flora. Situations where conditions of land, plant or special conservation status permit other technical solutions to be admissible, when justified. It specifies minimum distances from afforestation and reforestation land bordering; distances from afforestation and reforestation to water courses, etc.

Policy: Order No. A-09 of the Minister of Food, Agriculture and Light Industry validating the Regulation on organic agriculture and regulation of organic foodstuffs.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that organic farmer shall sustainably use, own and protect natural and/or common natural resources, and shall comply with the principles of organic production at any stage of production. Organic farmer shall keep record of foodstuffs and raw materials at all stages of production cycle, indicating whether they were produced with GMO and their derivatives. Seeds can be certified as "organic seeds" for the first year of cultivation, and planting material of perennial plants can be certified as “organic seeds/planting material” after two years of cultivation. The transition period from the non-agricultural crop production to the organic crop production shall commence within the following periods: (a) 12 months for annual plants; (b) 12 months for pasture and meadow plants before grazing; (c) 18 months for perennial plants before harvesting; and (d) 24 months for fruit trees and shrubbery. Milk obtained from cattle fed by organic fodder from the time of birth shall be considered “organic milk”. Honey products supplied to the market for at least one year shall be labelled with symbols indicating organic product. Only certified alimentary raw materials shall be used for organic food production. In order to be labelled as organic product foodstuffs must contain 90 or more percent of organic ingredients. Organic food shall be processed using biological, mechanical and physical methods, or similar traditional and natural methods. Packing material used for organic food shall not contain recycled or synthetic fungal preparations, residues, fragrances and nano components.

Policy: Ley de Equilibrio Ecológico  y Protección al Ambiente del Estado de Chihuahua.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley busca garantizar el derecho de toda persona a un medio ambiente sano y saludable y, a tal fin, establece el marco normativo aplicable en el Estado de Chihuahua orientado e asegurar el equilibrio ecológico y la protección del medio ambiente. Los principios rectores incluyen el principio precautorio y el principio de prevención, la sostenibilidad, el derecho de acceso a la información, el derecho a la participación en la gestión ambiental, el derecho de acceso a la justicia ambiental, el principio de responsabilidad ambiental. Por otro lado, el Título Cuarto fija los principios que deben contemplarse en la formulación y conducción de la Política Ambiental Estatal. Entre ellos cabe destacar el siguiente: quien realice obras o actividades que afecten o puedan afectar el ambiente, está obligado a prevenir, minimizar o reparar los daños que cause, así como a asumir los costos que dicha afectación implique. Asimismo, debe incentivarse a quien proteja el ambiente, promueva o realice acciones de mitigación y adaptación a los efectos del cambio climático y aproveche de manera sustentable los recursos naturales.

Policy: Regulation of the Ministry of Agriculture of the R.I. No. 05/PERMETAN/KB.410/1/2018 on Clearing and/or Processing of Plantation without Burning.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of 37 articles divided into eight Chapters and five Appendices, The scope of this Ministerial Regulation includes: a) planning for clearing and/or processing of Plantation Land without burning; b) opening clearing and/or processing of Plantation Land without burning; c) the system, means and infrastructure of forest fire control in the plantation area; d) reporting; and e) guidance and supervision. Plantation companies must have an RKPPLP approved by the Head of the provincial or district/city service in accordance with their authority before clearing and/or processing plantation land. Farmers do not have to have a RKPPLP before clearing and/or processing plantation land. To obtain RKPPLP approval as referred to in paragraph (1), the Plantation Company shall submit a written application to the Head of the provincial or district/city service in accordance with the authority, complete with requirements including: a) company profile; b) IUP-B, IUP-P, and/or IUP; c) Annual RKPPLP; d) digital maps with a scale of 1:50,000 in printed maps and electronic files in accordance with statutory provisions; and e) a statement of ability of clearing and/or process Plantation Land without burning according to Format-1. The application as referred to in paragraph (3) is in accordance with Format-2. RKPPLP as referred to in paragraph (3) letter c) shall be prepared in accordance with Format-3.

Policy: Law No. 22.926 establishing the Programme for the Certification of Agricultural, Livestock and Agroindustrial Products (Certifica Minas).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 10 articles, establishes the Programme for the Certification of Agricultural, Livestock and Agroindustrial Products (Certifica Minas). The Programme for Certification aims at assuring the quality of agricultural, livestock and agroindustrial products produced in the State and the sustainability of its production systems, providing these products a greater competitiveness by putting them on national and international markets. The certification will be given through the granting of a Certificate and the Certifica Minas Conformity Seal. Certifica Minas will have specific categories for the certification of different agricultural, livestock and agroindustrial products, in the form of regulation. The objectives of Certifica Minas are: improving the process of management of agricultural, livestock and agroindustrial activities in the State; optimizing the use of inputs and natural resources in order to promote the economic, social and environmental sustainability of agricultural, livestock and agroindustrial activities; providing more competitive conditions for the commercialization of these products produced in the State; increasing the generation of employment and income in establishments that have certified products.

Policy: Real Decreto Nº 6/2018 - Crea la Comisión Interministerial para la incorporación de criterios ecológicos en la contratación pública.
Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto, considerando que a contratación pública ecológica (CPE) es una importante herramienta para el logro de las políticas medioambientales relacionadas con el cambio climático, la utilización de los recursos y la producción y el consumo sostenibles, crea la Comisión Interministerial para la incorporación de criterios ecológicos en la contratación pública. La Comisión queda adscrita como órgano colegiado al Ministerio de Agricultura y Pesca, Alimentación y Medio Ambiente. La Comisión tiene como fin garantizar la coordinación de la Administración General del Estado (AGE), sus Organismos Públicos y los servicios comunes y las Entidades Gestoras de la Seguridad Social, en la incorporación y el uso de criterios ecológicos en la contratación pública.

Policy: Ordonnance n°2018-001/P-RM du 12 janvier 2018 portant création de l’Observatoire National de l’Industrie.
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance crée Observatoire national de l’Industrie (ONI) dont la mission est d’entreprendre des études et de mener des recherches en vue de promouvoir le développement industriel. A cet effet, il est chargé de: mener des études et des recherches sur l’Industrie ; contribuer à une meilleure exploitation des études et recherches réalisées dans le domaine de l’industrie ; analyser l’incidence des mesures législatives et réglementaires sur la promotion du secteur industriel ; analyser l’impact des investissements sur le renforcement du tissu industriel ; contribuer à la prise en compte de la dimension environnementale et sanitaire dans la conception des projets industriels au niveau sectoriel; contribuer à la détermination des filières porteuses ; participer à l’élaboration de tous programme et stratégie dédiés au développement industriel ; contribuer à l’évaluation des politiques menées pour soutenir l’industrialisation ; recenser les difficultés et contraintes, en rapport avec les organisations faîtières du secteur, et proposer toute réforme ou mesure à mettre en œuvre pour leur prise en charge adéquate ; produire et diffuser un rapport annuel sur le développement industriel. Les organes d’administration et de gestion de l’Observatoire national de l’Industrie sont : le Conseil d’administration ; la Direction générale ; et le Comité scientifique. Un décret pris en Conseil des Ministres fixe l’organisation et les modalités de fonctionnement de l’Observatoire national de l’Industrie.

Les organes d’administration et de gestion de l’Observatoire national de l’Industrie sont: le Conseil d’administration; la Direction générale ; et le Comité scientifique. Ses membres sont issus des secteurs publics, privés et de la société de civile.

Policy: Order No. 15-B/2018 establishing the minimum qualifications required for the designing and submitting of projects in the framework of afforestation and reforestation actions.
Policy_Content: This Order, consisting of 5 articles, establishes the minimum qualifications required for the designing and submission of projects in the framework of afforestation and reforestation actions. Projects must use forest species, for the purposes of the authorization and the prior communication provided for in arts. 4 and 5 of the Decree-Law No. 96/2013 of 19 July, amended and republished by Law No. 77/2017 of 17 August. The above mentioned projects can be elaborated and submitted by senior technicians, graduates, and bachelors in the areas of forestry as well as by agronomic scientists, provided they have at least three years of professional experience in the forestry area. Entities may submit projects as long as the technicians who subscribe to it comply with the minimum requirements for their qualification. All technicians wishing to design and submit projects are required to register with ICNF, I.P. Applications for registration must be submitted electronically. ICNF, IP's obligations are: a) verify the academic and/or professional qualifications of technicians who prepare and submit projects under arts. 4 and 5 of Decree-Law No. 96/2013, republished by Law n 77/2017; b) register the technicians; c) ensure maintenance and updating of records; d) make the cancellation of registrations.

Policy: Política de Acceso a Recursos Genéticos y Distribución de Beneficios (ABS) de la República Dominicana.
Policy_Content: La Política de Acceso a Recursos Genéticos y Distribución de Beneficios (ABS) de la República Dominicana es un instrumento cuyo objetivo general es trazar las líneas estratégicas para proveer un marco legal e institucional bajo el cual el Ministerio de Medio Ambiente y Recursos Naturales, como organismo rector de la gestión para la conservación de la biodiversidad, procese y evalúe las solicitudes de acceso a recursos genéticos y distribución de beneficios que forman parte del patrimonio natural del Estado dominicano y los términos y condiciones bajo los cuales podrá conceder acceso a dichos recursos. Constituyen objetivos específicos los siguientes: a) establecer y contar con una normativa y procedimiento institucional para el tratamiento de las solicitudes de acceso a recursos genéticos y distribución de beneficios (ABS) que forman parte del patrimonio natural de la nación; b) promover la protección, resguardo, investigación y uso sustentable de los recursos genéticos y los conocimientos tradicionales; c) fortalecer la capacidad científica y transferencia de la tecnología; d) velar por la participación de la mujer en el uso y conservación de los recursos genéticos y distribución de beneficios; e) mantener un registro actualizado de los usos que se hayan autorizado de los recursos genéticos y sus derivados; f) adoptar las medidas para vigilar y aumentar la transparencia acerca de la utilización de los recursos genéticos.

Policy: National Water Strategy 2030.
Policy_Content: This National Water Strategy is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at creating by 2030 a sustainable water sector, safeguarding water and the other natural resources and the environment, and providing cost-effective supply and high-quality services, contributing to the economic and social development. To achieve the goal, 5 specific objectives have been set out, as follows (i) ensure continuous access to adequate quantities of safe water, under both normal and emergency situations; (ii) enhance water demand management across all uses; (iii) deliver cost-effective, high quality, and affordable water and wastewater services; (iv) safeguard and optimize the use of water resources, while preserving the local environment for the benefit of the present and future Saudi society; (v) ensure water sector competitiveness and positive contribution to the national economy through promoting effective governance, private sector participation, capacity building, and innovation. According to the 5 specific objectives, 10 programs are defined, namely (1) water system and water resources management regulations; (2) water resources management; (3) sector resilience; (4) research, development, and capacity building; (5) supply chain efficiency and service quality; (6) water services regulations; (7) reconstruction of the saline water conversion corporation; (8) private sector involvement in the production and treatment of wastewater; (9) distribution restructuring and privatization; and (10) establishment of the General Organization for Irrigation and irrigation improvement.
