Policy: Law No. 8.602 - creating the State Socioeconomic Policy for the State of Pará, the State Socioeconomic System, the State Socioeconomic Policy Council, and the State Policy Socioeconomic Fund.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 30 articles divided into five Chapters, creating the State Socioeconomic Policy for the State of Pará, the State Socioeconomic System, the State Socioeconomic Policy Council, and the State Policy Socioeconomic Fund. This State Policy is instituted in order to establish strategies and promote the socioeconomic development of the State, through programmes and projects that meet the regional and sectoral peculiarities. Socioeconomics is an area that proposes to study different expressions, projects and strategies of social coexistence, based on the expansion of the democratic plan, in which the economic advances are subordinated to social benefits extended to all society. The principles of the State Policy are: sustainable and inclusive economy, focused on the distribution of wealth and valuation of local and traditional socio-productive activities with a view to adopting clean and sustainable alternatives to production and consumption; respect for peoples, preserving cultural identity and traditional knowledge, in the form of protective measures; stimulation of socio-environmental development, with the representatives of the most vulnerable groups. The objectives of the State Policy are: I - combat poverty and promote the reduction of inequalities, and discrimination; II - order public and private investments for regional development; III - promote the generation of income; IV - promote expansion, qualification and improvement of spaces for social participation; V - promote economic growth through the strengthening of sustainable productive chains considered strategic for the development of the State; VI - stimulate potentials for local infrastructure in order to increase the capacities in the territory, etc.

Policy: Tanzania Livestock Master Plan 2018.
Policy_Content: The Tanzania Livestock Master Plan (LMP) was developed by the Ministry of Livestock and Fisheries (MLF) with technical support from the International Livestock Research Institute (ILRI) as a roadmap to achieve the Tanzania Development Vision (TDV) 2025. One of the TDV’s goals is that by year 2025 there should be a livestock sector, which to a large extent shall be commercially run, modern and sustainable, using improved and highly productive livestock to ensure food security, improved income for households and the nation while conserving the environment. In recent years, the government of Tanzania has prioritized the transformation of the agricultural sector. Policy: Postharvest Management Strategy in Grains in Ethiopia 2018.
Policy_Content: This Postharvest Management Strategy in Grains is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at ensuring proper and better utilization of the grain crops produced in Ethipia in order to ensure better nutrition for the growing population. To achieve the gaol, the Strategy sets out a series of objectves resulting from the reduction, both quantitatively and qualitatively, of the postharvest losses along the agricultural value chains of grains, which are (i) food security as well as food safety; (ii) increased incomes for the agricultural sector; (iii) national economic development which aims to build a market economy in which (a) a broad spectrum of the Ethiopian people are beneficiaries; (b) dependence on food aid is eliminated; and (c) rapid economic growth is assured. Other goals of the Strategy next to the aforementioned main goal are (i) improving agricultural input and output market efficiencies for grains; (ii) improving access to financing and investment for improved postharvest loss management practices; and (d) supporting sustainable value addition enterprises throughout the agriculture value chain. Cross-cutting issues of significance to postharvest management systems including gender, youth, HIV/AIDs, environmental factors and agricultural information management shall be mainstreamed in all activities undertaken towards the attainment of the above specific objectives.

Policy: Poverty Reduction Strategy (PRS) 2018-2022.
Policy_Content: This Poverty Reduction Strategy is a 5-years nationwide sectoral document in line with the goals of the National Development Plan (NDP) for 2018-2022. Main goal is reducing poverty by at least 25 percent, by 2022. The strategic plan envisages (i) improving standards of living; (ii) protection against risks and hazards; (iii) achievement of economic empowerment needed to turn the poor into productive individuals economically and socially integrated. These objectives will be achieved through (1) sustainable income from work; (2) improved health status; (3) improved education; (4) suitable housing and environment responsive to challenges; (5) effective social protection; and (6) emergency response activities. The Strategy gives particular attention to the issue of financing and the costs of each activity. Regarding domestic financing, resources will come from (i) annual allocations of the general investment and current budgets; and (ii) savings generated from decentralization, with a consequent increased efficiency of implementation and local community’s ownership of the activities. The Strategy focuses on specific priority activities for specific poor areas, among others (i) financial and economic policies; (ii) investment policy; (iii) monetary policy; (iv) agricultural policy; and (v) trade policy.

Policy: National Agricultural Investment Plan (NAIP).
Policy_Content: This National Agricultural Investment Plan (NAIP) is a five-year nationwide multi-sectoral document developed by the Government of Malawi to put into effect the National Agriculture Policy (NAP) of 2016 by guiding investment focus in the medium-term to accelerate 1. agriculture transformation, 2. economic growth and 3. poverty reduction. The NAP’s transformation agenda involves a holistic approach to a heterogeneous sector with the following targets (i) focus on smallholders; (ii) support to commercial farming; (iii) focus on production and productivity; (iv) sustainable management of agricultural resources; (v) resilience to climate change; (vi) increased agricultural exports; and (vii) food security and improved nutrition. Its implementation therefore requires inputs from other sectors and line ministries. The NAIP uses a matrix structure composed of four Programs (rather generic and aligned to the NAP) and 16 Intervention Areas (IAs). The four Programs are: Program A: Policies, Institutions and Coordination for Results; Program B: Resilient Livelihoods and Agricultural Systems; Program C: Production and Productivity for Growth; and Program D: Markets, Value Addition, Trade and Finance for Transformation. The IAs cluster activities in technical areas that are needed to achieve the objectives of the NAIP and most of them are crosscutting, address different domains in the agri-food system, and target different stakeholder groups.

Policy: THE MANITOBA AGRICULTURAL SERVICES CORPORATION ACT (AgriInsurance Regulation 146/2018).
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes a production insurance program, as contemplated by the Act, for the purposes of providing insurance for the kinds of loss or damage described in subsection (2). The program is also known and sometimes referred to as "AgriInsurance" or the "AgriInsurance Program". Subject to subsection (2) and section 20 and the terms of the contract, the following are designated as perils for the purpose of this regulation: (a) big game; (b) disease; (c) drought; (d) excessive heat; (e) excessive moisture; (f) excessive rainfall; (g) fire; (h) flood; (i) frost; (j) hail; (k) pests; (l) waterfowl; (m) wind, including tornado; (n) winterkill. Subject to subsections (2), (3) and (4), a person may be eligible for insurance under this regulation if (a) the person is a qualified person; (b) in the cases of vegetable acreage loss insurance and pasture days insurance, the person is an eligible person; (c) the person is 18 years of age or older; and (d) the person, in the opinion of the corporation, is legally, operationally and financially independent of all other persons engaged in farming. The corporation may, in addition to the criteria set out in subsection (1), establish eligibility criteria as a basis for determining (a) whether a person is eligible for a contract of insurance; and (b) the coverage level for which an insured person qualifies. A qualified person who wishes to obtain insurance under this regulation must complete an application for insurance and submit it to the corporation, and (a) if the person wishes to obtain vegetable acreage loss insurance, must complete a vegetable acreage loss insurance application and submit it to the corporation; or (b) if the person wishes to obtain pasture days insurance, must complete a pasture days insurance application and submit it to the corporation. The corporation must not accept a vegetable acreage loss insurance application or pasture days insurance application from a qualified person unless the person has a contract of insurance.

Policy: Décrets n°2018-0005/P-RM du 10 janvier 2018 fixant les attributions spécifiques des membres du gouvernement.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les attributions spécifiques des membres du Gouvernement (Ministères).  Le ministre de l’Agriculture prépare et met en œuvre la politique nationale dans le domaine de l’agriculture. A ce titre, il est compétent pour : l’accroissement de la production et de la productivité agricoles en vue de la sécurité et de la souveraineté alimentaires ; la réalisation de travaux d’aménagements hydroagricoles, d’équipements ruraux et de maîtrise de l’eau, en rapport avec le ministre chargé du développement local ; la vulgarisation des techniques modernes de production agricole ; l’organisation de l’approvisionnement des producteurs agricoles en équipements, matériels, intrants et semences et l’amélioration de leur qualité en rapport avec le ministre chargé de l’industrie ; l’appui à la structuration, à l’organisation et à la formation des organisations de producteurs agricoles et des exploitations familiales; la mise en place de mécanismes d’accompagnement des unités de production agricole ; l’organisation, la diversification et la modernisation des filières et des circuits de commercialisation des productions agricoles en rapport avec le ministre chargé du commerce ; l’amélioration du cadre de vie des producteurs agricoles en milieu rural ; la contribution au développement et à la sécurisation de l’emploi rural salarié ; la gestion du foncier agricole, en rapport notamment avec les ministres chargés des affaires foncières, de l’administration du territoire et de l’aménagement du territoire ; la conservation et la restauration des sols cultivés ; la protection des cultures et la conservation des récoltes ; le développement de la recherche, de l’enseignement et de la formation dans le domaine de l’agriculture.

Policy: Order No. 4 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Administrative Regulation related to performance of state function by the Federal Subsoil Management Agency of state function for state expertise of deposits of minerals, geological, economic and ecological information related to plots of subsoil subject to allotment for subsoil management.
Policy_Content: This Administrative Regulation establishes the terms and sequence of administrative procedures (actions) of the Federal Subsoil Management Agency of state function for state expertise of deposits of minerals, geological, economic and ecological information related to plots of subsoil subject to allotment for subsoil management. The state service for the organization of the state expertise of deposits of minerals, geological, economic and ecological information on the subsoil areas to be provided for use shall be granted to the license holders for subsoil management and (or) work executors under a state contract for geological exploration of the subsoil and (or) (budgetary or autonomous) institutions under the jurisdiction of the Federal Subsoil Management Agency and performing arrangements for state geological exploration of subsoil in accordance with state assignment. Information related to the provision of the aforesaid state service shall be public. Provision of state service shall be performed by the authorized government bodies. The applicant shall file application containing the following information and data: (a) application in accordance with the form contained in the Annex 3; (b) documentation established by the Ministerial Decree No. 69 on state surveys of minerals and of geological, economic and ecological information regarding plots of land conceded in use, and on the amounts and collection modalities for charges related to the aforesaid surveys; (c) subsoil management license; (d) public contract for execution of works (in case of execution of such works); (e) state assignment (in case of execution of works by state assignment); (e) sanitary and epidemiological conclusion by the competent sanitary authority relate to compliance of groundwater quality with potable water requirements (in case of groundwater extraction for potable water supply); and (f) documentation envisaged by the Order No. 378 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Requirements for filing of materials related to exploration of solid minerals submitted for state expertise.

Policy: Decree No. 17 of the Cabinet of Ministers “On measures for the further improvement of regulation of import to and export from the Republic of Uzbekistan of ozone depleting substances and commodities containing them.
Policy_Content: Cabinet of Ministers, with a view to further improving he measures for state regulation of import into the Republic of Uzbekistan and export of ozone-depleting substances from the Republic of Uzbekistan and products containing them aimed at the implementation of the National Program for Stopping the Use of Ozone-Depleting Substances, and in accordance with the Commodity Nomenclature for Foreign Economic Activity of the Republic of Uzbekistan, the Cabinet of Ministers decrees to approve: (a) the list of types of ozone-depleting substances, import into the Republic of Uzbekistan and exports from the Republic of Uzbekistan of which shall be authorized with permits, in accordance with Annex No. 1; (b) the list of products, import to the Republic of Uzbekistan and export from the Republic of Uzbekistan of which, if ozone-depleting substances are contained in them, shall be authorized with permits, in accordance with Annex No. 2; (c) regulations on the procedure for the passage of licensing procedures for the import into the Republic of Uzbekistan and export from the Republic of Uzbekistan of ozone-depleting substances and products containing them, in accordance with Annex No. 3; (d) quotas for the import of ozone-depleting substances into the Republic of Uzbekistan for the period 2018 - 2030 in accordance with Annex No. 4; (e) regulations on the order of distribution of quotas for the import of ozone-depleting substances into the Republic of Uzbekistan in accordance with Appendix No. 5. Import of ozone-depleting substances listed in the Annex 6 shall be prohibited; import of refrigeration equipment and air conditioning installations using or dependent on ozone-depleting substances listed in Group I of List A and Group I of List C of the Annex No. 1 and Appendix No. 6 to this Resolution shall be prohibited. Regulation on licensing procedure sets forth authorization process for import to and export from the Republic of Uzbekistan of ozone-depleting substances and produce containing them. It shall not be applicable to natural persons importing produce containing ozone-depleting substances for individual non-commercial purposes. Regulation on distribution of quotas establishes the procedure for distribution of quotas for import and export of ozone-depleting substances among the applicants.

Policy: Regulation of the Minister of Marine and Fisheries of the R.I. No. 4/Permen-Kp/2018 on the National Strategic Area Plans for Maratua and Sambit Islands within East Kalimantan Province, 2018-2037.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of 80 articles divided into seven Chapters and several maps of the area, establishes Spatial planning of KSNT Maratua Island and Sambit Island. It aims to realize areas that serve for environmental protection that support sustainable fisheries and tourism activities; and a region that serves to support economic development for the welfare of the community. The Spatial Planning Policy aims to create environmentally responsible areas for supporting sustainable fisheries and tourism activities. RZ KSNT serves as a guideline for: a) preparation of development plans at KSNT; b) spatial use control in KSNT; c) realization of integration and harmony of development as well as cross-sectoral interests in KSNT and development plans with surrounding areas; and d. determination of location and function of space for investment in KSNT. Coverage of RZ KSNT consists of: land, covering the entire land area of ​​Maratua and Sambit Island, Berau District; the sea, covering the waters around Maratua Island and Sambit Island until up to 12 nautical miles measured from the coastline at the time of the lowest tide, except for: the territorial waters adjacent to another island in Kalimantan Province East which is within 24 miles.

Policy: Decree No. 13 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on access to protected areas.
Policy_Content: This Decree, with a view of regulation of recreational, ecological and other types of tourism in protected areas, validates Model Regulation on access to protected areas (Annex 1) and Regulation on collection of payment for access to protected areas (Annex 2). Model Regulation on access to protected areas establishes the terms and conditions for visiting complex (landscape) reserves, recreational, economic and other uses of natural parks (except for reserved areas), state nature monuments, reserves, natural nurseries and fisheries zones, third zones of natural healthcare areas, recreational zones , second and third zones of sanitary protection of water bodies, water protection zones, coastal strips, buffer and transition zones of state biosphere reserves (except for reserved areas). It shall be applicable also to terms and conditions for visiting part of the territory of conservation zones of state nature reserves transferred thereto for organization of ecological tourism. Access to protected areas shall be authorized for the following purposes: (a) recreation; (b) nature management; (c) cultural and aesthetic purposes, ecological education of the population; and (d) scientific research. Access of citizens to some protected areas can be subject to collection of payment on fee basis.

Policy: Resolución Nº 006-2018-ANA ─ Disposiciones que regulan el procedimiento de evaluación de los Formatos de la Autoridad Nacional del Agua en el marco del Instrumento de Gestión Ambiental para la Formalización de Actividades de Pequeña Minería y Minería Artesanal (IGAFOM).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba disposiciones que regulan el procedimiento de evaluación de los Formatos de la Autoridad Nacional del Agua (ANA) en el marco del Instrumento de Gestión Ambiental para la Formalización de Actividades de Pequeña Minería y Minería Artesanal (IGAFOM), que tienen por objeto regular el procedimiento de emisión de la opinión técnica favorable de ANA para la aprobación del IGAFOM. La opinión técnica estará referida a: 1) Acreditación de disponibilidad hidrica, cuando se considere el uso del agua en la actividad de pequeña minería o minería artesanal materia de formalización; 2) Evaluación del efecto ambiental del reuso, cuando se considere reutilizar las aguas residuales tratadas en la actividad minera; 3) Evaluación del efecto del vertimiento en el cuerpo receptor, cuando se considere disponer aguas residuales tratadas a un cuerpo de agua.

Policy: Regional Legislative Decree No. 1/2018/M approving the legal regime for mineral exploitation in the Autonomous Region of Madeira.
Policy_Content: This Regional Legislative Decree, consisting of 68 articles divided into ten Chapters and five Annexes, approves the legal regime for mineral exploitation and applies to the development of minerals, including research and exploration in the Autonomous Region of Madeira. Mineral exploitation activities are classified from 1 to 3, according to the environmental impact they may cause. Class 1 covers underground or mixed quarries having an area of more than 5 ha. Class 2 covers open pit quarries with an area of less than or equal to 5 ha using more than 2000 kg per year of explosives. Class 3 covers open pit quarries using explosives of up to 2000 kg per year. The exploration and exploitation of mineral areas may only be conducted under a research or exploration license, through the request of the interested party who owns the property. The declaration of public utility for the purpose of expropriation of the land necessary for the exploitation of mineral resources can only take place when, predictably, the future quarry exploitation may produce higher benefits to that resulting from the normal use of that land.
Subject: Land & soil, Mineral resources

Policy: Cabinet Resolution No.33 of 2018 on the circulation of used oils.
Policy_Content: This Resolution consisting of 19 articles aims at regulating the activities of the circulation of used oils and preventing them from polluting the environment or causing harm to public health. Its provisions shall apply to all used oils, including machinery, engine, hydraulic and gear oils, oils used for lubrication or any combination thereof, except for polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBS) which can not be remedied and may not be reused. The Resolution states that (i) it is prohibited to practice any activity related to the circulation of used oils without obtaining a license from the competent authority (the application for a license  shall be submitted to the competent authority); and (ii) to use the oils used for the production of energy in institutions, factories or houses it is necessary the prior written consent of the competent authority.

Policy: Décret n° 2018/001/PM du 05 janvier 2018 portant création d'une plateforme de dématérialisation dans le cadre des marchés publics et fixant ses règles d'utilisation.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée une plateforme de dématérialisation dans le cadre des marches publics et fixe ses règles d'utilisation. La dématérialisation se traduit par l’utilisation de la voie électronique pour les échanges qui interviennent dans le processus des marchés publics. C’est la substitution des documents physiques ou des procédures manuelles par des documents numériques ou des procédures automatiques. Policy: Legislative Decree 2 January 2018, n. 1 Civil Protection Code.
Policy_Content: The Civil Protection Code defines the scope and functions of the National Civil Protection Service. The scope is protecting life, physical integrity, property, settlements, animals and the environment from damage or danger of damage from events disasters of natural origin or deriving from human activity; its functions are those aimed at predicting, preventing, mitigating, and managing the risk of emergencies and overcoming them. Art. 7 defines the "Types of civil protection emergency events" as 1) events that can be managed by single administrations with ordinary powers, 2) events that require coordination of more than one administration and use of extraordinary powers 3) nationwide emergency events that requires the use of extraordinary measures and powers. A. 16 lists the types of risks that generally require intervention of Civil Protection, follow: seismic, volcanic, from tsunami, hydraulic, hydro geological, meteorological phenomena adverse, water deficit and forest fires, chemical, nuclear, radiological, technological, industrial, from transport, environmental, sanitation and uncontrolled return of objects and space debris. Section IV lays down the discipline for managing nationwide emergency events;  Art. 24 clarifies the process for a State of Emergency Declaration, Art. 25 identifies in the Chief of the Civil Protection Order the instrument that should be used in a situation of nationwide emergency ("to be adopted, notwithstanding any current provision of law and indicating sections and reasons that it derogates, in respect of the limits and formalities established by the Resolution declaring the state of emergency, in agreement with Region and Autonomous provinces), and the following articles set the discipline on budgeting and post emergency measures.

Policy: Cabinet Resolution No.187 of 2018 to regulate the General Organization for Irrigation.
Policy_Content: This Resolution consisting of 17 articles aims at regulating the Saudi Irrigation Organization, associated with the Minister of Environment, Water and Agriculture, which manages, operates, and develops irrigation activity in the Kingdom, also through contracts with specialized bodies to carry out some of its tasks. The Organization mainly undertakes the following specializations (i) prepare general policies, plans, and programs to develop irrigation activity and to conserve irrigation water and rationalize its use; (ii) utilize the available sources of conventional and non-conventional irrigation water; (iii) prepare irrigation scheduling programs for agricultural crops according to water regulations; (iv) develop and implement emergency plans for irrigation activity and to face water shortages; (v) propose draft laws, regulations and standards regulating irrigation activity; (vi) application of water quality standards used in agricultural irrigation, and monitoring the quality of irrigation water and agricultural soil; (vii) construct and maintain water supply sources for irrigation, such as dams, groundwater, and alternative sources; (viii) construct and maintain pumping stations and projects for transporting, storing, and distributing irrigation water; (ix) develop the approved techniques to monitor the consumption of irrigation water and ensure its compliance with the allocations and programs for the use of water; (x) conducting studies and research to improve irrigation methods, adopting modern technologies and rationalizing the use of irrigation water; (xi) provide programs to qualify human cadres working in this field; (xii) providing a database and statistical information on irrigation activity; and (xiii) conclude agreements and contracts related to irrigation with local and foreign authorities. The Organization shall have a board of directors headed by the Minister of Environment, Water and Agriculture. The Council is the main authority over its affairs, supervises its administration and conducts its affairs, and takes all decisions necessary to achieve its objectives.

Policy: Public Procurement and Disposal of Public Assets Act [Chapter 22:23], No. 5 of 2017
Policy_Content: The Act is meant to apply to all stages of the process of the procurement of goods, construction works and services by procuring entities and the disposal of public assets by procuring entities. Specifically, the Act does not apply to the procurement of services of fiscal agencies or depositary services, liquidation and management services for regulated financial institutions, services related to the sale, redemption and distribution of public debt and arbitration or conciliation services. The Act also does not apply to public employment contracts. The main objectives of the Act include to ensure that procurement is effected in a manner that is transparent, fair, honest, cost-effective and competitive; to promote competition among bidders; to provide for the fair and equitable treatment of all bidders, leading to procurement contracts that represent good value for money; to promote the integrity of, and fairness and public confidence in, procurement processes; and to secure the implementation of any environmental, social, economic and other policy that is authorized or required by any law to be taken into account by a procuring entity in procurement proceedings. The Act establishes the Procurement Regulatory Authority of Zimbabwe as a body corporate and charges it uphold the objectives of the Act. The Act places responsibility on each procuring entity to manage its procurement where the value of the procurement requirement is below the prescribed threshold. In some cases, the Act gives the procuring entity the responsibility to manage its procurement where the value of the procurement requirement is at or above the prescribed threshold. The Act mandates procurement entities to use only the standard bidding documents that are produced and issued by the Authority for the sake of procurements. The Act also provides for two methods of procurement, including competitive and restrictive bidding. Essentially, the Act provides that transparency and integrity shall be maintained throughout the procurement process.

Policy: Law No. 10.762 creating the State Policy to Encourage the Generation and Use of Solar Energy (Pró-Solar).
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the State Policy to Encourage the Generation and Use of Energy Solar - Pró-Solar, with the purpose of taking advantage of the solar potential of the State of Maranhão to rationalize the consumption of electric energy. This State Policy aims to carry out the following activities: increase the use of solar energy in the state; stimulate the implementation of solar energy systems and investments in this area, encompassing technological development and photovoltaic and photothermal generation, for commercial and self-consumption in urban and rural areas, by public and private initiative for residential, community, commercial, industrial and agricultural use; encourage the generation and use of photovoltaic energy in rural areas far from the electricity distribution network; transforming the State into a national reference for generation and consumption of solar energy; encourage the deployment of equipment, materials and components industries used in solar energy systems, providing employment and income generation; foster training programmes at all stages on the solar energy production chain; study on the application of the use of electric energy from solar energy; educational campaigns on the advantages of using solar energy; contribute to the reduction of greenhouse gas emission indices; etc.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 597 validating the Regulation on the State Supervision Service over Public Health and Social Protection of the Population.
Policy_Content: State Supervision Service over Public Health and Social Protection of the Population is the executive body of the state power of the Republic of Tajikistan, which performs the state supervision over medical activity and social protection of the population, pharmaceutical and sanitary-epidemiological activity in the Republic of Tajikistan. It exercises expertise, standardization, certification and supervision over quality compliance of food additives, mineral water, foodstuffs for special dietary uses and infant food. It takes part in mitigation of the consequences of natural and ecological disasters that represent risks for human life and health.

Policy: Arrêté n°2017-4388/MTFP-SG du 29 décembre 2017 complétant la liste des travaux dangereux interdits aux enfants .
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté modifie l’arrêté n°09-0151/MTFPRE-SG du 04 février 2009 complétant la liste des travaux dangereux interdits aux enfants de moins de 18 ans. Les activités interdites aux enfants concernent entre autres des activités agricoles, pastorales, agroforestières; pêches ; mines. Une liste détaillée de ces travaux est annexée à ce texte.
